Rita en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como pinturas, tela para lienzos, pinceles y marquetería, para la elaboración de sus lienzos artisticos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y con la educación de sus hijos, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Rita pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Rita continues her craft work, creating and selling oil paintings. She is currently requesting a loan to buy materials including paint, canvas clothes, brushes,and marquetry in order to create her paintings. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her work and improve her children's educations. She promises to make her payments on time. Rita belongs to the Kukuli communal bank, which is in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy materials including paint, canvas clothes, brushes, and marquetry

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a 43-year-old and married with 5 children who are in school. Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, eggs, etc.

In the future, Michelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 36-year-old single business woman. She runs a salon business and has been in operation for seven years earning KES 9,000 monthly.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD of KES 30,000 and she plans to use it to purchase weaves, braids, relaxers and hair oil for resale.

With the anticipated profits she plans to open another salon. Her hope and dreams is that her business prospers so she can earn more profits and open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Isnaida

texts.en:
Isnaida is 26 years old and married with one child.

Isnaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Isnaida has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from charcoal and vegetable retail sales.

Isnaida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Virginia has been in this business for 30 years. Virginia earns additional income from her general store.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 44 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Elna is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Elna has been buying and selling livestock for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 63 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y cordial en su trato con las personas. Está casada con Máximo quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Julia es la comercialización de abarrotes, artículos de librería, medicamentos y otros, para esto abrió una pequeña bodega en su propia casa, desde donde atiende las necesidades de sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes, a los que atiende muy amablemente. También vende golosinas y bebidas gasificadas en su bodega.
Se inició hace más de 8 años logrando hacerse muy conocida por las zonas que oferta sus productos y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.
Considera su negocio rentable porque casi siempre acaba todo lo que lleva para vender, dejándole buenas ganancias. Antes de empezar con su negocio tenía dificultades económicas ya que los alimentos suben  de precios constantemente y los ingresos de su esposo no les alcanzaban para cubrir todos sus gastos, por eso quiso apoyarlo generándose sus propios ingresos económicos.
Por tanto, viendo lo bien que le resulta su negocio, desea continuar y mantenerlo. Este es el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta con  un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. También comenta que se siente a gusto con banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en su negocio comprando abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, aceites, entre otros, y golosinas, buscando aumentar su capital con las ganancias de las ventas, por eso espera conseguir precios cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Julia, 63, is a hardworking, enterprising woman besides being cheerful and treating others kindly.  She’s married to Máximo who is a merchant and the father of their children who are all independent adults now.  They all live comfortably in their own house.  
 
Julia’s activity is selling groceries, stationery supplies, medicine and others.  To do so, she opened a small home-based store where she tends to her neighbors’ needs who are her main customers and who she tends to kindly.  She also sells sweets and carbonated beverages in her store.  She started more than 8 years ago and has succeeded in making herself very well-known in the areas because of her product offerings; to date she’s been working alone.

She considers her business to be profitable because she almost always sells out everything she brings to sell earning good profits.  Before starting her business she had economic difficulties because the price of food constantly rises and her husband’s income was insufficient to cover all expenses and that’s why she wanted to help him by earning income of her own.

Because of this, seeing the good results her business has, she wants to continue and keep it in operation.  This will be MFP loan #13 so she now has a small loan to be able to reach her objectives.  She commits once more to make her installment payments like she’s done with her previous loans.  She also comments that she feels comfortable in her communal bank because she considers it to be a united, supportive group.

She will use the requested 1200 new soles to invest in her business buying groceries in general like rice, sugar and oil, among others and also sweets hoping to increase her capital though profits from sales.  She therefore hopes to get good prices because of her volume purchases.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and sweets, among others.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retail. Emma is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through the past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 36 years old and married with two children.

Marisol works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Marisol has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retail and food vending.

Marisol aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buying and selling of rice grains business.

Rosalia has been in this business for 15 years. Rosalia earns more income from general store.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Charito is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 41 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. Evalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Evalyn has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, snack foods, soap, etc.

In the future, Evalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her restaurant business.

Josie has been in this business for 8 years. Josie earns more income from pig fattening.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 59-year-old who is married with 7 children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourdes has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marhabokhon

texts.ru: Мархабохон молодая  девушка и полна позитивными энергиями. Ей 18 лет и она еще не замужем. Мархабохон живет с родителями. Она с отличными оценками окончила среднюю школу и успешно поступила в медицинский колледж. Ее родители хотят, чтобы Мархабохон стала хорошим медиком, но они не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебу в колледже. Мархабохон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в колледже. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Marhabokhon is a young woman who is full of positive energy. She is 18 and not yet married. Marhabokhon lives with her parents
She graduated from high school with honors and was accepted to a medical college. Her parents want her to become a skilled medical worker, but they can't pay her tuition. Marhabokhon has requested a loan to pay her tuition. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her tuition

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante y triunfar en la vida. Es conviviente con Segundo quien es médico y es el padre de su único  hijo, con quienes habita una casa propia y los quiere mucho y son su motivación para trabajar  buscando brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad que realiza Liz es la venta de fármacos y demás productos de salud, para eso cuenta con una botica que abrió en un espacio acondicionado en su propia casa, ahorrándose más gastos de alquiler. Se inició con el negocio hace más de 05 año y contando con el apoyo de su pareja quien le apoyó con el capital que le faltaba para  comprar la mercadería necearía, viendo la necesidad de los vecinos de la zona, donde muchas veces no cuentan con los medicamentos para sus dolencias. 
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la regular clientela que tiene. 
Antes de tener su negocio, se encontraba en apuros económicos, ya que su familia crecía de manera muy rápida con la llegada de sus trillizos y los gastos crecieron,  ya no les alcanzaba con sus ingresos, buscando alternativas de solución, se decidieron por ese negocio, que ahora les va bien y les ha sacado de muchos apuros económicos. Por tanto, tienen planes de continuar y hacerlo crecer adquiriendo más mercaderías para así tener un stock disponible para la venta. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Esta muy contenta de saber que cuenta con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a cumplir  con el pago de sus cuotas y tener un buen record crediticio para en el futuro tener acceso a más créditos. Por otro lado, comenta que se siente a gusto con el trabajo de su banco comunal por el apoyo que viene brindando a las personas que lo necesitan.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de productos de farmacia como medicamentos, pastillas, y otros, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen y así brindar precios más bajos a sus clientes apoyándoles en sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Liz is 29 years old.  She is a hard-working and earnest woman who has a great desire to get ahead and be successful in life.  She lives with Segundo, who is a doctor and the father of her only son.  She lives with them in her own house and she loves them very much.  Her motivation is to work and to offer them the best quality of life.

Liz makes a living selling pharmacy products and other health products from a drugstore that she opened in a specially-created area of her own house, which saves on rent.  She started the business more than 5 years ago and relies on her husband who supported her with the capital she needed to buy the necessary merchandise for her neighbors in the area, where they often cannot count on the medicine needed for their ailments.

She considers her business profitable due to strong earnings and regular clientele.  Before starting the business, she found herself in financial straits, as her family grew very rapidly with the arrival of triplets and expenses exceeded her income.  She looked for a solution and decided on this business which right now is going well and has eliminated many of her financial difficulties.  For this reason, she has plans to continue with the business and buy more merchandise so that she will have available inventory to sell.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she can count on the line of credit to advance her business.  For this reason she promises to complete her payments and have a good credit record so that she will have more access to credit in the future.  She also says that she feels good about the work of her communal bank and for the support they offer to people who need it.

With the amount she is asking (1200 nuevos soles), she will invest in the purchase of pharmacy products like medicine, pills and others, seeking out the best wholesale prices so she can offer her customers the lowest prices and support their needs.

loans.use: to buy pharmacy products such as medicines and pills.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amancaes Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal AMANCAES; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Vilma, la socia tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de hostal, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  a su negocio, su hostal se encuentra ubicado por el centro de la ciudad a la vez la socia vende paquetes turisticos como city tours,valle sagrado entre otros a sus huespedes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,a la vez la socia es docente de profesión, ella trabaja y administra su negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de un par de camas para su hostal.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de llamadas locales, turismo, profesionales como profesores, contadora, terramoza, odontóloga, músico.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y la socia que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The community bank, "AMANCAES," (whose members are pictured above) is located in the Wanchaq district in the province and department of Cusco.

Vilma is a member of the community bank, and is 52 years old. She has two children, and she operates a hostel located in the center of the city. Thanks to her hard work, business is going well. Vilma also sells tourism packages, including tour options for: the city of Cusco, the Sacred Valley, and other popular destinations that her guests request. Vilma is a responsible, earnest person who is a teacher by profession, and who is motivated to support her family and to provide a better life for them.

Vilma plans to use the support from this loan to purchase a pair of beds for her hostel.

The other group members work in various trades, including: tourism, teaching, accounting, dentistry and music.

The group members who appear in the separate, smaller photos are those who had to arrive late to the meeting on the day the group photo was taken. The woman whose face is covered by a white oval is not a member of the community bank.

Vilma is very grateful for the support she has received, and promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of beds for her hostel.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, de 65 años es una mujer valiente y emprendedora.  Tuvo 7 hijos a quienes brindó educación y crianza hasta que ellos pudieron ser independientes.  Vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Arturo quien le brinda  las fuerzas para seguir  trabajando mucho y así brindarse mutuamente  una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Maria consiste en la venta de ropas usadas de toda variedad para damas, caballeros y niños para toda ocasión. Toda su mercadería la compra en el centro comercial de  su ciudad por fardos y lo lleva a vender por l zonas y distritos alejados. 
Se inició en ésta actividad por la idea e iniciativa de su esposo hace más de 5 años, quien la apoya en todo, viendo que es fácil y rentable decidió continuar  y hasta el momento le está hiendo muy bien.  
Considera  rentable su negocio ya que le genera muchos ingresos económicos. 
Aunque su trabajo a veces le resulta un poco pesado por los viajes que realiza y  porque tiene que cargar a veces su mercadería ella sola,  pero sabe que debe que esforzarse al máximo para poder tener mejores ganancias.  A pesar que vende mucho, a ella le gustaría  tener mayores ganancias y vender en mayor volumen. Por eso,  desea seguir trabajando y  hacer crecer su negocio. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, por tanto cuenta de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete una vez más a cumplir con sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de ropas usadas en fardos buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera desea obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 65, is a brave, enterprising woman.  She had seven children who she educated and raised until they were able to become independent.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Arturo, who gives her the strength to continue working much to provide each other with better quality of life.  María’s work consists in selling all varieties of all-occasion used clothes for women, men and children.  She buys all her merchandise by the bundle in a shopping center in the city and then takes it to sell in distant zones and districts.  She started this activity thanks to an idea and initiative of her husband’s five years ago; he supports her in everything.  Seeing how easy and profitable it was, she decided to continue and to date has been doing very well.  She considers her business to be profitable because it generates much income.

Although her work sometimes is heavy because of the trips she makes and because sometimes she has to carry the merchandise by herself, she knows she must strive to the maximum degree to earn higher profits.  Even though she sells much, she’d still like to earn higher profits and to sell in larger volume.  Because of this she wants to continue working and making business grow.

This is MFP loan #3 so she’ll have support to reach her objectives.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very kind, supportive people.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy larger amounts of bundles of used clothes seeking the lowest prices by buying in volume.  In this way, she hopes to have higher profit margins.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  Leonora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio tiene 37 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador, está casado con la señora Nelida hace 10 años, con quien tiene un hermoso hijo, por quien luchan incansablemente, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
El señor Julio trabaja de mototaxista desde hace 5 años y cuenta que es sacrificado, pero que le gusta mucho, porque por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su esposa e hijo. Su sueño es comprar otra parada y otra moto para trabajar y así progresar cada día más. Está muy contento por la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva y solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su moto, para que de esa forma siga trabajando y también de un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julio is 37 years old. He is a very hardworking man, he has been married with Nelida for 10 years and they have a beautiful child whom they constantly make efforts for. They live in the town of Coronel Oviedo.
Julio has been a moto taxi* driver for 5 years and he has told us that his job is demanding but he likes it very much because through this job he can support his wife and his child. He dreams of buying another taxi stand and another moto taxi to work with in order to progress a little more every day. He is very happy for the chance he is offered by Fundación Paraguaya and by Kiva, and he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his moto taxi so that he will be able to keep on working, offering a good service to his customers at the same time.

<cite>*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Carolina Raquel

texts.es: Carolina de 23 años de edad, es una joven madre responsable y trabajadora quien vive junto a su esposo y un hijo de siete años de edad el cual se dedica a estudiar. Para salir adelante junto a su familia y contar con una mejor vida, Carolina se dedica a comercializar productos de belleza como: perfumes, cremas, shampoo, tratamientos para el cabello y otros más, los cuales comercializa en su casa de habitación y así mismo para aumentar sus ventas, las comercializa haciendo visitas de casa en casa. Carolina solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y cuidado personal y así mismo incluir productos nuevos como ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, lo que le permitiría aumentar su margen de ganancias lo que sería muy positivo para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en: Carolina is 23 years old and she is a responsible and hardworking young mother who lives with her husband and her seven-year-old child who goes to school. In order to progress in life together with her family, and to achieve a better standard of living, Carolina engages in selling beauty products such as perfumes, creams, shampoos, hair treatments and many more. She sells them in her house and she also sells them door-to-door to increase her earnings. Carolina is requesting a loan because she wishes to buy a bigger quantity of beauty and personal care products, also including new products such as children’s clothes, men’s clothes and women’s clothes: this will allow her to improve her earnings, something that would be very positive for the maintenance of her household.

loans.use: To buy beauty and personal care products,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Rosmery

texts.es: Doña Rosmery  quien tiene 3 hijos de 18, 17 y 14 años de edad,   su hijo mayor estudia su carrera universitaria,  la segunda  en nivel diversificado y el más pequeño  este año termina   su estudio a nivel básico, doña Rosmery  viendo las diversas necesidades de sus hijos inicio hace 4 años con la venta de refacciones en varios establecimientos educativos, gracias a lo que ella gana ha podido ayudar en  parte al sustento de sus hijos como en  sus necesidades de estudio, doña Rosmery está solicitando este crédito para la compra de carnes, panes, gaseosas, azúcar, aceite etc. Doña Rosmey cuenta con un pequeño local en el mercado de San Juan Sacatepequez donde ella desde muy temprano prepara  panes con pollo, con chao min, frijoles, atol, refrescos y licuados,  luego llevárselos a los alumnos  que  la conocen y   buscan de sus servicios todos los días mientras reciben sus clases, doña Rosmery tiene el deseo de seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y verlos como personas de éxitos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Rosmery has three children who are 18, 17 and 14 years of age.  Her oldest son attends university, her daughter attends high-school and her youngest son is finishing basic level.  

Seeing the various needs her children had, Rosmery started four years ago to sell snacks at various schools.  Thanks to her earnings she’s been able to partly help support her children’s education.  

Rosmery is asking for this loan to buy meat, bread, soft-drinks, sugar, oil, etc.  She has a small stand in the San Juan Sacatepequez market where she starts to make bread with chicken, chow-mein, beans, atol [corn and milk based drink], beverages and blended drinks very early to then take to students who know her and seek out her services daily while attending classes.  Rosmery wants to continue supporting her children’s schooling and see them become successful people in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread, soft-drinks, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Manuela works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Manuela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Manuela has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to have her children finish their studies in college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a fish vendor from Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for fifteen years now. Maria supports her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

As of this time, she is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell to the people in the neighborhood. With this, she will be able to augment her daily earnings.

Maria hopes to make her business a success and save money for the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Greysi Stefania

texts.es:
Greysi es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pequeño hijo de 4 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Greysi no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta instruirse en internet y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Tallarines para compartir con su familia. 
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Greysi puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Greysi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: shampoo, perfumes, maquillaje, cremas, entre otros artículos de belleza; de esta manera Greysi tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco le servirán de mucho para poder ampliar su negocio y con ello espera lograr su gran sueño de poder dar inicio a sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Greysi, 22, lives in the city of Ica, Santiago District, with her little 4-year-old son who she loves and is her main reason for living.   She is a very kind, hardworking person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Unfortunately, Greysi was unable to study business administration but would have liked to do so very much.  In her free time she likes learning via Internet and sometimes cooks a delicious “Tallarines” to share with her family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, Greysi started a small business selling beauty products.  She starts work every day very early in the morning and can work up to ten hours daily.  She believes she does well because of her dedication and because of the kind way she treats her customers.

Greysi is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy merchandise like shampoo, perfume, make-up and creams, among other beauty products.  In this way, Greysi will have her business better stocked hoping to increase sales and income which will gradually help her expand the business and eventually reach her great dream of starting her professional studies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dora Matilde

texts.es: Dora Matilde de 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y una hija menor de edad. Dora posee la habilidad de coser, y es gracias a este oficio que ella posee su propio negocio, ella elabora cortinas y manteles en su casa de habitación lo cual posteriormente vende ya sea promocionándolas con sus familias y amigas y de este mismo modo las vende de forma ambulante. Dora solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL,  por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de diferentes tipos de tela ya sea para cortinas para la sala, habitaciones o cocinas, todos en distintos colores y estampados. Así también desea comprar hilos de distintos colores para producir más cortinas y manteles de modo que pueda percibir más ganancias.
texts.en:
Dora Matilde is 55 years old and lives with her husband and a minor daughter. Dora has sewing skills and this trade allows her to have her own business. She makes curtains and tablecloths at home, which she later sells either marketing to her family and friends or on the street. 

Dora is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can invest in purchasing different types of curtain fabric for living rooms, bedrooms, and kitchens, all in different colors and patterns. She also wants to buy different color thread in order to make more curtains and obtain higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making curtains to sell.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes' group is composed of three hardworking women. Agnes is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. 

For the past three years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  tomatoes, onions, potatoe and plantain.

loans.name: Roxana Marina

texts.es:
Roxana es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde pequeña aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres eran muy humildes y tuvo que aprender a trabajar para poder apoyarlos con los gasto del hogar, por ese motivo ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser Chef. Es madre de una hija, la cual estudia la carrera de Odontología y por quien trabaja muy duro para que sea una profesional y sobre todo sea mejor que ella. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. Este distrito se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores, los cuales también son personas muy luchadoras, asimismo este distrito tiene un clima cálido y posee atractivos turísticos como el bosque de piedras. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear con su hija y en ocasiones comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”.

Día a día Roxana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida por las mañanas y en por las noches vende postres, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 50 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buen sazón y sobre todo mucha amabilidad y carisma para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Roxana agradece a los prestatarios Kiva por la ayuda que le han brindado ya que con este gran apoyo ella podrá comprar los materiales necesarios para los estudios de su hija como moldes, equipo quirúrgico, entre otros, de esta manera su hija podrá tener los materiales necesarios y seguirá estudiando y Roxana seguirá luchando para ver hecho realidad su más grande sueño:” Ver hecha una profesional a su hija”.
texts.en:
Roxana’s a very hardworking woman who learned how to earn her daily bread with the sweat from her brow while still a little girl because her parents were very humble and she had to learn to work to help them with household expenses.  Because of this she only attended secondary school but would have loved to study to become a chef. 

She is the mother of a daughter who is studying to become a dentist and she works very hard so that she can become a professional and above all be better than her.  Her house is located in Parcona District in Ica, Peru.  This district is noted for the kindness of its residents who are very tenacious people.  This district also has a hot climate and many tourist attractions like the Stone Forest.  When she has free time she enjoys going out with her daughter and sometimes to eat one of her favorite dishes the delicious “Arroz con Pollo.” [Chicken with Rice]

Roxana works day to day in her small food sales business in the morning and at night sells desserts.  She works about 10 hours per day and can see up to 50 customers per day.  She believes she does well in her business because she makes tasty dishes and above all because of the kindness and charisma she has for her customers.

Roxana thanks Kiva lenders for the support they’ve given her because with this great support she will be able to buy the materials like molds and surgical equipment, among others, needed by her daughter for her courses.  In this way her daughter will have the necessary materials to continue with her studies and Roxana will continue striving to see her greatest dream become a reality: to see her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: to buy educationl supplies for her daughter.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es: La socia es la señora Yony, ella continúa con su actividad comercial artesanal, en la compra y venta de artesanías, principalmente de elementos decorativos como imagineria en telas y tejidos y los comercializa en su propio establecimiento y tambien a los diferentes mercados artesanales de la ciudad. Yony en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material como telas e hilos , por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Yony pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Yony continues to operate her craft business, and also buys and sells decorative handicrafts, including many woven, handmade items. She sells many of the crafts from her own business location, as well as in other craft markets around the city.

Yony is requesting this loan in order to invest in her business and purchase craft materials such as fabrics and thread. She is very grateful for this opportunity to develop and grow her business, and she promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time. Yony is a member of the community bank, "KUKULI," which is located in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase craft materials, including fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: La socia es la señora María Virginia, ella continúa con su actividad comercial que es la venta de productos de belleza como cosméticos en general y perfumería, productos que distribuye de forma directa y a solicitud, a sus clientes que en su mayoría son público femenino. María Virginia en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como maquillaje, cosméticos en general y perfumes, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. María Virginia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Maria Virginia.  She continues in her commercial activity which is the sale of beauty products such as general cosmetics and perfumes, products that she distributes directly and through orders.  Most of her customers are women.

Maria Virginia is now requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as make-up, general cosmetics and perfumes.  The member is very thankful to Kiva for helping her get ahead in her activity.  She promises to make her payments punctually.  

Maria Virginia belongs to the communal bank "KUKULI" of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy general cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es: Fidel Antonio de 58 años de edad, es una persona muy experimentada en el trabajo que realiza, por lo que cuenta con muy buenas referencias y varios clientes, él vive junto a su esposa, quien es su mayor aliciente para salir adelante. Fidel posee un taller automotriz donde se dedica a hacer reparaciones de automóviles, chequeos frecuentes entre otros trabajos más, desde hace veinte años que Fidel posee este taller por lo que es muy conocido por ser responsable y trabajador, lo que le permite tener ganancias aceptables. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar herramientas nuevas para elaborar su trabajo, así también para comprar repuestos pequeños y así realizar más trabajos. Fidel desea salir adelante y contar con mayores ganancias que sean de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Fidel Antonio is 58 years old.  He is very experienced in the work that he does, and because of this he has many good references and various customers.  He lives together with his wife who is his biggest incentive to get ahead.

Fidel has an automotive workshop where he works repairing cars, doing tune-ups and other work.  For twenty years Fidel has had this workshop and he is well known for being responsible and hardworking, which permits him to make an acceptable income.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy new tools for his work and also to buy small spare parts and thus to complete more jobs.  Fidel wants to get ahead and have better earnings, which would be very helpful in maintaining his home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to stock his workshop.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Geraldine hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is 27 years old and married with two children. He is in the business of selling green tea leaves. He has been in operation for the last year earning a monthly income of 7,000 KES. He has applied for a first loan of 10,000 KES with KADET. He will use it to purchase green tea leaves for resale. He plans to use the profits to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dream is to venture into selling tea leaves wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Las Viky Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Vicky lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Alexandra quien tiene un recorrido escolar y tiene una tipo cafetería en el microbús donde vende desde refrescos, reposterías, pan…etc. ella con el préstamo desea invertir en más variedad de productos.
Tiene tres hijos de 18, 8 y 9 años los cuales estudian el mayor ya trabaja.
Las otras integrantes son Idania de 35 años y Reyna de 30 las cuales también tienen el mismo tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
The Viky Group is composed of three working women entrepreneurs.  One of them is Alexandra who has a cafeteria-style minibus route which sells everything from soft drinks, pastries, bread ... etc.  She wants to invest the loan in more inventory and more variety of products.

She has three children aged 18, 8 and 9 years. The younger two are studying and the oldest one already works.  

The other members of the group are Idania, 35 years old, and Reyna who is 30.  They both also have the same type of business.

loans.use: to buy products to sell on their cafeteria bus routes ... especially soft drinks, pastries and bread ... etc.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever de 23 años de edad, es un joven  trabajador; vive solo en un cuarto alquilado, alejado de su familia, ya que su mayor anhelo es salir adelante para tener un buen futuro. Ever, se dedica al transporte en taxi; su labor es movilizar pasajeros de Distrito a Distrito; al movilizarse demora media hora para llegar a su destino y le gusta llevar cómodamente a sus pasajeros escuchando música o conversando sobre la visita que realizan sus pasajeros. Su trabajo lo lleva realizando durante 05 años, gracias a sus padres y a su trabajo compró su propio auto; comenta que empezó a los 19 años y siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad, ya que es lo que mas le gusta. Sin embargo durante las horas de la tarde (08 a 09 de la noche), a veces no hay mucho pasajero y tiene que regresar con 02 pasajeros o a veces tiene que esperar hasta el día siguiente para seguir laborando. Con el préstamo que obtuvo de los financieros  comprará repuestos para su auto y de esa manera seguirá continuando con sus planes de trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es comprar otra movilidad para seguir ejerciendo su trabajo. Este es su crédito número 01, se siente muy agradecido por la confianza que le brindan; asimismo se compromete a se puntual con sus cuotas de pago y no quedar mal con los socios de su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará repuestos para su auto.
texts.en:
Ever is 23 years old, and lives in one rented room, far from his family. As a hardworking young man, Ever's main dream is to get ahead and create a better future for himself. He makes a living as a taxi driver transporting passengers between districts. The commute usually takes half an hour, so Ever likes to make sure his passengers are comfortable during the ride by playing music or chatting with them. He has been working as a taxi driver for five years now (since he was 19), and he really enjoys his work. Thanks to his parents and money he had worked to save, Ever was able to buy his own car for transporting his passengers. Typically, during the evening hours (between 8:00 and 9:00 at night), there aren't many passengers looking for a ride, so Ever often has to wait longer to make trips with even two customers. Sometimes, he has to wait until the next day to continue working.

With the 1,000 nuevos soles of support from this, his first loan, Ever plans to purchase replacement parts for his car, so that he can continue with his taxi business. His dream is to eventually buy another vehicle to expand his operation. He is very grateful for the support he has received, and promises to make all scheduled repayments on time and make an effort to get to know his fellow group members.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for his car.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La socia es la señora María Luisa, ella se dedica a su actividad comercial que es la compra y venta de Artesanías, principalmente de elementos y joyas en plata y cerámica, productos que comercializa en uno de los principales mercados artesanales y turísticos de la ciudad. María Luisa en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como joyería en plata y adornos cerámicos, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. María Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member is Maria Luisa.  She works in the handicraft trade, mostly in the areas of silver jewelry and ceramics, products that are sold in one of the main handicraft and tourist markets of the city.

Maria Luisa is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as silver jewelry and ceramic decorations.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her activity.  She promises to make her payments punctually.

Maria Luisa belongs to the communal bank "KUKULI" of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as silver jewelry and ceramic decorations.

loans.name: Evelyn    Achieng

texts.en: Evelyn is 35 years old and a mother of two children who are in school. She does poultry farming to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of owning a poultry farm in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy chicken feed and chicks.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
Unidas son un buen grupo llamado así por que sus integrantes son muy unidas, además de ser buenas amigas.

Ángeles es una de las integrantes del grupo, es una señora muy responsable de 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 17 años; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en mercados rodantes y el crédito le ayudara para surtir playeras y gorras para caballero.

Una meta muy importante para Ángeles es superarse y llegar a vender muchas mas cosas para en un futuro poder hacerse de su propio local.

Ángeles nos cuenta que todas sus compañeras son muy buenas y además de tener mucho tiempo de conocerlas, todas son muy buenas cumpliendo con sus pagos.
texts.en:
"Unidas" is a good group, and it's called that because its members are very united and they're also good friends.
Ángeles is one of the members of the communal bank. She's a very responsible lady who's 42 years old. She's married and has two children aged 12 and 17. She sells new clothing in traveling markets, and the loan will help her stock up with gentlemen's t-shirts and caps.
Ángeles has a very important goal, which is to improve herself and eventually sell much more things, so that in the future she can own her own store.
Ángeles tells us that all her fellow members are very nice. She's known them for a very long time and what's more, they're all very good at making their repayments.

loans.use: to purchase gentlemen's t-shirts and caps.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is 44 years old and single with two children. She has been in the cereals business for the last four years, earning approximately KES.7,500 monthly. 

She has applied for her first loan of  KES.15,000 from  KADET LTD, and plans to use it for purchasing dry maize and beans for resale. 

With the anticipated profits, she plans to repay her loan and will use the remaining amount for running her business. She hopes to take care of her children’s needs and education.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
This is Jorge, 57, a resident of Manila, Philippines. He is single and he manages his own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.  

Jorge is a rice dealer. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by sacks or by kilo. He store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,800 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of rice for his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jorge hopes to grow his business in the coming years and he hopes to have a good life through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of rice needed in his business.

loans.name: Dúo San Raymundo Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN RAYMUNDO
Este dúo lo forma doña Lorena quien nos cuenta que es casada y tiene 3 hijos, y es dueña de una tienda que está ubicada a la salida de San Raymundo, está solicitando este crédito porque necesita invertir un poco más en su tienda ya que a veces el producto que tiene no le alcanza para la semana y compra en otro lado en donde le sale más caro, y ahora quiere comprar directamente con los vendedores que pasan una vez a la semana, además se acerca el mes de septiembre y las ventas incrementan en ese tiempo y por eso necesitan invertir para seguir incrementando sus ganancias, está solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Lorena is one of the members of Duo San Raymundo.  She is married and has three children.  She is the owner of a shop that is located on the outskirts of San Raymundo.

She is seeking this loan so she can invest a little more in her shop.  At times she runs out of her products during the middle of the week and has to go to the other side of the city to buy products, where things are more expensive.  She wants to be able to purchase directly from the vendors who pass through once per week. 

Further, it is now September and sales increase during this time,  so she needs to invest so that she can keep increasing her earnings. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase groceries for resale.

loans.use: She will use the loan proceeds to purchase groceries for resale.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 43, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Protacio, a seaman, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Arlene sells RTW (ready to wear) products like towels, bed sheets, shower curtains and blankets to her customers. She has a stall in the market which makes her products easily seen by customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of personal merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Arlene dreams to be able to give all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Peter  Kinuthia

texts.en: Peter is 63 years old and a hardworking father of four children.  For five years, he has been operating a general store to earn a living. He operates his business in a high-traffic area. In addition, he does horticultural farming to supplement his income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to grow his business. With the additional income, he was able to purchase a piece of land. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy bundles of sisal ropes to sell.

loans.use: To buy bundles of sisal ropes to sell

loans.name: Dúo Jireh Group

texts.es: Dúo Jireh, Al ser integrada por las señoras Rufina de 43 años de edad, quien es  madre soltera y una mujer  muy trabajadora, doña Rufina  líder de este grupo quien se ha dedicado al comercio desde hace 9 años,  con lo cual ha salido adelante gracias a Dios y al esfuerzo de todos los días, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su hija de 18 años,  ambas desde  las 5 de la mañana viajan  a la escuela de la localidad donde ofrecen  a los niños antes  del ingreso a clases, útiles escolares,  golosinas, calcomanías,   también  cuenta con la venta de  calzado para dama, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercaderia en útiles escolares,  golosinas, calcomanías etc.
texts.en: "Dúo Jireh" is comprised of ladies. Rufina is 43 years old. She's a single mother and a very hardworking woman. Rufina is the leader of this communal bank and she has been in the retail business for 9 years. Through her business she has gotten ahead, thanks to God and to her everyday efforts. She gets help from her 18-year-old daughter. Starting at 5 a.m., they both travel to the town's school, where they offer school supplies, snacks and stickers to the children before classes begin. She also sells ladies' footwear. She requests this loan in order to purchase more merchandise such as school supplies, snacks, stickers, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as school supplies, snacks, stickers, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo  se puede apreciar paisajes hermosos y una flora y fauna muy linda, también podemos encontrar muchos platos típicos de la zona y uno de los más conocidos es el riquísimo Juane. Al lado de Juan vive su esposa a quien quiere muchísimo y fruto de ese amor tienen un hijo de 11 años de edad, el cual se encuentra estudiando en la escuela primaria y por el cual trabaja mucho y se esfuerza para poder ofrecerle una vida digna y con mucho amor. 

Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho reunirse con su familia y degustar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Tallarín con Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Forestal.
Día a día Juan trabaja en su negocio de compra y venta de chatarra,  el recorre por las calles de su ciudad en busca de los clientes y trabaja alrededor de 7 horas al día; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene muy buenos precios y por sus amabilidad y carisma con los clientes.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han enviado a los prestatarios Kiva el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio y de esta manera tener más productos para ofrecer, asimismo sus ingresos mejoraran y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes”.
texts.en:
Juan is 52 years old and he lives in Pucallpa, a town renowned for its hot and welcoming climate where one can find wonderful landscapes and beautiful animals and plants; here one can also taste many typical dishes of the area, the delicious “juane”* being one of the most famous. Juan lives with his wife whom he loves very much; they have one child aged 11, who is attending primary school and for whom he works very hard, making efforts to succeed in granting him a dignified life also rich in love.

Whenever he has some free time, he likes getting together with his family to taste one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “tallarín con pollo”. Because of his meager economic resources he has been able to study only up to the fourth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to study Environmental Engineering.

Day by day Juan runs his activity, buying and selling scrap metal. He travels along the streets of his town looking for customers and he works around 7 hours a day. He thinks things are going well with his job because his prices are very good, because of his charisma and because of the kindness he treats his customers with.

Juan is deeply grateful to Kiva Lenders, as thanks to the help received form Kiva Lenders he will buy more products for his activity: in this way he will have more products to sell and his earning will improve, so that he will keep on engaging himself in making his biggest dreams come true: “Providing a good education to his child and owing a general store”.

<cite>*“Juane” is rice, hen's meat, olives, boiled eggs and spices enveloped in a leaf of bijao and boiled for around 90 minutes.</cite>
<cite>**“Tallarín con pollo” is chicken noodles.</cite>

loans.use: To buy more scrap metal.

loans.name: Milagros Zoraida

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 21 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora y sobre todo on muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde muy pequeña aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres eran muy humildes y en ocasiones lo que ganaban no alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar y por ello trabajaba para ayudarlos.  Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee playas hermosas y sus pobladores tienen un don para la preparación de platillos ya que les sale de manera muy deliciosa. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho leer y en ocasiones disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Pollo a la Braza”.

Con mucho entusiasmo Milagros trabaja como secretaria en una institución de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo por las noches estudia la carrera de derecho; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y sobre todo por su responsabilidad.

Milagros está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá costear los gastos de sus estudios como matricula, mensualidad, útiles, separatas, entre otros; de esta manera ella tendrá las herramientas necesarias para continuar estudiando y poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y ser el orgullo de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Milagros is 21 years old and is a hardworking young woman.  Most of all she is highly motivated to get ahead.  From the time she was very young, she learned what it is to earn her living by the sweat of her brow, since  her parents came from a very humble background.  At times what they earned was not enough to support the household, so she worked in order to help them.  She lives in the city of Chincha, which is characterized by its warm climate and friendly atmosphere.  There are beautiful beaches, and the local people have a gift for making delicious dishes.  

When she has some free time, Milagros very much likes to read, and sometimes she enjoys one of her favorite dishes “Pollo a la Braza” (barbecued chicken with French fries).

With a great deal of enthusiasm, she works as a secretary in a city institution.   She works for around nine hours per day, and in the evenings she uses her earnings to finance her studies.  She is pursuing a career as a lawyer.  She believes that things are going well in her work because she is highly motivated to succeed, and above all she is very responsible.

Milagros is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to cover her educational expenses, such as registration fees, monthly tuition, textbooks, school supplies and other items.  In this way she will have the tools necessary to continue studying and will be able to make her greatest dream a reality: "to have a good professional career and be the pride of her parents".

loans.use: to cover her educational expenses, such as registration fees, monthly tuition, textbooks, school supplies and other items.

loans.name: Hamfrey

texts.en:
Hamfrey is 29 years old, married to Pauline and blessed with three children, aged eight, six and three. He owns a local video showroom, a business he started four years ago from which he earns a monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

Hamfrey wants to purchase a DSTV satellite disc for his business and has requested a second loan of KES. 60,000. The profit he makes will help him venture into other lines of business. 

He dreams of becoming a prominent businessman.

loans.use: To purchase a DSTV satellite disc for his business.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio de 51 años de edad, es un esposo y padre responsable de tres hijos menores de edad quienes los fines de semana acompañan a José a realizar su trabajo. Él posee una venta de frutas y verduras la cual realiza en diferentes colonias con la ayuda de su pick up con el cual se transporta a diferentes lugares. Desde hace varios años que él trabaja de este modo sacando adelante a su familia. José desea aumentar sus ventas y así poder suplir todas las necesidades de sus hijos, razón principal por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de verduras y frutas de estación, con lo que espera aumentar sus ganancias lo cual es de mucho beneficio para su hogar, tomando en cuenta que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee ya que toda la familia se dedica a esta labor.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 51 years old and is a responsible father and husband.  He has three young children who go with him on weekends and help him with his work.  He has a business selling fruits and vegetables in various neighborhoods, with the help of his pickup truck.  He has been doing this work for several years in order to help his family get ahead.
 
He wants to increase his sales and thus be able to give his children everything they need.  This is is main reason for seeking a loan from INTEGRAL.  He will use the funds to purchase a larger quantity of seasonal fruits and vegetables, which he hopes will help him increase his earnings. This will be very beneficial to his family, considering that it is their only source of income since they all work in this business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for making and selling flowers.

loans.name: Aracely De La Cruz

texts.es: Aracely de la Cruz, es una persona muy responsable y de confianza, quien cuenta con una familia muy unida que está conformada por su esposo y dos hijos que se dedican a estudiar. Aracely posee una venta de tortillas y pupusas las cuales ella misma elabora, una jornada muy difícil pero gracias a la cual ha logrado salir adelante, así mismo comercializa cosméticos y perfumes los cuales ofrece a sus vecinas, gracias a todos estos esfuerzos es como Aracely le brinda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: maíz, frijoles, queso, chicharrón y otros más para la elaboración de las tortillas y pupusas, así mismo para comprar diferentes tipos de cosméticos y perfumes.
texts.en: Aracely de la Cruz is a very responsible and reliable person. She has a very united family made up of her husband and her two children who are studying.   Aracely has a tortilla and pupusa (stuffed tortilla) shop. She makes them herself. It is difficult work, but with it, she has been able to move forward. She also sells cosmetics and perfumes, which she offers to her neighbors. Thanks to all these efforts, Aracely gives her husband the help he needs with the household expenses. She is applying for a loan from INTERGAL to be able to buy more ingredients like corn, beans, cheese, pork rinds, and others to make tortillas and pupusas. She will also buy different kinds of cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, and other ingredients to make pupusas (stuffed tortillas).

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
This is Merlyn, 32, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dennis, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. Merlyn is working hard to provide income for her daily expenses.  

Merlyn oversees the operation of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. Merlyn will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to service their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlyn dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She can draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay their loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle transport.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Bohol, Philippines. She is in the food business selling snack foods. Sometimes she cooks food to sell in the neighborhood. 
Mercedita is able to earn money through this business. However, she lacks funds for the expansion of her venture. She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy more stock to sell.
In the future, Mercedita dreams of making her business grow and experiencing the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as snack foods.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: Silvia Elizabeth, una excelente madre quien trabaja muy duro por el bien de sus tres hijos, los cuales dependen por completo de ella para tener una vida estable. Silvia se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos los cuales comercializa en su casa de habitación. Silvia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL con el objetivo de mejorar grandemente su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, las cuales vende a crédito por lo que en muchas ocasiones no posee el capital necesario para comprar más productos nuevos, situación que espera superar gracias al préstamo realizado y así de esta manera poder aumentar su inventario lo que será de mucho beneficio para su hogar y sus hijos.
texts.en: Silvia Elizabeth is an excellent mother who works very hard for the good of her three children, who depend completely on her for a stable life. Silvia works selling perfumes and cosmetics, which she sells out of her home. She is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL with the goal of greatly improving her business, and buying a greater quantity of beauty products. She sells them on credit, which means that many times she doesn't have the money she need to buy new products. She hopes to remedy this situation thanks to the loan and this way be able to increase her inventory, which will be very beneficial for her home and her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo Antonio  de 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa quien trabaja como empleada domestica y así mismo vendiendo pan,  y dos hijos. A pesar de su corta edad Wilfredo es muy responsable y trabajador, él posee un taller industrial en donde labora estructuras metálicas en donde el trabajo es muy constante ya que trabaja para algunos negocios y para clientes particulares. Wilfredo solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de hierro, el cual ha aumentado su precio en los últimos días, así también para la compra de otras herramientas necesarias para la elaboración de su trabajo. Wilfredo es una persona muy soñadora quien desea salir adelante y darle lo mejor a su familia en todo momento.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Antonio, 22 years old, lives with his wife, who works as a domestic employee and also by selling bread, and two children. Despite his young age, Wilfredo is very responsible and hard-working. He owns an industrial workshop in which he works metal structures. The work is very steady since he works for some business and private customers.

Wilfredo requests a loan for the means with which he can buy a large quantity of iron, which has gone up in price in the last several days, and also for the purchase of other tools necessary for production in his work. Wilfredo is a dreamer who wants to get ahead and give the best to his family at every moment.

loans.use: to buy iron to complete structures to sell.

loans.name: Serah  Munyiva

texts.en:
Serah is 54 years old and married with one child, age 28. She operates a cafeteria in a busy area. She has engaged in this business for five years and has employed two people.  

She also does poultry farming to supplement her income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save through her training in financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more beverages and to renovate her cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy more beverages and renovate her cafeteria.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en: Nizar, a 22-year-old single man, is the only brother of two sisters. Nizar is a university student majoring in Computer Information Systems. He has applied for this loan to pay his tuition for the semester to get his Bachelors degree.

loans.use: to pay for his semester student fees.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David Antonio de 35 años de edad, es un joven padre de cuatro hijos y así mismo un esposo responsable. Él se dedica al oficio de la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijoles, los cuales son granos básicos que posee una gran demanda en el país ya que son básicos en la dieta alimenticia de las personas. David siembra las semillas y luego las vende en tiendas y mercados, logrando de esta forma sostener a su familia. David solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder mejorar su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de semillas de maíz y de frijoles para sembrar, así mismo pesticidas y abono para la salud de su cultivo.
texts.en: David Antonio, 35, is a young father of four children and is a responsible husband. He works in agriculture, planting corn and beans, which are staples for which there is high demand in the country, since they are basics in peoples' diets. David plants the seeds and then sells in shops and markets, and this way he is able to support his family. David is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to improve his business and buy a greater quantity of corn and bean seeds to plant. He also wants to buy pesticides and fertilizer for the health of his crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant.

loans.name: Imelda Meléndez

texts.es: Imelda Meléndez de 62 años de edad es muy alegre y trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo quien es pensionado y le ayuda con el negocio, y así mismo junto a una hija y una nieta. Imelda posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa. Desde hace 10 años ella ha trabajado mucho por lograr mejorar las condiciones de su negocio ya que su mayor deseo es poder tener una tienda muy surtida, la cual las personas prefieran. Imelda solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios para obtener  mayores ganancias. Ella junto a su esposo se esfuerzan día con día para poder llevar el sustento diario a su hogar  y de esta manera poder tener una vida mejor.
texts.en: 62-year-old Imelda Meléndez is very cheerful and hardworking. She lives with her husband, who's retired and helps her in the business. She also lives with a daughter and a granddaughter. Imelda owns a store that sells perishable goods and it's located in her own home. For the past 10 years she has worked hard in order to improve her business, since her biggest wish is to have a very well-stocked store that's preferred by people. Imelda requests a loan that allows her to purchase all the products she needs in order to increase her profits. Along with her husband, she works hard every day so that she can provide daily support for her household and therefore have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase essential goods.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos de 58 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de los cuales dos le ayudan con el negocio y junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Juan Carlos posee un talle en el que elabora estructuras metálicas como: puertas, balcones, rejas y otras más. El negocio está ubicado en el centro de su lugar de residencia, una zona muy concurrida por cientos de personas que transitan a diario por ahí, lo que es de mucho beneficio para el negocio. Juan Carlos solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de poder comprar una maquina soldadora, así también hierro y otras herramientas para la elaboración de su trabajo. Él es una persona muy responsable quien siempre entrega los pedidos a tiempo, razón por la que muchas personas lo prefieren.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is 58 years old. He lives with his three children, two of whom help him in the business. He also lives with his wife, who's in charge of the household chores. Juan Carlos owns a shop where he manufactures metal structures such as doors, balconies, grilles, etc. The shop is located in the center of his home, a very busy area with hundreds of people walking by on a daily basis, which is very beneficial to the business. Juan Carlos requests a loan from INTEGRAL in hopes of being able to purchase a welding machine, as well as iron and other tools for his manufacturing work. He's a very responsible person who always delivers the orders on time, which is the reason why many people prefer to go to him.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine for his business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: Ester de 22 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora y dedicada a su hogar. Vive junto a su esposo y dos pequeños hijo menores de edad.
