Ester se dedica a la elaboración de tamales de carne y de elote, este es un platillo muy típico de este país y cuenta con varios clientes ya que los tamales pueden  comerse para desayuno o para cena. Ella elabora los tamales en su casa de habitación vendiendo una pequeña cantidad ahí mismo  y vendiendo otra parte en diferentes colonias. Con el deseo de mejorar su venta y ampliar sus ganancias, Ester solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: maíz, pollo, verduras, hojas de plátano para envolver los tamales y leña para cocinarlos. Ella es una persona muy positiva quien lucha por la esperanza de poder vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en: Ester is 22 years old, is a young entrepreneur and is dedicated to her home.  She lives together with her husband and two young children. Ester works making tamales made with meat and corn.  This is a very typical dish in her country and she has many regular clients since tamales can be eaten for breakfast or for dinner.  She makes the tamales in her home, selling a small quantity right from her home and selling another part in different neighborhoods.  With the goal of increasing her sales and improving her earnings, Ester is asking for a loan in order to buy a larger amount of raw materials like corn, chicken, vegetables, and banana leaves for wrapping tamales as well as firewood for cooking.  Ester is a very positive person who fights for the hope of being able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase corn, chicken, and vegetables in order to make tamales.

loans.name: Orbelina Del Carmen

texts.es: Orbelina Del Carmen es una mujer muy luchadora quien desde muy joven se ha esforzado al máximo por salir adelante y poseer una vida estable, ella vive junto a tres hijos y su esposo. Orbelina se dedica a la elaboración de tamales los cuales elabora hasta cinco veces a la semana, aumentando su producción los fines de semana ya que es cuando las personas más los consumen, así mismo para contar con más ingresos Orbelinda ha iniciado una venta cosméticos que comercializa de forma ambulante al igual que los tamales. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos como sombras de para ojos, labiales, también perfumes y cremas y así de esta manera mejorar y surtir este negocio, con lo que ella garantice tener mayores ganancias para el bien de su hogar.
texts.en: Orbelina Del Carmen is a very hard-working woman who from the time she was young has worked her hardest in order to get ahead and to possess a stable life.  She lives together with her three children and her husband.  Orbelina works making tamales which she does five times a week, increasing her production on the weekends since that is when people consume the most.  In addition, in order to earn more income, Orbelina has begun selling makeup that she offers as a walking saleswoman along with her tamales.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a larger quantity of cosmetics like eye shadow, lipstick, perfume and face cremes, and in this way better supply her business.  She guarantees that with better supplies she will have better earnings and that will help her family.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia y su esposo son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando la primaria, y no cuentan con el dinero necesario para pagas los gastos de la inscripción y comprar los uniformes.
Solicitan un préstamo para cubrir esta necesidad escolar que tiene para que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando.
La señora Cecilia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos y su esposo es chofer de un camión de carga, estos son los ingresos generan para salir adelante.
Con las ganancias que obtiene la señora Cecilia será para pagar el crédito y el sueldo que percibe su esposo de su trabajo será para los gastos familiares.
Desean que sus hijos tengan la educación necesaria para que lleguen hacer unos triunfadores en su futuro.
texts.en: Mrs. Cecilia and her husband are parents and have two children who are studying in elementary school.  They do not have sufficient money to pay the expenses for their children's school fees and to purchase the required uniforms.  They are asking for a loan in order to cover the necessary school expenses so that their children can continue to study.  Mrs. Cecilia works selling beauty products via catalogues and her husband is a truck driver.  These are their means for generating income in order to move forward.  With the earnings that Cecilia makes from her sales she will repay the credit and the earnings from her husband's job will be used to cover household expenses.  They want their children to have the education necessary to be able to triumph in the future.

loans.use: To pay for school expenses.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 45 years old and married with six children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this one.  She has been running the general store for 11 years, and also earns an income from raising livestock and food vending.

Rebecca aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Rhodah  Koitalel

texts.en:
Rhodah is 58 years old and married with five children. She sells text books and exercise books to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for fifteen years and has employed one person to help her in her business. Besides this, she does farming to supplement her income. Previously she used to work as a school teacher.

Through Faulu Kenya, she was able to manage her business because she has been trained on business management skills. She dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. Rhodah has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy text books and exercise books.

loans.use: to buy text books and exercise books

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an overlock machine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 71 years old, married to Samson and is the mother of two children. She is a farmer in Limuru and has been in the farming business for twelve years now. She also has a retail shop shared with her husband. She gets a monthly income of 57,000 KES from selling vegetables in bulk.

This will be Mary’s fifth loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy farm implements like fertilizer and spraying chemicals. 

With the profit she will get, she wants to buy a dairy cow. In the future she wants to be a successful business woman in Limuru.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, crop chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Liseth Paola

texts.es: Paola tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera se dedica al rubro del comercio de cosméticos por catalogo Natura, también obtiene otros ingresos con venta carteras y alguna ropa para mujer en oficinas publicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz se dedica a esta actividad hace ya 3 años con la cual paga alimentación, vestimenta, pasajes, etc. Paola cuenta con grado de instrucción técnico y vive en anticrético con su hermano sus padres se encuentran en Estados Unidos, es una mujer emprendedora con mucha iniciativa  que desea salir adelante y poder obtener como anhelo principal su vivienda propia y poder tener también una familia. Ella solicita el crédito para capital de operaciones compra de cosméticos, perfumes, etc. Ya que tiene una cartera de clientes consolidada y diversificada es por eso que solicita que le colaboremos con el crédito para que pueda tener con su trabajo una mejor calidad de vida y mayores ventas.
texts.en: Paola is 30 years old, is single, and works selling cosmetics via the catalogue Natura.  She also obtains income by selling purses and clothing for women in the public and private offices of the city of La Paz.  She has been working in this field for 3 years and she uses her earnings to pay for food, clothing, travel, etc.  Paola received education up through technical instruction and she lives in a rent free building along with her brother.  Her parents live in the U.S.  She is a very hard-working woman with much initiative who wants to get ahead and be able to obtain as her principle dream her own home and be able to have her own family.  She is asking for credit in order to get operational capital to purchase cosmetics, perfumes, etc.  Since she has a solid and diverse group of customers, she is asking that we collaborate with her on this credit so that she can have a better quality of life through her work by increasing her sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like perfumes, purses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bulb holders to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs and basic ingredients to start her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables to pickle to sell.

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es:
El grupo Arcoiris lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosibel quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 4 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en pantalones, blusas, camisetas y camisas con el fin de salir adelante.
Las otras integrantes son Marlene quien tiene un cafetín desde hace 10 años en una de las universidades de Managua y Aura vende sandalias y tortillas hace 11 años.
texts.en:
Group Arcoiris is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women. 

One of them is Rosibel, who has made a living selling clothing for the past 4 years. 

She will invest the money in pants, blouses, T-shirts, and shirts. 

The other members are Marlene. who has ran a café at the university of Managua for the past 10 years, and Aura, who has sold sandals and tortillas during the past 11 years.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, such as pants, blouses, and shirts.

loans.name: Tabernaculo De David Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tabernáculo de David lo conforman cuatro personas emprendedoras una de ellas es Petrona quien se dedica a la venta de ropa en Boaco este negocio lo inicio hace 2 años. El crédito lo invertirá pantalones, camisetas, bikinis, brazier, calcetas…etc. 
Las integrantes son Elda quien vende enchiladas y platanitos, Rosa quien vende nacatamales y derivados del cerdo y Violeta quien vende yoltamal y pinolillo desde hace 5 años.
texts.en: The "Tabernáculo de David" ("David's Tabernacle") communal bank is comprised of four enterprising people. One of them is Petrona, who sells clothing in Boaco. She started this business two years ago. She will use the loan to invest in trousers, t-shirts, bikinis, brassieres, stockings, etc. The other members are Elda who sells enchiladas and plantain chips, Rosa who sells nacatamales (a typical Nicaraguan dish consisting of steamed corncakes wrapped in plantain leaves) and pork products, and Violeta who has been selling yoltamales (corn tamales) and pinolillo (a sweet cornmeal and cacao-based traditional drink in Nicaragua) for the past five years.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing).

loans.name: Veronica Valentina

texts.es: Verónica tiene 19 años de edad vive en la zona de Sopocachi de La Paz, ella es soltera y vive con su mama ya que su papa se marchó hacia Argentina cuando ella era muy pequeña.  Veronica es una persona que comenzó a trabajar desde joven a sus 16 años vendiendo productos por catálogo de líneas Avon, Esika, Ebel, CyZone y también billeteras y carteras con esta actividad aporta en los gastos familiares y paga su gastos cuenta con dos años de experiencia en este rubro actualmente se dedica a este rubro casi la mayoría de su tiempo para poder salir adelante y generar mayores ingresos. Ella se dedica a trabajar y estudiar para poder ayudar en casa a los gastos familiares, el crédito es para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para el negocio ya que esta época es alta en ventas y ella tiene mucha experiencia en esto. El objetivo, el sueño fundamental de Verónica es tener un negocio prospero que le de un mejor futuro así poder vivir bien e independizarse y poder comprarle a su mama una casa propia.
texts.en:
Veronica is 19 years old, living in the area of Sopocachi, La Paz. She is single and lives with her mother since her father left them for Argentina when she was very young.

Veronica started working at a young age, when she was 16 years old, selling products by catalogue of; Avon, Ebel, Ésika and CyZone lines and also wallets and purses. The income helps to pay the family expenses. She has two years of experience in this field, which demands most of her time, in order to get ahead and generate more income. 

She works and studies in order to help the family expenses at home. The loan is to buy more merchandise for the business since this is the peak season and she has much experience in this. 

The goal, the dream of Veronica is to have a thriving business that gives her a better future as well as to become independent and to be able to buy a house for her mom.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as purses, wallets, and creams.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Él cuenta con 23 años de experiencia en el trabajo de enderezado y pintura de vehículos. Aprendió el trabajo, ya que empezó a trabajar en un taller de automóviles como ayudante, pues era muy joven y no tenía conocimiento sobre eso. Pero después, él aprendió bien el oficio e instalo su propio taller en donde les da trabajo a jóvenes que desean aprender el oficio. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ocho galones de masilla, dos galones de pintura, electrodos, sierras, discos, entre otros. Con el préstamo don Juan, podrá comprar los materiales en mayores cantidades, para conseguir un precio más accesible y a la vez se ahorra tiempo al no tener que viajar tan seguido a la ciudad en donde compra los materiales. Además, con los materiales en su taller don Juan podrá desempeñar cualquier trabajo que llegue, pues tendrá material para hacerlo. Su objetivo, es construir un espacio más amplio para su taller y protegerse de la lluvia.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 42 years old. He's married and has three children. He has 23 years' worth of experience in repairing and painting vehicles. He learned this trade because he started working in an auto repair shop as an assistant, since he was very young and unfamiliar with it. However, later on he learned the business very well and set up his own shop where he employs young people who wish to learn the trade.
The loan he requests from Fundación Campo is to purchase eight gallons of putty, two gallons of paint, electrodes, saws, discs, among other items. With the loan Don Juan will be able to buy the supplies in bulk, so that he can get more accessible prices. He'll also save time by not having to travel so often to the town where he buys the supplies. Besides, with the supplies in his shop Don Juan will be able to tackle any job that comes in, because he'll have the supplies to do it. His goal is to build a larger shop and get protection from the rain.

loans.use: to purchase eight gallons of putty, two gallons of paint, electrodes, saws, discs, among other items.

loans.name: Bunsuor's Group

texts.en:
Bunsuor, 43 years old, is a farmer living in a rural village in the Sangke District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has three children. Two of them have their own employment and the remaining one is helping her with the household and the family’s business. Through rice farming and growing vegetables, such as cabbages and chilies, Bunsuor earns approximately 32,000 riels (KHR) and saves about 17,000 riels each day after deducting daily expenses. She has been in her business for 20 years. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her field business.

Bunsuor has been with VisionFund for eight cycles, while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has wisely used her past loans and she has paid back with success to better support her business. She is now leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund in amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion for fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income so as to make her family’s standard of living better in their rural life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa used her first loan in a smart way that helped her to improve their living conditions. Now she has applied for another loan to bring in new goods to increase her profits so she can open an independent store in the future.

loans.use: to bring in more goods.

loans.name: Dúo Roca De Vendición Group

texts.es:
Dúo roca de bendición,
Este grupo está  integrado por la señora Carolina ella es originaria de San Juan Comalapa,  tiene 5 hijos el mayor anhelo de ella es que sus hijos sean unos buenos profesionales mas adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de leña, Carbón sus ventas las realiza en su casa ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de leña y carbón para la venta espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que ella necesita por medio del crédito.
texts.en:
“Duo roca de bendicion” is a group that includes Carolina who is originally from San Juan Comalapa. She has five children and her greatest desire is that her children become good professionals later on in life.  

She makes her living selling firewood and charcoal. She makes sales from her home and she is very well known by her clients. She is requesting this loan to buy wood and charcoal to resell. She hopes that she can receive the support she needs through this loan.

loans.use: to buy wood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Silueta De Cristal Group

texts.es:
El grupo Silueta de Cristal lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ivania quien tiene un taller de calzado desde hace 1 años y sus productos los vende en Managua, León y Rivas. El crédito lo invertirá en charol, azulón, plantillas, suelas y alistado.
Las otras integrantes son Ivania quien vende legumbres, pozol, tiste desde hace 5 años y Juan de Dios quien tiene un taller de calzado desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The "Silueta de Cristal" ("Crystal Silhouette") communal bank is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Ivania, who has owned a shoemaker's shop for a year. She sells her products in Managua, León and Rivas. She will use the loan to invest in patent leather, dye, insoles, soles and other supplies.
The other members are Ivania, who has been selling vegetables, pozol (a typical drink made with corn, milk, sugar and water) and tiste (another typical drink made with cacao and corn) for the past five years; and Juan de Dios, who has owned a shoemaker's shop for seven years.

loans.use: to buy patent leather, glue, dye, insoles, soles, lasting, and other supplies.

loans.name: El Halcón Group

texts.es:
El grupo El halcón está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Miriam quien se dedica a la venta de frutas actividad que inicio hace 15 años. Ella inicio con las ganancias del bordado y luego poco a poco lo fue aumentando.
Los otros integrantes son Cristina quien desde hace 30 años vende frutas y verduras y José Isabel quien comercializa nacatamales y frutas.
texts.en:
The group “El Halcon” consists of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Miriam who makes her living selling fruits which she started 15 years ago.  She started this business from the profits of her embroidery business and she grew it little by little.  

The other members of the group are Crisitina who has sold fruits and vegetables for 30 years and Jose Isabel who sells tamales and fruit.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to sell in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a horse cart

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap lives in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a 32-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been farming rice for eight years to support her family and also supplements the family’s income by selling desserts in the local area. Her current business earns her around 32,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day, which she uses to meet her family's needs. The main challenge for her field business is low crop yields.

Sopheap has been with VisionFund for one cycle, while the other member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Sopheap successfully and smartly used her first loan, which she has paid back, to support her children’s education and improve her livelihood. Now she and her fellow group member are requesting a new loan from VisionFund. Sopheap, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, which she hopes will result in more productive crop yields and thus enable her to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 4 children, ranging in age from 3 to 13 years old. She describes herself as a go-getter and an ambitious woman. She operates a retail store where she sells toiletries such as Colgate, tissues, and sanitary napkins. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a potential business area, and her primary customers are other retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve her business.

Jackline will use her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more toiletries for resale. Her business goal is to be a supplier of toiletries within 5 years. She hopes to build permanent business premises in the future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more toiletries

loans.name: El Tucán Group

texts.es:
El grupo el tucán lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Digmara quien desde hace 7 años tiene una tortillerías, además vende leña desde hace 1 año. Ella desde tempranas horas alista el fogón y empieza a palmear las tortillas para la mañana, a la hora del almuerzo y la cena repite este arduo trabajo; por las noches nezquisa el maíz.
El crédito lo invertirá en maíz y leña principalmente.
Los otros integrantes son Luz quien se dedica a la venta de verdura desde hace 6 años y Yaritza quien tiene una mini pulpería desde hace 7 años
texts.en:
The Tucan Group consists of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Digmara who has had a tortilla store for seven years and has also sold firewood for one year.  From the early hours in the morning, she prepares the stove and begins clapping the tortillas for that morning. At lunch and dinner she repeats this hard work. In the evenings, she grinds the corn. 

She will invest the loan in mainly corn and firewood.  The other members of the group are Luz who has sold vegetables for six years and Yaritza who has had a small grocery store for seven years.

loans.use: to buy corn and wood to sell in her business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es:
Michael de 21 años de edad, es un joven de responsable, convive con María de 20 años, en la casa alquilada junto a su pequeño hijo John de 04 años. Michael, se dedica a la venta de comestibles para el hogar; su negocio lo ejerce en la casa que alquila, junto a su pareja. Ellos desde muy jóvenes empezaron a convivir y ahora ambos tienen responsabilidades que cumplir, es por ello que vieron por conveniente abrir su tienda, para que de esa manera logren obtener buenas ganancias por las ventas que dí a día realizan. 
Su labor empezó hace 01 año y comentan que gracias a sus vecinos que siempre visitan su tienda, pues logran tener buenas ganancias; para ello es que necesita el préstamo, porque con ese crédito que obtuvieron lograran abastecerse de mercadería para incrementar en su tienda. Este es su crédito número 01 y se siente contento por la confianza que le brindan, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago y no quedar mal ante los socios de su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles màs sus ahorros comprará cereales, verduras y conservas.
texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Michael is a responsible young man.  He lives in a rented house with his girlfriend, twenty-year-old María, and his young, four-year-old son, John.  Michael sells foods for the home; he runs his business out of the house he rents with his girlfriend.  They started living together when they were very young and now they both have responsibilities.  That is why they thought it would be a good idea to open their store, so they can make good profits from their day-to-day sales.

He started this work one year ago and they tell us that they are able to make good profits thanks to the neighbors who always visit their store.  This is why he needs this loan; with it they will be able to restock the merchandise in their store.  This is his first loan and he is satisfied because of the confidence it gives him.  He promises to make his payments on time and not to make himself look bad in front of his communal bank members.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles he will buy cereals, vegetables, and canned foods.

loans.use: to buy cereals, vegetables, and canned foods

loans.name: Crisantemo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Crisantemo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Oscar quien se dedica a la venta de flores en uno de los mercados más populosos de Managua; además tiene un billar desde hace 4 años. El crédito lo invertirá en flores (rosas, crisantemos, margaritas…etc.)
Los otros integrantes son Marbely quien vende ropa y cosméticos; y Leopoldo quien vende granos básicos.
texts.en:
The group Crisantemo consists of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Oscar who makes his living selling flowers in one of the most populated markets of Managua. He has also had a billiards business for four years. He will use the loan to invest in flowers (roses, chrysanthemums, daisies, etc). 

The other members of the group are Marbely who sells clothing and cosmetics and Leopoldo who sells basic grains.

loans.use: to buy flowers to sell in his business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 46-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is a mother of three children who are still attending school. She has been engaged in the hog-raising business for more than ten years. She recently bought piglets to raise.

She now needs money for her hog-raising business. Specifically, she is requesting a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy feed and supplements for her pigs. This will enable her to raise healthy and good-quality pigs.

Vicenta believes that, with the financial support of the loan, she can make her dreams of improving her family's lives possible.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements for her pigs

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es:
Juana tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Aprendió el trabajo por cuanta propia, ya que no tiene ninguna profesión académica y se vio en la necesidad de brindar alimentación y educación a sus hijos. Ella cose 60 libras de maíz, luego las lleva al molino; a partir de las 9:00 a.m. comienza a elaborar sus tortillas durante todo el día y las vende en su casa. El maíz y la leña las adquiere, en el mercado de la ciudad y los traslada en autobús durante veinte minutos de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 15 sacos de maíz y unas dos camionadas de leña. Con el préstamo Juana, podrá comprar los insumos en mayores cantidades, ya que actualmente los compra diariamente, podrá conseguir precios más accesibles y seguridad al tener los insumos en su casa.  Su objetivo, es instalar una tienda de productos básicos en su casa, ya que los mismos clientes que le compran las tortillas, podrán ser los clientes de la tienda; aumentando sus ingresos para que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Juana is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She has five years' worth of experience in making and selling tortillas. She learned the business on her own, since she has no academic career and was faced with the need to provide food and education for her children. She cooks 60 pounds of corn and then takes it to the mill; starting at 9 a.m., she spends the whole day making her tortillas, which she sells from home. She buys the corn and the firewood in the town's market and transports them on a 20-minute ride to her house.
The loan she requests from Fundación Campo is to purchase 15 sacks of corn and about two truckloads of firewood. With the loan Juana will be able to buy the supplies in bulk. Since she currently buys them everyday, she'll be able to get more accessible prices and the security of having the supplies at her home. Her goal is to set up a grocery store in her house, because the same customers who buy her tortillas may be customers at her store. That way she'll increase her profits, so that her children can study.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of corn and about two truckloads of firewood.

loans.name: Romel

texts.es: Romel de 18 años de edad; es un joven soltero y habita en la casa de su madre Yolanda, junto a su hermanito menor Brayan. Romel, es un muchacho empeñoso. Se dedica en la venta de abarrotes en su propia casa, junto a su querida madre; que desde un inicio lo acompaño. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo, es poder brindar buena atención a sus clientes y de esa manera ganarse la confianza de ellos. Sin embargo a veces se le agotan los productos y requiere de mas comestible; para ello necesita el préstamo, siendo así podra continuar con su negocio. Su mayor anhelo es tener una profesión y que su madre y hermano tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su crédito número 02, se siente contento por la confianza que le brindan por segunda vez; seguirá cumpliendo con su pago y no quedar mal ante los socios de su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles más las ganancias de su tienda, podrá abastecerla de cereales, conservas, bebidas, etc.
texts.en: Eighteen-year-old Romel is a single young man who lives at home with his mother, Yolanda, and his younger brother, Brayan.  Romel is a hardworking guy.  He sells groceries from his home for a living along with his beloved mother, who has been with him since the beginning.  What he likes most about his work is being able to offer good customer service, which is how he will be able to continue with his business.  His greatest dream is to have a profession and for his mother and brother to have a better quality of life.  This is his second loan and he feels good about the confidence that has been placed in him for a second time.  He will continue to make his payments and not make himself look bad in front of his communal bank members.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles and the earnings from his store, he will be able to stock up on cereals, canned foods, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy cereals, canned foods, and drinks

loans.name: Amor Al Trabajo Group

texts.es: El grupo Amor al trabajo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Karla quien se dedica a la venta de cosechas de frutas y tiene una pulpería (gaseosa, hielo, aguacate) desde hace 12 años. Los otros integrantes son José quien es agricultor y vende frutas desde hace 25 años; y Rosa quien vende nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo.
texts.en:
The group Amor Al Trabajo consists of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Karla who makes her living selling fruit and has also had a small grocery store (selling soda, ice, avocado, etc) for 12 years. 

The other members of the group are Jose who is a farmer and has sold fruit for 25 years and Rosa who sells tamales, a traditional food made from corn and pork.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and basic grains.

loans.name: Paul  Njoroge

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking 24-year-old businessman. He distributes bread to different retail shops to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years. Besides this, he does farming to supplement his income. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save because he has been trained in financial management skills. He dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy bread to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, es una mujer casada, tiene 38 años; habita en su propia casa que compró junto a su esposo Eulogio de 40 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 03 hijos. La actividad que realiza Marina es de arduo trabajo, ya que se dedica a los cultivos de plantas de cacao, café, achiote, palillo, y frutales. Esta labor lo realiza hace mas de 20 años con el apoyo de su esposo; pero en los tiempos de cosecha siempre contrata a jornaleros para que le apoyen en la extracción de sus frutos.
Para ella su trabajo es una actividad que le gusta, porque se siente tranquila al obtener muy buena producción; sin embargo comenta que a los inicios tuvo problemas con sus plantas,, pero ahora que ya tiene experiencia, le resultan muy productivas con sus cultivos y las cosechas son comercializadas en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Para mas adelante desea tener una tienda de comestibles, pero ahora prioriza en fumigar sus plantas. Este es su crédito número 03, se siente agradecida con los financieros quienes apoyan a que siga con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo se siente alegre por pertenecer a un banco comunal, donde los socios son personas solidarias y responsables.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de abono para mantenerse sanas su producción.
texts.en:
Marina is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives in her own house, which she acquired along with her husband, 40-year-old Eulogio. From this relationship they have three children. Maria's business is one of hard work, because she grows cocoa, coffee, achiote, string bean and fruit trees. She's been in this line of work for over 20 years, and she has her husband's support; however, during harvest season she always hires day laborers to help her reap her produce.
For Marina, her work is an activity she enjoys, because she feels at peace when she gets a very good crop; nonetheless, she comments that in the beginning she had problems with her plants. But now that she's experienced, her crop yields very productive results, and the produce is sold in distribution centers in her town. In time she wishes to own a grocery store, but right now her priority is to fumigate her plants. This is her third loan, and she's thankful to the lenders who support her in moving forward with her business plan. She's also glad to belong to a communal bank whose members are supportive and responsible people.
With the 3.000 nuevos soles she'll purchase fertilizer in order to keep her crop healthy.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a welder and tools.

loans.name: Yut's Group

texts.en:
Yut is 54 years old and an inhabitant of a rural area of Dambae District (Cambodia). She is the mother of three children, two of whom are her responsibility as they are still in school. As a widow mother, who raises her children alone, she has pulled the family through hardship via her occupation as a school teacher in the community and with her cassava-growing business. She has been involved in this business for 20 years, earning almost 17,000 riels (KHR) per day. 

For Yut, it is the third time that she has borrowed with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She has used her loans smartly and with success in keeping up good progress in her business. Also, she has kept her children in school. All of her past loans have been paid back. 

Now, in the same group consisting of two female members, she is the leader. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR and her co-member is requesting 1,200,000 KHR. Yut, the group leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide for her rice farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her business and earn a larger income so that she can maintain her household's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticide for her rice farm

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: El señor Elvis, es una persona de 26 años de edad de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con 2 dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus pequeños hijos; la actividad económica principal a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola; produce papa, haba y cebada  en sus propias parcelas y en compañía (es decir en terrenos de otra persona la misma dispone el terreno, semilla y los clientes la mano de obra y algunos insumos utilizados en la agricultura y a la cosecha el rendimiento final se dividen en partes iguales); los terrenos donde el cliente vive y realiza la siembra sus productos se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Sankayani Bajo del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 77 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. Finalmente el cliente y su esposa manifiestan tener ganas de poder incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de insumos agrícolas y de tal forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia atravez de incrementar su producción.
texts.en: Elvis is 26 years old and he is married.  He finished high school, specializing in humanities.  He lives in his own home and he has two financial dependents, who are his two young children.  His main source of income is farming; he grows potatoes, broad beans, and barley on his own plots and on neighborhood plots (in other words, he prepares the land and seed for other people's land; they provide the labor and some farming supplies, and at harvest time they split the yield evenly).  The land where he lives and does his planting are in the community of Sankayani Bajo in the municipality of Tíraque, which is about 77km from the city of Cochabamba.  He and his wife are finally showing signs of wanting to increase their farming production and to do so they need to ask for investment money to buy farming supplies and thereby improve their family's living conditions by increasing their production.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan sells health products like medicine, soap and food supplements to earn a living. He also sells phone accessories to supplement his income. 

Jonathan had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to buy medicine for his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Jonathan has requested for a loan of 40000 KES to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: C7808 Dushyigikirane Group

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 34 years old. He is married with three children, who are between 5 and 13 years old. He is a farmer cultivating rice and works in the fields from 6 a.m. until 1 p.m. daily, except on the weekend. Jean Marie Vianney currently employs six people to help him. He has eleven years of experience in this work and is team leader of this group, which is called "C7808 Dushyigikirane" in the local language

Jean Marie Vianney has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy fertilizer for his farm. With the profit from the loan, he expects to save money for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe de 60 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora quien vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos mayores de edad quienes corren con sus gastos personales. Desde hace más de 25 años que Guadalupe posee una venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación y también tiene un molino eléctrico el cual alquila para que las personas lleguen a moles sus alimentos. Guadalupe solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de poder invertir en la reparación del molino que desde hace algunos meses no le funciona y que no ha podido mandar a reparar, lo que le provoca varias perdidas ya que es una fuente menos de ingresos que tiene, así mismo desea utilizar el préstamo para la compra de maíz para elaborar las tortillas. Guadalupe y su esposo son personas de mucha confianza y que poseen muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 60, is a very hard-working woman who lives with her husband, and three adult children who pay for their personal expenses. 

Guadalupe has had a tortilla stand in her home for more than 25 years, and also an electric mill that she rents out, so that people can come to grind their foodstuffs. 

Guadalupe is applying to Integral for a loan, with the desire to be able to invest in the repair of the mill, which has not been working for some months, and that she has not been able to have repaired. This has caused her several losses, as it means she has one less source of income. 

In addition, she wishes to use the loan to buy corn for making the tortillas. 

Guadalupe and her husband are very trustworthy people, and have good references from their neighbors.

loans.use: To buy a mill for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for her agriculture.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 03 hijos a quienes les brinda mucha atención; juntos viven en su propia casa que Isabel obtuvo gracias a su trabajo. Isabel, es una mujer laboriosa, se dedica al trabajo publico (trabaja como personal de obras de la municipalidad de su Distrito). Su labor lo lleva realizando hace 05 años y le gusta su trabajo, ya que conoce a personas como ella, que luchan por salir adelante y brindar un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Para ella su trabajo es una actividad muy rentable, ya que le remuneran muy bien por su trabajo; sin embargo la dificultad que tiene es soportar el calor intenso durante las horas de su labor. Con el tiempo desea abrir una tienda para que este mas estable; para ello necesita el crédito que obtuvo por los financieros quienes accedieron para que realice sus objetivos; de esa manera logre tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su crédito número 02; se siente muy contenta por contar una vez mas con el préstamo. Asimismo se siente orgullosa de trabajar en su banco comunal, porque los socios son personas cabales y solidarias. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, más las ganancias de su trabajo, realizará la compra de una refrigeradora, para pueda vender cremoladas, bebidas, gelatinas, etc.
texts.en:
Isabel, 28, is a single mother and has 3 children who she takes very good care. They live in a house that Isabel owns, thanks to her job. Isabel is a hardworking woman. She works in the public sector (as staff for the municipality in her district). She has been at her job for 5 years and she likes her job as she knows people like herself who fight to get ahead and offer a better future for her children. Working is highly profitable for her as it pays her very well. However, she finds the intense heat unbearable during her work hours. 

In time she wants to open a store so she can be more stable. Consequently she needs a loan obtained from lenders who agree so that she can achieve her goals. Thus she will have a better quality of life. This is her loan number 02. She is really happy to count once again with the loan. Also, she is really proud of working in her communal bank because the members are trustworthy and supportive. With 1,000 nuevos soles plus her earnings at her job, she will be able to buy a refrigerator to be able to sell iced fruit juices, drinks, gelatin etc…

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
This is Lucita, who is 52 and a resident of Payatas, Philippines. Lucita is married to Rodeo and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Lucita is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Lucita maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-sales brands such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. In direct selling, the dealer buys the customer's order in cash and then gives it to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, hence the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Lucita also has a tailoring business making pillow cases and bed sheets. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy orders for her customers and expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lucita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from their study of Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is a 31-year-old married mother of four children who are students at a local public school. Currently, her entire family is living under a thatched house in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. For the household's financial survival, Channy cultivates rice with her husband, her core income-generating activity. To supplement the family's income, Channy sells spicy papaya salad, meatballs, and soya milk; she has been in this business for four years and is able to earn almost 25,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day.

Channy just joined VisionFund as a first-time borrower. She will use her loan to buy wooden boards for building her house. She hopes to own a decent house, like others, for her children's sake.

loans.use: To buy wooden boards for building her house

loans.name: Seinepbu

texts.ru:
Сейнепбу 55 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Сейнепбу работает поваром в столовой местной школы  и в качестве дополнительного дохода с 1996  года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Сейнепбу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 12 овец и 4 козы. Также, Сейнепбу обрабатывает 1,60 га земли с кукурузой, клевером и пшеницей. Благодаря доходам от бизнеса, Сейнепбу оплачивает обучение для сына в столице.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сейнепбу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Сейнепбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Seinepbu is 55 years old, married, and has 4 children. 

Seinebpu works as a cook in the canteen of a local school. Since 1996, she has been growing crops and raising livestock as a means of supplementing her salary. She started this business with only 6,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent hard work, Seinebpu now has 2 dairy cows, 2 calves, 12 sheep and 4 goats. She also has 1.6 hectares of land where she grows corn, clover and wheat. The income Seinebpu has earned has allowed her to pay to send her son to the capital city for his studies. 

Seinebpu approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS) to develop her business. She will use the money to purchase young livestock to fatten and re-sell. Seinebpu plans to use the income generated by this loan to re-invest in her business. She wants to buy more cattle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert runs a video show business to earn a living. He previously obtained a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped him to buy a flat screen television for use in his business. His business improved, and, with the additional income, he was able to start another business selling soft drinks. He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a refrigerator and another flat screen television.

loans.use: to buy a flat screen television and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Heak's Group

texts.en:
Heak is the breadwinner of a family with nine children, six of whom are living with her. Among her six kids, she can afford to keep two daughters in school while the remaining four help the family business. They also produce sugar from sugar palm trees in order to assist their mother (Heak) with their basic daily needs. 

Heak and her husband manage their two-hectare (about 20,000 square meters) of farmland for rice crop cultivation to help their big family survive. Heak has been involved in this business for 25 years and earns about 26000 KHR. Her main challenges are water supply shortages and insufficiency of working capital to support her rice farm, especially the cost of harvesting fees. Therefore, Heak formed a group of two women to seek a new loan; she is in the third cycle while her co-member is in the second cycle with Kiva's partner.

After successfully repaying a loan, Heak feels confident that she can sustain her family's living condition as well as her business. For this cycle, she and her fellow group member are seeking the same loan amount: 1000000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay a harvesting fee and buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to gain more yield and sell at a higher price so she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay a harvesting fee and buy fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Margaret   Wanjiru

texts.en: Margaret is 60 years old and is married with four children. She sells construction supplies such as stones in order to make a living. She has been engaged in this business for twenty years and has employed three people to assist her. She previously obtained a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her grow her business. She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more stones for resale.  She dreams of building rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stones for her construction-supplies business

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.es: La señora Lurdes, es una persona de 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive actualmente en su propia casa junto a su familia y cuenta con seis dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad económica de la clienta es la producción agrícola, los productos que cultiva son la papa, maíz y arveja; produce especialmente la papa durante dos épocas de la gestión en sus terrenos propios que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Ch'aqo Capilla del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 63 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Lurdes y su familia manifiestan ser personas trabajadoras y responsables que quieren  superarse e incrementar su productividad  y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de insumos agrícolas que a corto plazo le permitirá obtener mayores  ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Lurdes, 34, is married and lives in the home she owns with her family, which includes 6 dependent children. She completed primary school. She is a farmer, cultivating potatoes, corn and peas. She produces potatoes during two growing seasons on her own land that is located in the community of Ch'aqo Capilla in the county of Tiraque, approximately 63km from the city of Cochabamba.

Lurdes and her family demonstrate that they are hardworking and responsible people who want to better themselves and increase their productivity. In order to do that, they see the need to ask for investment capital to buy agricultural inputs that in the short term will allow them to bring in more profits that will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II y tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos. Es socia de Finca Perú hace tres años y es dueña de un horno con el cual elabora panes para vender. Ella manifiesta que gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal porque le enseñan a ser responsable, ha aprendido sobre como mantener una buena relación matrimonial, además asistiendo a las reuniones se des estresa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de harina para que pueda elaborar pan.
texts.en: Adelaida, 54, is a member of the communal bank Unión II. She has four children. She has been a member of Finca Perú for three years and she has an oven which she uses to make bread that she sells. She says that thanks to the training she has received in the communal bank, because they taught her to be responsible, she has learned how to maintain a good marital relationship. Attending the meetings also relieves her stress. She will invest the loan in buying flour to make bread.

loans.use: to buy flour so that she can make bread.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb, 35, is an original citizen from a rural area of Kror Kor district in Pursat province. She has five sons to cater to; three are still in school, while the other two are still young. To provide decent food for her children, she and her husband struggle to earn income by growing paddy rice in their two hectares of farmland. Her husband also works for others for a fee in his spare time to generate additional income.

Chreb has been in the rice business for 13 years and is able to earn almost 16,000 Cambodian riels (KHR). She has been with VisionFund for five cycles and paid back her entire loan with success. The past loans have helped her to provide timely support for her business and thus earn a decent income. As a result, she can buy chickens and pigs to raise for extra income.

In order to boost her yield and keep making good progress with her business, Chreb formed a group of three women to seek a new loan. Chreb is seeking 800,000 KHR, while her two fellow members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Chreb will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer to boost her yield. She expects to maximize her production so she can maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to boost crop yields

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a food market  where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a market with high potential and her primary customers are residents from nearby estates. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of food ingredients for preparing meals to customers to meet the increasing demand for food. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals for selling to customers. Her business goal is to be a supplier of food to customers within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals for selling

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 45, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Mario and mother to her seven children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Jocelyn is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in a container from wholesalers and sell it in 5-gallon containers at a profit. Her regular customers on her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of mineral water to expand her product. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jocelyn dreams to be able to give all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахим трудолюбивый и добрый человек, он хороший семьянин, у него 3 детей.    Абдурахим в течении 16 лет занимается выращиванием сельско - хозяйственной культуры.    Он выращивает пшеницу, лук, морковь и кукурузу.Но в основном он выращивает лук и пшеницу.   У него 9 Га земли и для того чтобы получить хороший урожай надо удобрять землю минералами.   В прошлом году он получил хороший урожай и в этом году он также планирует  получить большой урожай с земли.Поэтому хочет закупить минеральных  удобрений,и на полученный кредит  осуществить свои планы.
texts.en:
Abdurahim is a kind and hard-working person. He is a good family man with 3 children. 

For the past 16 years, Abdurahim has been growing crops, including wheat, onions, carrots and corn. Of these, onions and wheat are his main crops. 

Abdurahim has 9 hectares of land, and in order to have a successful harvest, he needs to fertilize with minerals. Last year he had a good harvest, and plans to have another big yield this year.

Abdurahim is seeking a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers to realize his plans for excellent future harvests.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizers

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es:
Julissa tiene 25 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, vive al lado de su esposo con el cual tiene 1 pequeño de 5 años de edad, a quien quiere muchísimo y por quien trabaja muy duro al igual que su esposo para poder darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy caluroso y posee flora y fauna muy hermosa, rodeada de paisajes muy lindos en los cuales podemos desconectarnos del bullicio de la ciudad. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser profesora.

Día a día Julissa trabaja muy duro en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja alrededor de 15 horas diarias, ya que abre su pequeño negocio desde muy temprano hasta muy noche; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Julissa agradece mucho a los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros, así como también podrá comprar materiales para poder construir una especie de techo afuera  de su vivienda como calaminas, listones, clavos, entre otros; así de esta manera tendrá mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, así como también brindarles mayor comodidad, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y  tener un negocio mas grande”.
texts.en:
Julissa is 25 years old, she is a hardworking young woman, and above all, eager to get ahead. She lives next to her husband with who she has a child who is 5 years old. She loves him so much, and with her husband, they work hard to give him a decent life and above all, much love. 

Her house is located in the city of Pucallpa, a city that is characterized by very hot weather and has beautiful flora and fauna. It is surrounded by beautiful landscapes where we can disconnect from the hustle and bustle of the city. 

Due to their limited resources, she could only study through fifth grade of secondary education, but she would have liked very much to study to be a teacher. 

Julissa works hard every day in her small business selling groceries. She works around 15 hours a day, because she opens her small business from early morning untill late night. She believes she is doing well in her business because she is very friendly with customers.

Julissa is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided, she will buy merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, and noodles, among others. Also, she will buy materials to build a roof outside her house such as corrugated, strips, and nails, among others. Doing so, she will have more variety of products to offer to her customers, and will also provide them with more comfort. That will allow her to improve her income and keep fighting to realize her greatest dream: "To give good education to his son and have a larger business".

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, etc.) and corrugated and strips,  among others.

loans.name: Peter  Mwaura

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and married with two children. He sells timber in a busy environment to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business since the year 2000. Besides timber sales, he also runs a transport business to supplement his income. 

Peter had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him grow his business. He has also learned how to manage his business because he has been trained in business management. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming successful in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy timber to sell.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Nhean's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in a rural area of Pursat province's Kror Kor district, Nhean is the head of a family blessed with three children. Two of her three kids are living with her and also help her to generate income for the family through assisting with the family business of producing sugar from sugar palm trees for resale. Her rice cropping business, which she has been in for several years, earns her almost 17,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

This is the third loan cycle for Nhean with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She has succeeded in paying back the entire past loans, and they have gradually provided better support toward her business. 

Now, in a group composed of four female members, she is a group leader. The other three members in her group are also third-cycle loan clients. 

For Nhean, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She expects to boost her rice farm in a timely manner so she can multiply her income and attain good living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a young 31-year-old woman who lives in Tiribe, a settlement in the coast province of Kenya. She has had a small casual clothing store for over 10 years, located at the market, and would like to invest in merchandise to take advantage of the festive season when sales are high. She has her list of steady customers that has been carefully put together. She is very optimistic and wants to achieve her dream of improving her quality of life. 

This will be her first loan, and she hopes to make her repayment punctually. Veronicah plans to purchase bales of clothes for all genders to offer a variety to her customers. This way, she will be able to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon has been involved in a transportation business for nine years. She is thankful because though her husband is far from them, still she is able to manage her time wisely. She is 29 years of age and has two children who go to school.

Sharon's brother is the driver for her motorcycle transport because her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker. Her main priority is to educate her two children and be able to gain greater income for her family needs. Sharon doesn't want to rely only on the remittances she receives from her husband; instead, she would like to generate her own income to help her husband in bringing up their two children. She hopes that she could uplift their living conditions out of poverty.

Sharon would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy a new wheel, chain and sprocket for her motorcycle transport business. This amount will surely help her business grow continuously because changing to new wheels and spare parts for her motorcycle transport will provide comfortable travel for her passengers.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel, chain and sprocket for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: 2012 Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “2012 ABEJITAS TRABAJADORAS”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delfina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: ayudante de albañil, venta de dulces en tienda, venta de gas, venta de coca, tejido de guantes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delfina es integrante, ella indica que es la primer vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de guantes de alpaca; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por referencias de algunas amigas a quienes veía trabajar con este negocio y posteriormente ella se involucro al mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The communal bank "2012 ABEJITAS TRABAJADORAS" will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Social Center.  It is comprised of six members and led by a board of directors whose president is Delfina.  The businesses run by the members are varied and include: bricklayer assistant, sales of sweets in a store, sales of coca leaves, glove knitting.

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small business owners group to which Delfina belongs.  This is her first experience as a member of Pro Mujer which she was invited to join by a promoter of the institution who visited her home.  Currently, she has an alpaca wool glove knitting business which she set up through references of friends she saw working in this activity, and later got involved herself.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital to buy yarn at the city fairs in the city of El Alto, to use later iat her sales point.  This work allows her to earn an income to support her family, since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area.

loans.use: To buy yarn.

loans.name: Janet   Wambui

texts.en: Janet is a hardworking business lady and the mother of two children who are in school. She operates a cafeteria business in a busy environment with reliable customers. She has been in the business for eight years and has employed one person. Besides, she operates a grocery store to supplement her income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming prosperous in the future. Janet has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to buy ingredients such as wheat and maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat and maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II y tiene 62 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace nueve años y es dueña de una empresa de distribución de gasolina. Ella está agradecida con la institución por todo el apoyo que le han brindado para el desarrollo de su empresa así como para su persona, le gusta mucho ahorrar y también participa en las capacitaciones que le brindan en su Banco Comunal. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de gasolina para venderlo en su negocio.
texts.en: Dionisia is a member of the communal bank Unión II.  She is 62 and the mother of four children.  For nine years she has been a member of FINCA Perú and she owns a gasoline distributing company.  She is grateful to the institution for all the help she has received for business and personal development.  She likes to save money and participate in the training provided by her communal bank.  The loan she is requesting is to buy gasoline to sell through her business.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to sell.

loans.name: María Alejandrina

texts.es: María Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II y tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 10 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado. Ella dice que está agradecida con FINCA Perú porque le apoyaron y logro ahorrar con lo que pudo pagar los estudios de sus hijos, también le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal porque le enseñan a manejar su negocio y a ser puntual. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra de ropa para damas, niños y caballeros.
texts.en: María Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank Unión II.  She is 60 and the single mother of four children.  For ten years she has been a member of FINCA Perú; and she earns a living selling clothing in the market.  She says she is grateful to FINCA Perú because they supported her and she was able to save money and pay for her children's education.  She also enjoys the training she receives through her communal bank which has taught her to manage her business and be punctual.  The loan she is requesting is to buy women's, children's and men's clothing.

loans.use: To buy women's, children's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel has manages a school canteen for nine years. She is married to a farmer and has three children. The couple works together to have a better way of living and to send their children into higher level of education.

Razel's spouse is a supportive and responsible man. She is thankful to God because despite the difficulties and hardship she has encountered in her life, she is still able to stand up with courage to surpass all those things. For now, one of her children has gotten married at early age while the other two are still studying. She desires to let them finish their studies so they can find better opportunities someday.

Razel plans to increase the merchandise she offers at school so she can earn better profits, which will serve her family needs including the education of her children and be able to provide the farm supplies of her rice field. With regards to this matter, she ask for a loan of PHP 10,000. She knows that she could attain her goals in life through the unending financial support provided by the lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients of pancit, soft drinks, assorted biscuits, candies, and breads for her school-based store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II y tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de una hija. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace un año y es dueña de una empresa de lácteos. Ella dice que le gusta ser parte de FINCA Perú porque allí le ayudan prestándole capital de trabajo que puede invertir en su negocio, también participa de las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal donde se motiva a seguir trabajando además tiene el cariño de sus compañeras. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos lácteos para venderlos en su negocio.
texts.en: Gloria is a member of the communal bank Unión II.  She is 28 and the mother of a daughter.  For a year she has been a member of FINCA Perú and she has a dairy products company.  She says she likes being part of FINCA Perú because there they lend her working capital for her business.  She also particpates in training through her communal bank, and is motivated to continue working.  She has also found friendship with the other members.  The loan she is requesting is to buy dairy products to sell through her business.

loans.use: To buy dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es: Ros Meri de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera; tiene a su única hija Naydelin de 09 años, a quien desea brindar un buen futuro; Ros Meri habita en su propia que compro gracias a su trabajo cotidiano. La actividad que realiza la señora Ros Meri, es de mucha paciencia y brindar buena atención a su clientela. Ella tiene un negocio donde vende bebidas y productos de comestible. Su trabajo lo realiza sola hace 02 años y siempre tiene ingresos, sobre todo en la venta de bebidas, ya que el lugar donde habita es un lugar muy calido. Con el préstamo que obtuvo, gracias los financieros podrá incrementar mas comestibles en su tienda y de esa manera seguirá continuando con su trabajo. Este es su crédito número 07, una vez mas agradece a los financieros porque son personas que apoyan para que continúe con su negocio. en su banco comunal, es una socia responsable y activa. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles mas sus ganancias seguirá abasteciéndose de mercadería como: cereales bebidas, verduras, etc.
texts.en:
Ros Meri, 39, is a single mother and has a nine-year-old daughter, Naydelin, for whom she wants to provide a good future.  Ros Meri lives in the house she bought with money earned through her daily work.  She has a job that requires much patience and good customer service.  Her business is selling beverages and food products.  For two years she has been working alone, earning an income especially from the sale of beverages, since the place where she lives is very hot.  

With the loan she has obtained, and thanks to the lenders, she will be able to buy more food for her store and continue working.  This is her seventh loan and, once again, she is grateful to lenders because they are people who keep her in business.  She is a responsible, active member of her communal bank.  The 3,000 PEN loan, plus her profits, will be used to buy more merchandise such as cereals, beverages, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: To buy cereal, beverages and vegetables.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina started raising hogs in 2008 and has five today. She has spent most of her time running this kind of business. This time, she currently raised four for fattening. Rizalina is married and has two children; the eldest is a college student while her youngest is in her secondary level of education. She said maintaining a good attitude and wise management of her business has been the key to obtaining success in life. Besides business, Rizalina also plants vegetables in her backyard. She really loves what she does and finds it satisfying. For now, Rizalina struggles due to a shortage of capital from the expenses of her college student and increased household expenses. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 allowing her to buy stock hog feed and an additional three piglets, so she can increase her profits and be able to have a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and hog feed for her raised hogs.

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en: Theary is a 35-year-old mother of a schoolchild and is a permanent citizen and farmer from Siem Reap Province's Kror Lanh district. The rice cultivation on one and half hectares of farmland, from which she is able to generate income for her daily basic needs, enables her to earn about KHR 20,000 per day. It is the business that she has been in for 15 years. This is a new loan cycle for Theary as well as her co-member with VisionFund (Kiva's partner); both are in the same group in which Theary is the leader. They are requesting the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. For Theary, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to further improve her business and increase her household's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice field.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married and lives in the town of Tiribe. She has made her living selling clothing for more than 20 years. She has a well-established clientele, which is a great help. She has been a client of Yehu since 2011, and thanks to the help she has received from them, she has been able to keep her business growing.

Bahati has a store in which she sells new clothing. Her challenge is credit defaulters who take her goods on credit. She is requesting the loan to purchase trousers, skirts, t-shirts, footwear and blouses, which will help her to stock her business and to continue filling her customers' requests.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, skirts, t-shirts, footwear and blouses.

loans.name: Samson   Kasuu

texts.en: Samson is 79 years old, married, with five children. He operates a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for twenty years. In addition, he does farming to supplement his income. He has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy goats to slaughter.

loans.use: To buy goats to slaughter.

loans.name: Gerelt-Od

texts.en:
Mr Gerelt-Od is 32 years old, not married, and lives with his parents in the western province of Mongolia. His parents are retired and live on a pension. Because his parents were elderly, Mr Gerelt-Od left secondary school and became a herder. He has experience as a driver, because he needed to drive cars and trucks in the countryside. He has since moved, with his parents, to the center of the province. 

Now he plans to his open a transportation business and he has decided to purchase a truck. In Mongolia it is possible to buy a truck for 7,000,000 MNT. He has sold his livestock for 4,000,000 MNT, but he still needs a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase the truck. Although Mr Gerelt-Od has a limited education, he is a hardworking man.
