Last year, he built his private house with four rooms.

loans.use: To purchase a truck.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has been a hog-raiser for more than five years. This time, she raised one fattening because she had disposed of her other hogs. Her family's main source of income comes primarily from her farming and hog raising business.

Irene's gained profits are used for their daily household expenditures including an allowance for her youngest child, maintenance to her rice field, and she put up her home-based store. She is really glad and thankful to God for all the blessings she receives that pushes her to strive harder to be a better entrepreneur someday.

Irene would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 allowing her to buy stock hog feed, and some amount will be use to purchase various kinds of merchandise. She hopes to get this loan amount in order to save and educate her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy stock hog feed and some amount will be use to purchase various kinds of groceries for her retail store.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley said gardening is a great source of exercise; it gives the sense of excitement when they begin to bear flowers and it helps us to relax her and free her from stresses in life. She currently grows vegetables such as eggplant, string beans, okra, and bitter gourd on her 3,000 square meter vegetable plot. Aside from growing vegetables in her backyard, Shirley is also engaged in a hog-raising business.

Shirley is married and has two grown-up children. Both of her children have settled for marriage and are living separately with their spouses. Right now, she spent most of her time in raising her vegetables because she would like to succeed and become a better entrepreneur someday. Everyday, she wakes up early in the morning to water the plants and clean its surroundings to be able to avoid insects and pest that attack it, which allows them to produce good flowers and fruits. Sometimes, Shirley sells her vegetables house-to-house and through contact buyers from other towns and near her village.

Shirley would like to take out for a loan amount of PHP 10,000 allowing her to buy additional vegetables to sell within her local community. She hopes that she can satisfy her costumer demand and be able to encourage more buyers for her vegetables. In this way, she could obtain a stable source of income and improve their way of living.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables such as cabbages and carrots for her vending activity.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a hog-raiser from Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for three years now. Hog raising is a booming business venture in the country. Corazon plans to expand her business, but lacks the financial resources to do so. That is why she joined CEVI to gain access to the financial support offered by the organization to small investors like Corazon. As of this time, she is requesting a loan worth PHP 7,000 to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. In the future, Corazon dreams of seeing her business become sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: David   Masai

texts.en: David is a hardworking 50-year-old business man. He is married and has three children who are in school. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for eight years and employs one person. In addition, he does farming to supplement his income. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 35,000 KES to buy rice, sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Peter  Kilonzo

texts.en: Peter is 36 years old and married with four children who are in school. He sells household products like kettles, basins, plates, and cups to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for ten years and has employed one person. Besides this, he does farming to generate more income. He dreams of owning a piece of land in the future. He has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy kettles, hotpots, plates and sufurias.

loans.use: To buy kettles, hotpots, plates, and sufurias.

loans.name: Nhean's Group

texts.en: Nhean is 42 years old, married and has three school-children. She and the rest of her family are living in Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province. For her children's sake, she earns a living through two hectares of corn-growing farmland. It has been 10 years since she has engaged in this business, and it earns her about KHR 25,000 per day. For Nhean, the main challenge for her business is low crop production due to the unpredictable weather issue, pests, and the declining price of corn. The past loan was her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). After the successful loan that has sustained a good living condition for her especially in providing decent food for her children, she has paid back the entire loan. Now, she is a leader in a group of two female members. She and her co-member are seeking the same loan amount of KHR 1,000,000 each. For her loan portion, she will use it to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides for her crops. She expects a larger yield and to receive a high profit so as she can keep supporting all of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new overlock machine for a sewing business and sewing materials.

loans.name: Fatou Thioubou

texts.fr: Fatou est une femme mariée.Elle a trois enfants.Elle vend au marché de sa localité des tissus et des chaussures d'enfants.Ce commerce lui permet de générer des revenus et de subvenir à ses propres besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de ses enfants.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter des tissus et des chaussures d'enfants et satisfaire ainsi la forte demande durant le période des fêtes.
texts.en: Fatou is a married woman. She has three children. She sells fabrics and children's shoes in her local market. This business allows her to make an income and to cover her own living expenses and those of her children. In order to increase her working capital, she is seeking a loan of 200,000f in order to purchase fabrics and children's shoes - so she will be able to meet the strong demand over the festive season.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and children's shoes.

loans.name: Himoidin

texts.en: Himoidin is 54 years old. He and his wife have six children. He is very hardworking and kind in nature. He has been farming for eight years, producing carrots, onions, and other crops. He has been in this line of work since 1998; all of his experience has been dedicated to producing vegetables and crops. His products are sold at the local market in the city. In order to provide his vegetables and crops with the needed attention, Himoidin is currently requesting another loan in the amount of USD 2,000 so that he can buy fertilizer and seeds to continue improving his vegetables and crop production. He hopes to generate more income and make a better standard of living and help his children continue their education.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Thai's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Cambodia, Thai is a 62-year-old mother of four children who are paid workers. She has struggled in earning a daily living from her three hectares area of paddy-planting which is her primary source of income. Additionally, she grows pineapples on another small plot of land to add to her income. It has been 10 years that she has been in this business and she is able to earn almost 19,000 KHR per day. 

Thai is a new client with Kiva's partner. The other member of her group is also a first-time client. She is applying for 1,000,000 KHR and her co-member is seeking 500,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her portion to buy eight sacks of fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to get a high yield from her business so she can set aside some money to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her crop-planting business.

loans.use: To buy eight sacks of fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 56, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ramiro, her business partner, and she is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen operates a buy and sell business. She buys gold scrap and old notes then sells them to collectors. She also buys and sells jewelry. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Helen dreams of being able to give her family a good life through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gold and silver things needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 49, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Pedro and is the mother of their children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilou operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 27,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilou hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chiboya

texts.en:
Chiboya is a newly married man with a beautiful wife but no children yet. He works hard to make sure that he provides his wife with all she needs. He opened his grocery store four years ago in order to support his household expenses. The lack of capital has been one of the biggest problems over the years, and one of his dreams is to own a wholesale shop in the future.

Chiboya has worked hard all his life but in the last few years and today more than ever he wants to expand his business in order to fulfill his dream, thinking of his family. This investment in his store will allow him to generate more profit through buying and selling merchandise. We hope that Chiboya is able to achieve his goals through this opportunity. With this loan, he will be able to add stock of flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to add a stock of flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sothhor's Group

texts.en:
Sothhor, a father of one son, is 62 years old and a rural villager from Moung Russey district's Battambang Province. He has been working on his half-hectare of farmland to provide daily sustenance to his household. It is a business which adds additional income to what he gets from his current occupation as a public worker in the government district office in a local area. He has been engaged in this business for 10 years and can earn almost 14,000 KHR per day. 

Sothhor joined VisionFund one cycle ago and has paid back the entire loan with success. As a result, he can better support his family compared to before the loan. Now he is in a group consisting of two male members. The other member has just joined VisionFund (Kiva's partner) this cycle. Sothhor is applying for 1,200,000 KHR and his member is seeking 1,000,000 KHR. For Sothhor as a leader, he will use his portion to buy eight sacks of fertilizer for his farmland. He expects to reap a larger profit from his cash-crop so he can build a new concrete house for his family.

loans.use: To buy eight sacks of fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is Merly, 39, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Roy, a driver, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Merly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Merly hopes to grow her business and dreams of sending all her children to school through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Muthuku   Ndambuki

texts.en: Muthuku is 52 years old, married, and with five children who are in school. He operates a retail shop in a busy environment to earn a living. He has been in this business for ten years. Besides, he does crop farming to generate additional income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to start another business. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy sugar, maize, beans and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mahmadyunus

texts.en:
Mahmadyunus is married and has eight children for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that 20 years ago he began his own driving business. Thanks to the good services he provides, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving and now his children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. 

He is asking for a loan to repair his lorry. In this way his business will be able to provide better services which will increase his income, allowing him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his lorry.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Bendu from Torkpoi town Southern area in Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 15 and 20. Her children are going to school and she also has two relatives at home.

Bendu runs a clothes business; she sells suitcases, baskets, wax cotton and female dresses. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works in the business 12 hours a day and 7 days per week.  She also earns income from the sale of wood. At present she is facing a problem of heavy rain in her province.

Bendu has requested a loan in order to buy more items like suitcases, baskets, wax cotton and female dresses. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more items like suitcases, baskets, wax cotton and female dresses.

loans.name: Nchadze

texts.fr: Nchadze est un homme de 35 ans célibataire sans enfants. il commerçant a ouvert et gère une mini alimentation depuis 4 ans dans laquelle elle commercialise les produits de premières necessité et crédit de communication. Il achète les marchandises qu'il revend en petite quantité dans sa boutique et est obligé d'aller au marché tout le temps. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement sa clientèle grandissante en achetant en cartons pour détailler (un sac de riz un carton de savon et des friandises et le crédit de communication) et lui évitera les allez et venus mais aussi augmentera son profit. Les benéfices générés par ce crédit seront épargnés et réinvestis dans sa boutique pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Nchadze is a 35 year old single man without children. He is a business trader; he runs a convenience store which he opened 4 years ago, in which he sells basic essentials and telephone credit. He buys the products that he resells in small quantities and is therefore obliged to go to the market very frequently.
This loan will not only allow him to meet the needs of his growing customer base by enabling him to buy boxes of goods for resale (namely a bag of rice, a box of soap, sweets and telephone credit), it will allow him to avoid the comings and goings and to increase his profit.
The profits generated by this loan will be saved and invested in his shop in order for it to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of rice, a box of soap, some sweets and telephone talk-time credit for resale.

loans.name: Boniface  Mutua

texts.en:
Boniface is 52 years old and married with five children who are in school. He does crop farming to earn a living. He also keeps and sells livestock to generate more income. He has engaged in this business for three years. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to manage his business because he has been trained in business management skills. He dreams of becoming a large-scale farmer in the future. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a goat and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy a goat and fertilizers.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
A humble farmer living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia, Heang is a 61-year-old widowed mother of five children, two of whom have their own employment (one is a security guard while the other one works at one company in local area). Heang struggles to earn a living through growing vegetables such as garlic and cucumber. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn around KHR 20,000 per day and manage to save approximately KHR 8,000 each day after daily expenses. Small crops, caused by destructive floods is a main challenge for her vegetable-planting business. 

This is Heang’s fourth microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past three loans have helped her better support her household consumption and build on her saving for future needs. Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund of US$ 1,300. Heang is going to use this loan to buy a proper motorbike for her children to commute to work. She hopes this loan will help her family especially her children to save their transportation expenses and maintain their lifestyle. Therefore, she will no longer have to worry about her children's transportation and she will be able to pay more attention to her current business.

loans.use: To buy a proper motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Pashua  Wambui

texts.en: Pashua is a hardworking business lady with two children. She distributes soft drinks to retail shops to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business since the year 2006 and employs three people to help her. In addition, she generates extra income from her rental houses. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to keep her business records since she has been trained on business management skills. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to expand her business premises.

loans.use: To expand her business premises.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia  is a fishmonger in Akotokyire. She has been selling fish for three years now. Emelia is a single parent with five dependents. As a single parent, she is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying the school fees of her children. 

She will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to sell. With the additional profit, Emilia hopes to sell even more fresh fish in larger quantities.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba sells fabric and African print cloth in Akotokyire. She has been in this business for 25 years. Araba is a single parent and has four children. She feeds, clothes and pays the fees of her children with her income. 

She will use her loan to purchase fabrics and African printed cloth for sale. With the new profit, Araba will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and African printed cloth to sell.

loans.name: Polin's Group

texts.en:
Polin is a citizen from Mongkul Borey district's Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is a widow and mother of four children.  Her main business is paddy cultivation while selling desserts is her supplementary business, from which she is able to strive to support herself daily. She can earn about 25,500 KHR per day. One cycle ago, Polin joined VisionFund as a first-time borrower. She has used previous loans with success in order to maintain a good pace of  business and improve the family's livelihood. 

She is now in a group of two members. She and her fellow group member are taking a loan of 500,000 KHR and 300,000 KHR, respectively. As a group leader, she will use her portion buy four sacks of fertilizer for the rice field and use a small portion of it to buy a traditional flour mill for her dessert-selling business. She expects to maximize income from the current business so she will not only be able to upgrade her standard of living but also to save some money to buy a mini-tractor for her farm.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer and a traditional flour mill.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Mariama from Southern area in Bo. She is married with four children between the ages of 14 years and 20 years. Two of her children attend school. She began her business after the war because she had no money and needed a way to feed her children.
 
Mariama runs a cookery business from her house; she sells local food like beans rice, cassava leaf rice and pure water. She has been running this business for nine years. She works at the business every day. She starts preparing the food at 4:30am and doesn't rest until the food is finished. Her other source of income comes from the sales of palm oil. At present she is faced with a problem of insufficient capital to run her business.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items such as bags of rice, Maggie, salt and vegetable oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her cookery business. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items such as bags of rice, Maggie, salt and vegetables.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
At 33 years of age, Jacob has a business buying and selling goats for slaughter. He is married and has six children, four of whom are currently attending primary school. Despite the fact that Jacob works more than six hours every day of the week to move his resources forward and increase his earnings, he does not have enough goats to generate greater earnings. 

For this reason, through Yehu, he is requesting a loan from Kiva to be able to buy more goats for sale and in turn, increase his earnings. In this way he will be able to give his children a more dignified life and fulfill his dream of owning a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is a hairdresser. She owns the beauty salon at Akotokyir near Cape Coast. She is married with three children. Gifty has been a hairdresser for a year now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. Gifty will use her loan to purchase creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer  for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Esther

texts.fr: Esther une jeune femme de 36 ans, célibataire et mère de 04 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 à 10 ans, trois de ses enfants vont déjà à l'école.Elle gère un petit centre d'appels téléphonique(call box) dans un quartier de la capitale  depuis 5 ans et tient également une petite échoppe dans laquelle elle dans lequel elle commercialise aussi les cigarettes et friandises .Elle s'approvisionne en crédit de communication auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques en moyenne 02 fois par semaine.Mais cependant,la demande de crédit et d'appel étant de plus en plus croissante,elle a du mal a satisfaire sa clientèle car son capital ne lui permet pas de s'approvisionner convenablement ce qui cause de constantes ruptures de stock et la perte progressive de sa clientèle.Elle sollicite dont ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner plus en crédit de communication, cigarettes et friandises ce qui lui permettra de retenir et accroître sa clientèle et par conséquent ses bénéfices.Bénéfices qui seront  réinvestis dans sa petite échoppe afin de l'agrandir,mais également de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Esther is a young single woman, 36 years old and the mother of four children, whose ages vary between 2 and 10 years old. Three of her children already attend school. She has been running a small telephone call centre (a "call box") in the capital city for five years, and she also has a small shop where she sells cigarettes and candy as well. She buys her mobile phone credit from the phone operators on average twice a week; however, as the demand for the credit is always increasing, she has trouble meeting all her customers' requests. This is because her working capital is insufficient to allow her to restock quickly enough; which causes her to be frequently out of stock, and to progressively lose her customer base.
Therefore, she is seeking this loan in order to be able to increase her purchase of mobile phone credit, cigarettes and candy - this will allow her to retain and grow her customer base, and as a result, her profits. These profits will be invested back into the shop in order to grow it, but some will also be used to cover the family's living expenses.

loans.use: to increase her stock of telephone credit, cigarettes and candy.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa sells soap in Akotokyire near Abura. She has been selling soap for 13 years now. Her husband is a pensioner and has four children, who are in school. Yaa uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. 

She needs this loan to purchase boxes of soap for sale. With the new profit, Yaa will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap for sale.

loans.name: Fatou Binetou

texts.fr: Fatou Binetou est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de six enfants dont deux fréquentent l'école primaire.Elle vend depuis près de trois ans, des produits cosmétiques.Elle achète en gros dans la capitale et revend en détail à ses clients.Elle parvient ainsi avec ses revenus à prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants.Elle sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter des lait de beauté et du parfum.
texts.en: Fatou Binetou is a married woman. She is the mother of six children, two of whom attend primary school. She has sold cosmetic products for nearly three years. She buys in bulk in the capital city, and retails in smaller quantities to her customers. With the income she manages to cover her living expenses and those of the children. She is requesting a loan of 200,000f in order to purchase body creams and perfume.

loans.use: to purchase body creams and perfume.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Babacar est un homme marié.Il vend des chaussures au marché de sa localité.Son commerce lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et aux dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter 10 douzaines de chaussures.
texts.en: Babacar is a married man. He sells shoes at his local market. His business generates an income which enables him to meet his needs and cover his family's living expenses. He is requesting a loan of 250 000 francs so that he can buy 10 dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.use: to buy ten dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Rosine Chantal

texts.fr: une jeune femme de 31 ans fiancée, mère d'un enfant de 4 ans qui va à l'école. elle a aussi deux autre s personnes à sa charge. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis 4 ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence des mèches, et greffes et defrisants en gamme dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail . Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter les mèches, défrisantsen gamme . Ceci lui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
[Rosine Chantal] is a young 31-year-old fiancée and a mother of a 4-year-old child who goes to school. She also cares for two other people. 

After her training, Rosine Chantal opened a hair salon. She has been running this salon for four years already. 

She often deals with a lack of hair extensions, hair weaves, and different hair relaxers in her business, because she buys these products on a retail basis. 

She is asking for this loan so she can buy hair extensions, [hair weaves], and a range of hair relaxers. This will help her achieve her goals of satisfying her customers and increasing profits. Profits gained from this loan will help Rosine Chantal meet her and her family's needs. Also, profits will be saved to help expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair weaves, and a range of hair relaxers

loans.name: Dieudonné

texts.fr: Dieudonné est un jeune homme de 26 fiancé, père d'un enfant de un an. il a aussi deux autres personnes à sa charge.IL est mécanicien et vend en même temps les vélos et pièces détachés dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 2 ans. Son petit commerce fonctionne mais il manque de capital pour augmenter les stocks de marchandises d'où la necessité de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter 4 vélos et les pièces de rechange. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc son bénéfices qu'il épargnera pour réinvestir dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Dieudonné is a young 26-year-old man, who is engaged to be married and father to a 1-year-old child. He also has a further two other people under his care. He works as a mechanic, and also sells bicycles and spare parts in a neighborhood in the capital, which he has done for the past two years. 

Dieudonné’s small business works well, but he lacks the capital he needs to increase his stock of merchandise. This is why he needs this loan, which will allow him to buy four bicycles and spare parts. This will increase his sales and, consequently, his profits, which he will save to reinvest in expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy four bicycles and spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for goods for retailing.

loans.name: Hélène Nadège

texts.fr: Nadège est une jeune femme de 27 ans fiancée mère de 1 enfant d 14 ans qui va à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans le domaine de la restauration depuis 1 ans. Grâce à son accueil chaleureux et à la bonne qualité des plats proposés,et surtout aux prix pratiqués, elle a acquis une clientèle considérable et de plus en plus exigente.La petitesse de son chiffre d' affaires ne lui permet plus de satisfaire les doléances variées de la clientele. en effet,ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter les casiers de boisson et les aliments(cartons de poisson, sac de riz et les ingrédients)afin de diversifier et augmenter les quantités de ses denrées alimentaires entrant dans la composition de ses plats, de satisfaire sa clientèle mais aussi d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Hélène Nadège is a young, 27-year-old woman who is engaged, and the mother of a 14-year-old child who goes to school. She has been a restaurateur for one year. Thanks to her to warm welcome and the good quality of the food she sells, and especially the prices she charges, she has built up a considerable customer base which is becoming more and more demanding. Her small turnover does not enable her to address the various complaints of her clientèle. This loan will enable her to buy cases of drinks and food (cartons of fish, bags of rice and other ingredients for meals) so that she can diversify and increase the quantity of the ingredients she puts in her meals, in order to satisfy her customers and also to increase her profit margin. She will reinvest part of her profits into her business in order to expand it, and the rest will enable her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy food (bags of rice, cartons of fish), cases of drinks and the ingredients necessary to prepare breakfast.

loans.name: Mohamadou

texts.fr: Mohamadou est un jeune homme de 22ans, fiancé sans enfants. Il est commerçant dans un quartier de la capitale où il vend des pièces détachées depui 2ans. Grace à son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine, il s'est fait une clientèle grandissante au fil du temps. IL sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra donc d'acheter les pièces détachées(les roues, batteries et cylindre...). Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d'étendre son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Mohamadou is a young 22-year-old man who is engaged and has no children. He is a retailer in a district of the capital where he has been selling spare parts for 2 years. Thanks to his dynamism and his expertise in this area, he has built up a growing customer base over time. He is requesting a loan which will enable him to buy spare parts (wheels, batteries, cylinders, etc.). The profits generated will allow him to expand his business and meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts (wheels, batteries, cylinders).

loans.name: Aloyinou Group

texts.fr: ALOYINOU est un groupe de seize personnes, dont les membres fréquentent la même église. La représentante du groupe, Cathérine Léontine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un pasteur du nom de Isidore. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cathérine Léontine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a quelques années que Cathérine Léontine exerce comme activité, la vente des tissus par le système de distribution. Cathérine Léontine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Cathérine Léontine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Cathérine Léontine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ALOYINOU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Aloyinou is a group of 16 people who all go to the same church. The group’s representative is called Cathérine Léontine (pictured with her hand raised in the photo). She is 52 years of age, and is married to a shepherd called Isidore. The couple has four dependent children, who are all at school. 

Cathérine Léontine and her husband live with their children, and provide for the household’s various expenses. For a few years Cathérine Léontine has worked selling fabrics via the distribution system. She is passionate about this business, which allows her to provide for herself and for her family. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. 

In order to ensure customer satisfaction and increase her working capital, Cathérine Léontine has requested her first loan along with the other members of the Aloyinou group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ requests, as well as to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza is married with five children. All her children go to school. 

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for more than five years. She has applied for a loan of 600000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  

She generates additional income through poultry farming and works from her home. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis and works six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her movements. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to help in transportation. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expense  includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to  buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Don De Dieu Group

texts.fr: DON DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résidant dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Amivi Florence (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est marié  un électricien du nom de David. Amivi Florence est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Amivi Florence vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Amivi Florence n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de cinq ans que Amivi Florence mène comme activité la vente des boissons, des fournitures scolaires et divers produits vivriers à son domicile. Amivi Florence mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Amivi Florence s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Amivi Florence sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DON DE DIEU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Don de Dieu (Gift from God) is a group of three people, who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative is called Amivi Florence (pictured with her hand raised in the photo). She is 44 years of age, and is married to an electrician called David. She has three dependent children, all of whom go to school. 

Amivi Florence lives with her children and her husband, and the couple ensures that the various household expenses are covered. Amivi Florence did not go to school, and for almost five years she has worked selling drinks, school supplies, and various food items from home. She has this business so that she can contribute to paying the household expenses, and she gets her supplies in Benin. 

In order to ensure customer satisfaction, Amivi Florence has requested a third loan alongside the members of the Don de Dieu group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ needs, as well as to make more profits. Their prior loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy drinks, school supplies and various food items.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is a 56-years-old married woman and a mother of eight children from the town of Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. She has run a motorcycle transport business for more than six years now. She and her husband also tend a small rice farm. These are the sources of their income for the needs of the family especially for the school expenses of their children.

Norberta gives her best to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Norberta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services offered by the organization to some entrepreneurs who want to make their business grow and become sustainable. Norberta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. At this time, she is asking to take out another loan worth 21000 PHP to buy fuel and spare parts for the motorcycle and for the continuous expansion of their ventures. 

In the future, Norbeta has hopes of experiencing the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Mayramkhon

texts.en:
Mayramkhon is 42 years old, a divorcée, and has three children. She sells cloth and women clothes in the local market. She has many customers and develops her business year by year. Last year she could not withstand the business challenges. 

To improve her business, Mayramkhon is requesting a loan of 3000 USD from Imon International, to buy cloth for resale. She is hoping for the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: to buy cloth for resale.

loans.name: Noudehou 1 Group

texts.fr: NOUDEHOU 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à une même  famille. La représentante du groupe, Ayomassè dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans. Ayomassè est mariée à un certain Nestor. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Ayomassè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quatre ans que Ayomassè mène comme activité la vente du haricot, du maïs et de la farine de manioc. Ayomassè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Ayomassè s’approvisionne dans certaines régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Ayomassè sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe NOUDEHOU 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés
texts.en:
Noudehou 1 is a group of 3 people, who are all members of the same family. The representative of the group, Ayomassè (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 46 years old. She is married to a man named Nestor. The couple has two children. Both children have been to school and are still under their parents' care. In addition to their own children, the couple also takes care of another child. The couple lives together with the children, and they provide for the needs of their household together. Ayomassè did not go to school. 

Ayomassè has been selling beans, corn, and manioc flour for almost four years. Ayomassè procures her goods from areas in Benin. She conducts her business passionately, and this is what allows her to meet her family's needs.

In order to satisfy her customers, Ayomassè is requesting this loan with the other members of the Noudehou 1 group. This loan will help them better respond to customer requests and increase profits. Their previous loans have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, and manioc flour

loans.name: Marie Nadine

texts.fr: Marie est une femme mariée de 31ans.Elle a 03 enfants.Elle est couturiére  mixte dans la ville de kribi ou coud depuis 02ans.Grace à son dynamisme et sa compétence dans ce domaine, elle s'est faire une clientèle grandissante au fil du temps.Elle solicite un crédit qui lui permettra donc d'acheter une machine a surfiler des habilles.Cette machine lui facilitera la tâche et surtout améliorer son travail.Les bènefices que cette machine l'apportera va l'aider d'etendre son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Marie is a 31-year-old married woman, who has three children. She has worked as a dressmaker for men and women in the town of Kribi for the past two years. Thanks to her dynamic nature and skills in this area, she has built up a growing customer base over time.

Marie has requested a loan so that she can buy a machine to oversew her clothing. This machine will make her job easier and, above all, improve her work. The profits that this machine will generate will help her to expand her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy an oversewing machine.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Don Felipe tiene 32 años, nació  en la provincia Carrasco del departamento de Cochabamba, estudio hasta quinto básico, desde niño ayudo a sus padres en la agricultura, tiene bastante experiencia el rubro de producción de banano, hace 9 años que trabaja de forma independiente tiene sus propias parcelas para producción, aun principio le fue  dificultoso independizarse porque no contaba con recursos económicos para el inicio de la actividad, la ayuda que le brindaba su padre con mano de obra no le abastecía, debido a que desde un principio él se propuso comenzar con 5 has., de pronto pensó en sacar un préstamo, para mejorar su producción de banano hay que mantener con la aplicación de fertilizantes ya sea químico u orgánico, esto dependiendo de los años de producción que tienen las plantas, es por tal razón que él solicita un préstamo para mantener la producción de banano, esto le ayudara  mantener sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Felipe is 32 years old. He was born in the province of Carrasco in the departament of Cochabamba. He went to school up to the fifth grade. Since he was a boy he helped his parents farm. He has a lot of experience growing bananas. He has worked independently for 9 years with his own land parcels. At first it was difficult to go off onhis own because he didn't have the financial resources to start the activity. The help his father gave him with the labor wasn't enough, because from the beginning he decided to start with 5 hectares. He decided to take out a loan. In order to improve his banana production, he has to apply fertilizer, chemical or organic, depending on how old each tree is. Tthat is why he is asking for a loan to maintain the banana production. This will help him to maintain his income.

loans.use: to buy chemical or organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: Rosalie est une jeune femme de 34 ans, mariée et mère de famille, .Elle gère un petit centre d'appels téléphonique(call box) dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 3 ans e .Elle s'approvisionne en crédit de communication auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques en moyenne 02 fois par semaine.Mais cependant,la demande de crédit et d'appel étant de plus en plus croissante,elle a du mal a satisfaire sa clientèle car son capital ne lui permet pas de s'approvisionner convenablement ce qui cause de constantes ruptures de stock et la perte progressive de sa clientèle.Elle sollicite dont ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner plus en crédit de communication,  ce qui lui permettra de retenir et accroître sa clientèle et par conséquent ses bénéfices.Bénéfices qui seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité afin de l'agrandir le reste lui permettra d'aider son époux  à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rosalie is a young 34-year-old woman, who is married and a mother. She runs a small call center (call box) in a neighborhood in the capital, and has done so for three years. She gets her call credit supplies from telephone operators on average twice a week. However, as the demand for call credit is growing, she finds it hard to satisfy her customers as her capital does not allow her to buy credit more often. This brings about constant stock shortages, and she has progressively lost some customers.

Rosalie has requested this loan so that she can buy supplies of call credit. This will allow her to retain and expand her customer base and, consequently, increase her profits. She will reinvest part of these profits in expanding her business, and the rest will allow her to help her husband to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To increase her call credit.

loans.name: Niyokindi Group

texts.fr:
Chantal fait partie du groupe  Niyokindi et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a  33 ans et est mariée à  Célestin, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de  3  à 14 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique(haricot, riz,sel,...)  depuis  4ans. 
Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz,sel,...), à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait voir sa famille prospérer.
texts.en:
Chantal is part of the Niyokindi group, and lives in Bujumbura. She is 33 years of age, and is married to a driver called Célestin. Together the couple has four children, aged between 3 and 14.

Chantal has worked selling various items (beans, rice, salt) in a store for four years, and this is her sixth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she has applied for, she plans to increase her capital and buy lots of items for her store (beans, rice, salt), which she will resell to make more profits. Over the coming years, Chantal would like to see her family get ahead.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy lots of items for her store (beans, rice, salt), which she will resell to make more profits.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es:
Jorge, trabaja en un taller de reparación de bicicletas, es un joven emprendedor con experiencia en la reparación de bicicletas, está  ubicada en las afueras de su vivienda, los ratos que le quedan libres atiende un molino en el mismo lugar.
Nos ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de repuestos empaques, tubos, frenos, asientos, forros, entre otros, esto le permitirá atender las necesidades del usuario  y expandirse;   sus cliente son personas que vive  en las afueras de la zona.
Lo que  pretende con este crédito es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia puesto que es lo más primordial.
texts.en:
Jorge has a bicycle repair shop. He is a young entreprenuer with experience repairing bicycles. His shop is located outside his house. When he has free time, he tends to a mill that is located in the same place.

He has asked us for a loan to invest in buying replacement parts such as washers, tubes, brakes, seats, seatcovers and more. This will allow him to tend to the customers' needs and expand. His customers are people who live on the outskirts of town. What he intends on doing with this loan is improving his and his family's quality of life, which is the most important thing.

loans.use: to buy washers, tubes, brakes, seats, and seatcovers.

loans.name: Mwanachitu

texts.en: Mwanachitu, 48 years old, is a married man with 5 children, only one of whom is still underage. While his wife takes care of the house and does a little farming, Mwanachitu works buying and selling goats at the market.  He sells mostly to people buying for slaughter; this is how he supports his family. He considers the most difficult part of his work to be going to the villages looking for goats to buy and transporting them to the market for sale. Mwanachitu wants to invest in the purchase of more goats.  He wants to make a good investment to increase his income and thus improve his lifestyle. The expansion of this business is a step toward fulfilling his longing to improve conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more goats

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna  is married with three children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for five years.  She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.

Anna sells to all kinds of people but on retail only and she works seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land so as to build rental houses.  Anna has applied for a loan of 400000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Fredis Orlando

texts.es:
Fredis, se dedica a prestar servicio, con un molino de nixtamal, que funciona con combustible diesel, está casado, tiene un hijo de meses de edad, no tiene familia en el extranjero, el molino está ubicado en una zona rural, lo atiende de 6:00 de la mañana a las 3:00 de la tarde toda la semana.
 Nos ha solicitado un  crédito lo necesita para invertir en mejorar las instalaciones del molino, discos, fajas, tolvas,  para que  quede en condiciones más adecuadas y que el cliente pueda obtener un servicio de calidad, así poder subir  la  clientela.
El crédito contribuirá a mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredis works rendering services in a hominy mill, which runs on diesel. He is married, and has a baby who is just a few months old. He doesn’t have any family living abroad. The mill where Fredis works is located in a rural area, and he runs it from 6 am until 3 pm all week.

Fredis has requested a loan to invest in improving the mill's facilities. He will buy discs, belts and hoppers to improve the conditions, ensuring that his customers receive a better quality service. This will increase his customer numbers, and the loan will contribute to improving his income and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy discs, belts and hoppers.

loans.name: Fatbardha

texts.en:
Fatbardha is 44 and has three children.  They are 21, 15 and 13 years old and two of them attend school.  She has been a single mother for a  long time now and has gotten zero support (financial or otherwise) from the children’s father.  While she suffers from a slight autism, that hasn’t stopped her from raising the children, or working.

Fatbardha is talented at making straw/bamboo bags and she started this activity three years ago. It was difficult in the beginning, she explains, yet  very soon people took an interest in her artistic work and started to buy her products. 

Fatbardha now wants to buy raw material and for this she is requesting lenders' financial help. She would very much appreciate each and every one’s support.

loans.use: To purchase raw material (straw & bamboo) for her artistic bags

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella se posee un puesto de golosinas, bebidas, frutas entre otros, tiene varios años con el pequeño negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el puesta esta ubicado en una zona con alta circulación de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija pues la prefieren porque saben que comercia producto de calidad, a buenos precios y sobre todo con excelente servicio; Catalina es una mujer activa, luchadora, honesta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, cada día se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de si porque sabe que así lograra el éxito, como toda comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, fruta, bebidas etc. Catalina tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Catalina is 44 years of age, and lives with her three children in her own home. She owns a store where she sells items such as candies, drinks and fruit, and has had this small business for several years. This has given her lots of valuable experience, which has allowed her to earn more profits.

Catalina’s stall is located in an area where there are lots of people. She has built up a large, regular customer base, as they prefer to come to her as they know she sells quality products at good prices. Most of all, she provides an excellent service. Catalina is an active woman, who is hardworking, honest, and with a strong desire to get ahead. Every day she strives to give her best, as she knows that this is the way to succeed. 

Like any retailer, Catalina wants to expand her business. This is why she has requested a loan from Integral, which will allow her to buy candies, fruit, drinks and so on. Catalina has good payment references, and is sure that she will be able to repay her loan. She is also confident that she will be able to give her family a well-rounded life.

loans.use: To buy candies, fruit and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn wholesale

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: EVA TIENE 37 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UNA MUJER CASADA Y TIENE UN HIJO. SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UNA MAQUILADORA DE LA CIUDAD Y ELLA REALIZA DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON LAS NECESIADES DE SU HOGAR. DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU DOMICILIO NEGOCIO CON EL CUAL ELLA PUEDE ADQUIRIR OTRO INGRESO PARA AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA CON LOS GASTOS QUE SE LES PRESENTAN. ELLA DESEA PODER AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA PARA QUE TENGAN UN MEJOR INGRESO ECONOMICO POR ESTA RAZON AYUDA EN SU COLONIA A LLEVAR A LOS NIÑOS A LA ESCUELA Y GRACIAS A ESTO OBTIENE UN INGRESO EXTRA TRANSPORTANDO A DIFERENTES NIÑOS A LA ESCUELA. ADEMAS VIO LA NECESIDAD DE ALGUNAS DE SUS VECINAS QUE SOLICITABAN SU AYUDA PARA CUIDAR A SUS HIJOS, POR TAL MOTIVO ELLA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA POR LAS TARDE A CUIDAR NIÑOS Y GRACIAS A ESTO ELLA PUEDE OBTENER UN POCO MAS DE INGRESO QUE BENEFICIA A SU FAMILIA. YA QUE EVA SIEMPRE A BUSCADO LA MANERA DE MANTENERSE ACTIVA Y PRODUCTIVA. POR TAL MOTIVO ELLA AHORA QUIERE RALIZAR LA INVERSION DE SU NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES PORQUE TIENE EL DESEO DE HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y LOGRAR MANTENER SATISFECHOS A SUS CLIENTES. POR ESTA RAZON ACUDE A LA SOLICITUD DE UN PRESTAMO PARA LLEVAR A CABO LA COMPRA DE MAS MERCANCIA CON LA CUAL PUEDA SURTIR BIEN SU TIENDA.
texts.en:
Eva is 37 years of age, married, and has one son. Her husband works in an assembly plant in the city, and she does different things to help her husband with the household needs. For the past eight years Eva has had a small grocery store in her home, and this gives her a further source of income to help with the family expenses. 

Eva wants to be able to help her family have more financial income. She therefore helps in her neighborhood by taking various local children to school, and this gives her additional income. She also saw that some of her neighbors were requesting help to look after their children. As a result, Eva now also works in the evenings looking after children, and this has given her a little more income which she uses to help her family. 

Eva has always looked for a way to keep herself active and productive. This is why she now wants to invest in her small grocery store, as she wants to expand her business and keep her customers satisfied. She has therefore requested a loan, so that she can buy more merchandise and stock her store well.

loans.use: To buy products for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with five children, and only four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She sells to all categories of people on both a retail and wholesale basis and works six days a week.  

She generates additional income through rental rooms and selling firewood. Her major business challenge includes transportation and defaulters. She is hoping to sell on a wholesale basis only and also to buy a delivery van to ease transportation.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
This is Mylene. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mylene dreams of being able to see her child graduate from college. She also dreams of expanding her business someday and making it a grocery store. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products for her business.

loans.name: Munhnasan

texts.en:
Mrs. Munhnasan is 45 years old and lives with her husband in a new winter house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Byambasuren and he helps in her business. Her children live separately. 

She started her own sewing service business in 2003 and she now has many regular customers. She operates this business in a rented space, and her monthly income is 500,000 - 1,000,000 MNT. Her husband built their winter house this summer. 

Mrs. Munhnasan is requesting a 2,600,000 MNT loan to purchase heat retention materials for her house. She is a modest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To purchase heat retention materials for her house.

loans.name: Saiah

texts.en:
Saiah, 45, is single and lives at West Point with her three children who are between the ages of 3 and 12.  She would like to give the best education to her children, but lacks financial support. 

For the past ten years she has been selling nails, hammers, door locks, hinges and painting brushes. She is proud of her business because with the profits she can buy more goods and attend to the needs of her children. 

She has requested this loan to purchase more nails, hammers, door locks and hinges to improve her sales. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more nails, hammers, door locks and hinges to improve her sales.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose, 28, spends most of her time in trade. She is married and from her marriage has four children. Her husband is a day laborer and also a farmer, and they own the house in which they live.

She helps her husband with the household expanses through the sale of mats, which she sells at the market. This loan will be used to buy more mats and baskets to increase her stock. Her goal is to expand her business and open a kiosk in the near future. She looks forward to your support.

loans.use: to buy more mats and baskets to increase her stock

loans.name: Fatuma Ta

texts.en:
Fatuma Ta is 37 years old and is a single mother with three children. They are aged between 9 and 15, are currently in school, and live with her in West Point.

Fatuma Ta sells children's slippers and ladies slippers in the open square market. She has been involved in this business for the past fifteen years, since she is the only provider for her children. She started the business with initial capital given to her by a friend. She likes her business because it allows her to meet the needs of her children and it gives her independence.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more children's slippers and ladies' slippers for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase children's slippers and ladies' slippers for resale.

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.en: Bargigul is 47 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her children. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry when her children were little. Her husband helps her with the business. She requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 USD to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Samin

texts.en: Samin is so grateful to both Yehu and Kiva for the support given. Since the previous loan, Samin has a good testimony that her business has been doing well. Demand for more goods to offer has risen and she does not want to let her customers down. This is the main reason for her requesting a new loan from Kiva through Yehu so as to increase her merchandise. With this loan, she intends to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions, dry fish and vegetables. Her dream is to see her children educated and have quality lives. Her business goal is to see it expand and have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions, dry fish and vegetables

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana, 55, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Noel, an employee, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Susana operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this, she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,200 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Susana hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for hog feeds needed in her business

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is in his early sixties and has two grown-up children. He was considered below the poverty level some years back by the Area Development Programs of World Vision Albania and has been helped by them ever since. Now that the two organizations, the VisionFund Albania and World Vision Albania, are working together on improving the living conditions of these poor families, Shaban was selected to be part of the program and he is extremely happy.

Shaban wants to buy fifteen goats because livestock is something he has been doing for the last three years. Currently, he has some but he wants to add more to the herd.

Shaban sends many thanks to Kiva, VFA and WVA for all the support, financial and non-financial :)

loans.use: to add fifteen more goats to the existing herd

loans.name: Duo Pacorral Group

texts.es: Dúo Pacorral.  Este Dúo está integrado por la señora Flavia ella es originaria de aldea pacorral Tecpan Guatemala, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos  típicos, ella es madre soltera tiene una niña y desde hace varios años  se dedica a esta actividad ella vende sus tejidos en el mercado municipal de su localidad,  está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos.
texts.en: This group is called Dúo Pacorral, and one of its members is Flavia. She is from the village of Tecpan Guatemala, and works making traditional fabrics. She is a single mother, and has one daughter. Flavia has worked in this business for several years, and sells her wares in the local market. She has requested this loan to buy raw materials to make these traditional fabrics.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BARRIO LINDO”  iniciará el ciclo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de plásticos, venta de rellenos, tienda de barrio, costura de chamarras, artesanía en general, costura de polleras, tejido de mantas, salón de peluquería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que al presente es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de rellenos; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por referencias de su Tía a quien le apoyo y posteriormente ella se involucro al mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de herramienta (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la preparación lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The BARRIO LINDO community bank is entering its fourth round of funding as part of Pro Mujer, a division of the Panamericana Center.  The group has eight members, headed by a board.  Virginia is the president of the board.  The members operate a range of businesses that include: plastic sales; food sales; a corner grocery; tailoring services; general crafts; sewing businesses; and hairdressing services.

The loan will support small businesses.  Virginia tells us that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, after receiving an invitation to join from a friend.  She has a food business now.  She helped her aunt start the business and joined in to operate it later.  
 
Virginia will use the loan to buy the ingredients she needs (flour) to continue the business.  She will buy the flour from a market in El Alto, use it to make "relleno" and sell what she makes from a market stall.  The business provides her with the resources she needs to support her family.  She is married and has three children.  

When we asked Virginia what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the health and financial training the bank provides.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a 53-year-old Lebanese man who is married to Fatima. He lives with her and their four children, three of whom are attending school while the other one just started working.  

Radwan is trying his best to build a good future for his family. He’s responsible for covering his children’s study fees as well as all the heavy life expenses.  

Since 2000, he has been working in the construction field. He works on a freelance basis and has more than a few projects to accomplish. 

Today, Radwan intends to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools and construction supplies for his business. In this way, he will be able to start his new projects properly. Also, this Kiva loan will help him accomplish his work in a very short period of time. Radwan is an ambitious man who seeks better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and construction supplies for his business.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 29-year-old Lebanese single woman who lives with her parents and two siblings. She has been working on her own as a female hairdresser and beautician since 2005. She receives her customers at her home. She is very talented at her work and due to her friendly personality she has been able to attract a good number of customers. At the same time, Maya works at a local company to supplement her income. 

Maya would like to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new hairdressing tools and beauty supplies, and rent a small salon. In this way, she will be able to focus on one industry where she can properly attend to her clients and provide them with high quality services. She is very optimistic about the future and she hopes to expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and beauty supplies, and rent a small salon.

loans.name: Kobah

texts.en:
Kobah lives in West Point. She is 48, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 6 and 23. Her children are not in school because she lacks financial support. 

Kobah has been selling hinges, nails, paint brushes, and door locks for the past eight years. She learned to sell  from  her mother, and started in this business with a little capital that she received from her husband. She is now proud of her business because she makes a profit and with the profit she improves her business and contributes to her family. Kobah is requesting a loan to purchase more hinges, door locks, and nails for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more hinges, door locks, and nails for her business .

loans.name: Ubumwe / Rtg Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Jacques est le membre et le président du groupe Ubumwe / Rgt. Le nom du groupe signifie «Union ».Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 4 mois an à 4 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Il a 1 personne en charge autres que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Jacques est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jacques is a member and president of the Ubumwe/Rgt group, the name of which means “union”. He is 28 years of age, married, and has two children aged from 4 months to 4 years, both of whom are at school. He has one person under his care in addition to his children, and he studied six years of high school.

Jacques works growing rice, and this is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy fertilizers, as well as to pay the labor costs associated with his rice-growing business. To expand his business, he plans to request further loans to expand his rice-growing capacity. Over the coming years, he would like to become the best rice grower in his region. With the profit he earns, Jacques plans to pay for his children’s schooling and medical fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay the labor costs associated with his rice-growing business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina de 42 años de edad, es una mujer laboriosa; reside en su propia casa que compró junto a su esposo Julián de 41 años; en ella habita con sus 04 hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Saturnina, se dedica a la venta de raspadillas (hielo rasgado  con miel y refresco); esta labor lo realiza en el ovalo de su comunidad donde la mayoría  de la gente transita. 
Su labor empezó hace mas de 01 año y comenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, sobre todo en las temporadas de mucho calor; las dificultades que se presentan solo es en las temporadas de lluvia, ya que es ahí donde no sale a vender. Para ella su trabajo le es rentable porque en este Distrito es una zona calida y siempre degustan de una gran raspadilla para calmar el calor que se siente.
Con el préstamo obtenido comprará las necesidades que requiere para su trabajo. Este es su crédito número 02, se siente muy contenta por este apoyo que le brindan; asimismo agradece a sus socios por darles la oportunidad de trabajar responsablemente. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará vasos descartables, baldes para la venta de su refresco, miel para la preparación de su raspadilla.
texts.en:
Saturnina, 42, is a hard-working woman.  She and her husband, Julian, 41, live in a house that they bought together.  She has 4 children and wants to give them a good start in life.  Saturnina owns a drinks business, selling "raspadillas" (shaved ice with honey and cola).  She operates the business in the main plaza of her town because of the many passers-by there.
She has operated the business for more than a year now and says that she is happy with her progress.  Sales are especially good, she says, when the weather is hot.  Rain, on the other hand, is a problem for her because it drives away her customers.  It's normally hot here, though, and local people always want raspadillas to cool off.
Saturnina will use this loan to buy the supplies she needs to continue her business.  This will be her second loan and she says that she is grateful for the support she's received.
