She also wants to thank her fellow members for being responsible and supportive.  This 1,000 new soles loan will cover the costs of disposable cups, drinks jugs, honey and other supplies for Saturnina's drinks business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her soft drinks sales business.

loans.name: Duo La Union Group

texts.es:
Dúo la Unión.
Este dúo está integrado por la señora Celia Antonieta ella es originaria de tecpan Guatemala tiene 3 hijos menores de edad desde algunos años ella viene realizando este trabajo ya que es el único medio que ha tenido para salir adelante y darles lo necesario a sus hijos el sueño de ella es tener un negocio más grande para poder darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos por medio de las ganancias de su negocio. Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos típicos  para la venta.
texts.en:
Dúo la Unión.

One of the members of Dúo la Unión. is Sra. Celia Antonieta, who is a native of Tecpan, Guatemala. She has three minor children and has been doing this work for several years since it is the only means she has had to get ahead and provide her children with what they need. Her dream is to have a larger business so that she can give her children a better future through the profits from her business.

Celia Antonieta is requesting this loan in order to purchase basic material to make traditional woven goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase basic material to make traditional woven goods to sell.

loans.name: Amine

texts.en:
Amine is a 63-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife. With her cooperation, he is able to satisfy their family needs and have a decent standard of living.  Amine owns a small mini-market where he sells all kinds of dairy and daily products in addition to soft drinks and many other products. He is well known for being kind and friendly with his clients, even if they are visiting him for the first time.

Today, Amine is asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the necessary quantity of food provisions for his mini-market. This way, he will be able to diversify his items and increase his revenues and thus improve his standard of living. Amine looks forward to expanding his grocery and is waiting for the perfect time to open other branches and assign people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary quantity of food provisions for his mini-market

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia, 47, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Armando, a technician and father to her seven children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Cecilia is a Yakult vendor. Yakult is a Japanese pro-biotic milk-like product made by fermenting a mixture of skimmed milk with a special strain of the bacterium Lactobacillus casei Shirota. She buys Yakult from a Yakult plant and then she sells it by the bottle.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Cecilia is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more stocks of Yakult to expand her product. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cecilia dreams of being able to give her all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of Yakult (a pro-biotic milk-like product) needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new embroidery frame

loans.name: Zohdeyeh

texts.en: Zohdeyeh is a 58-year-old married female from Al-Hashmi-Amman in Jordan. She has two children. She has requested a 400 JOD loan to purchase Russian jewelry to sell. In the future, she would like to open a jewelry shop and improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to purchase Russian jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia thanks Kiva lenders for the loans she has received. She says they have helped her a lot. 

Lydia still operates a food stall, which is located in a very populated neighborhood in the area. She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead in life. She has a jovial and entrepreneurial spirit, and there is no doubt that she will meet all of the goals she has set for herself. One of her goals is to own a hotel.

With the new loan, Lydia will buy more ingredients such as beans, rice, flour, etc. This will enable her to offer her customers more variety and food that is higher in quality.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as beans, rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 32-year-old Lebanese man. Several years ago, he got divorced and started a new and independent lifestyle. He is the only one responsible for managing his own household expenses while operating his business. 

Ibrahim has been the owner of a home products shop since 2005. He sells different types of plates, plastic items, cups and many other products. His shop is located in his town where many customers from his community visit him to buy their needed products at good prices. Ibrahim keeps on working very hard in order to maintain his financial status at a good level.

Today, Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand his product inventory. He says that the loan will help him boost his sales and thus his income by 15 percent. One of his greatest dreams is to get married for the second time and have children. This is why he needs to amplify his income in order to be able to save money for his new life.

loans.use: to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es: José, de 54 años de edad, originario de San Marcos una comunidad ubicada en las afueras de Estelí, padre de tres hijos, se dedica a la agricultura es especifico siembras de hortalizas. Él ya es cliente recurrente de MiCredito su primer crédito le fue de mucha ayuda pues logro comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar 2 manzanas de cebolla, le fue bien en su cosecha. Ahora necesita sembrar una manzana más de cebolla, es por esto que solicita este crédito para comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para sacar adelante su cosecha de cebolla, de la cual espera una sea una producción de mucha calidad, le ayude a mejorar las condición de vida de su familia y continuar sembrando.
texts.en: José, 54, is from San Marcos, just outside the city of Esteli.  He has three children.  José operates a farming business, growing and selling garden crops.  He is an on-going client of MiCredito and says that he used his first loan to plant 2 "manzanas" (a unit of land area) of onions.  The loan covered the costs of the labor and supplies he needed for the planting.  He is applying for a new loan because he wants to plant more onions.  The investment will pay for the additional labor and supplies that he needs to ensure a good crop.  He adds that your help has allowed him to continue his business and helped him improve the lives of his family.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his general store.

loans.name: Norma Liliam

texts.es:
La señora Norma, es originaria de Somoto uno de los municipios más turísticos de Estelí reconocido por su pintoresco paisajes y sus sabrosas rosquillas hechas a base de maíz y queso. 
Ella, está casada, de oficio contadora, madre de tres hijos. A pesar que logro estudiar la carrera de contabilidad decidió emplear sus propios conocimientos poniendo su propio negocio de panadería.  Aunque su primera experiencia con negocio fue trabajando en un mini súper a la edad de 34 años deicidio dejar de trabajar ahí cuando intentaron robar el negocio pues ella se mantenía sola. Fue entonces que tomo un curso de panadería y empezó ella misma a vender pan hecho por sus propias manos. Ella sale a ofrecer sus productos a las diferentes pulperías y supermercados , pero necesita trabajar con máquinas que le ayuden a agilizar más rápido sus  pedidos  , es por ello que está solicitando el crédito para comprar una batidora grande para mezclar mayor cantidad de mezclas y elaborar más unidades de pan y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes. Pues su sueño es ir comprando maquinaria nueva para hacer pan y mejorar la calidad de su producto que le permita tener mayor clientela y solidez en su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is from Somoto, one of the most touristic municipalities in Estelí.  It is known for its picturesque scenery and delicious ‘rosquillas’ [a ring-shaped pastry], which are made with corn and cheese.

Norma is married, an accountant by profession, and she has three children.  In spite of the fact that she managed to study accounting, she decided to use her knowledge by establishing her own bakery business.   Even though her first experience with business was working in a mini supermarket when she was 34, she decided to stop working there when they tried to rob the business, which she looked after by herself.

That is when she took a bakery course and started to sell, by herself, the bread she made with her own hands.  She goes to different grocery stores and supermarkets to offer her different products.  However, she needs to work with machines that help her fill her orders more quickly.

That is why she is requesting the loan to buy a large mixer in order to mix larger quantities of dough, to make more loaves of bread, and to fill pending orders.  Her dream is to gradually buy new machinery in order to improve the quality of her product.  This will allow her to have more customers and solidify her business.

loans.use: to buy a mixer.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчону 32 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Илхомчон раньше занимался земледелием, но доход от земледелия не хватал для обеспечения семьи, так как  в семье они 7 человек. Ильхомчон много думал, как обеспечить семью, чтобы дети не нуждались. Он решил продать единственную дойную корову и еще брать кредит с нашей организации. Этими деньгами он купил автомашину Опель–Астра. В данный момент Илхомчон занимается услугой такси. Вначале он очень уставал, но сейчас он уже укладывается со всеми делами.  Материальная часть семьи намного улучшилась по сравнению прошлым годом. Илхомчон уже много лет кредитуется в нашей организации и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 6000 сомони. На полученные денежные средства он хочет отремонтировать автомобиль.  Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется, что вы ему поможете.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is 32 years old and is married with two children at home.  He used to work in agriculture, but his income as a farmer was not enough to support his family, who number seven in total.  After much thought about how to support his family so his children wouldn't go hungry, Inhomjon decided to sell his only dairy cow and to apply for a loan from our organization.  With this money, he bought a car - an Opel Astra - and he currently works as a taxi driver.  At first, the work was very tiring, but he now finds that it suits him.  His family's financial situation has improved greatly since last year.  Inhomjon has borrowed from our organization for many years and has good credit history.  He is asking for a loan of 6,000 somons, with which he plans to repair his car.  He awaits your kindness and hopes that you will help him.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three young children, who are still attending school. He is the main income source of his family. He has owned a pastry shop since 2001, where he produces delicious pastries. He has one full-time employee who helps him with the work and benefits from a good salary that helps him support his family as well. 

Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase merchandise needed for his shop, such as flour, sugar, pastries etc. He plans to increase his business productivity so as to augment his income and therefore enhance his family’s way of living. This is his second Kiva loan, and we note that he was a very good client with on-time payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise needed for his shop, such as flour, sugar, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Iye from Moriba town in the southern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 11 and 22 years. Three of her children attend school. 

Iye runs a cookery shop; she sells prepared local foods like cassava leaf and rice. She has been running this business for 10 years. She wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to prepare the food until 7:30 p.m. before she rests, seven days per week. She also sells wood at home as another source of income. She benefits from this type of business, and it helps her to feed her family.

Iye has requested a loan in order to increase her cooking products like bagged rice, Maggie seasoning, palm oil and bagged onions. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her welfare. In the future, she plans to build a cement house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to increase her cooking products like bagged rice, Maggie seasoning, palm oil and bagged onions.

loans.name: Guadalupe Enrique

texts.es: Guadalupe, es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos de 10 y  7 años de edad, él se dedica a atender una barbería. A pesar que el estudio arquitectura la cual es una carrera que no es muy demandada, él no se dio por vencido y busco otra forma de subsistencia es por eso que puso su propio negocio de barbería, el cual funciona desde hace 4 año , él se fue a Panamá a trabajar ahí tomo un curso de barbería  y a su regreso puso el negocio siempre teniendo en su visión progresar y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Él está solicitando el crédito para comprar una silla para su barbería pues actualmente solo tiene una y necesita otra para atender a sus clientes y así poder brindar un mejor servicio. Su sueños es lograr preparar a sus hijos con estudios, brindarles un techo digno donde puedan vivir y ampliar su negocio de barbería actividad que disfruta hacer.
texts.en:
Guadalupe has two children, ages ten and seven.  He works at a barber shop.  In spite of studying architecture, which is a career without much demand, he did not give up.  He looked for another way to survive.  That is why he established his own barber business, which he has had for four years.

He went to Panamá to work, and he took a barber course.  Upon returning he established the business, while always having the vision of progressing and helping his family get ahead.

He is requesting the loan to buy a chair for his barbershop.  He only has one now, and he needs another in order to take care of his customers.  This way he will be able to provide better service.

His dream is to manage to prepare his children with an education, to provide them with a decent roof over their heads, and to expand his barber business, which he enjoys doing.

loans.use: to buy a chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a married man living with his wife and one child. He’s a 39-year-old hard worker looking to offer his family a respectable life far from complications and problems. 

Wissam has many years of experience in his recent job. He’s a furniture painter who works with high professionalism. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can. He’s known for being punctual and well-organized. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed painting tools and related supplies for his business. He will be utilizing the loan to facilitate and carry on his work in a proper way. Wissam is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he looks to take on more projects, maybe outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase the needed painting tools and related supplies for his business.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es:
El Señor Medardo tiene 72 años de edad, reside en compañía de su esposa en el Municipio de Esparta, Departamento de Atlántida.
Don Medardo se dedicaba anteriormente a la venta de pan de manera ambulante, con esfuerzo propio logró establecer una pequeña tienda de venta de productos alimenticios en su vivienda como: frijoles, arroz, huevos, churros, refrescos, galletas, azúcar y café.
Ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de  10,000 Lempiras para invertir en el surtido de su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de mercancías y alimentos de la canasta básica familiar.  
Don Medardo  procura siempre mantenerse con salud, él apoya y cuida mucho de su esposa, además desea crecer con sus clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Medardo, age 72, lives with his wife in the Esparta municipality in the Atlántida department.  Medardo used to sell bread in an itinerant manner.  Through his own effort he managed to establish a small store in his house.  He sells beans, rice, eggs, churros, soft drinks, cookies, sugar, and coffee.

He has requested a loan for 10,000 lempiras in order to stock the business.  He will buy a greater quantity of merchandise and basic food products.

Medardo is always in good health.  He supports and takes good care of his wife.  Also, he wants to get more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy food products (eggs, basic grains, sugar, and coffee).

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru: Назар проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Назар занимается животноводством. Он в основном занимается купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. В этом ему помогает его жена. Назар на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Nazar is married and has five children.  Nazar is 54 years old and lives in a town of Istaravshan. He's engaged in animal husbandry and cattle trade. Nazar has been engaged in this business activity for more than 20 years.  Nazar's wife is also helping alongside him.  Nazar is asking for a loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy another motorbike for the rent-a-bike business.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra, es originaria de Matagalpa un departamento pero habita en la ciudad de Estelí, es madre de tres hijos , todos mayores de edad. Ella es estilista dueña de un pequeño salón de belleza. Sus inicios primeramente fueron trabajando en una repostería y costura pero en el transcurso del tiempo le empezó a gustar el estilismo y decidió  tomar un curso de belleza para especializar y fue así que emprendió y logro poner su salón de belleza además que ella ofrece sus servicios a domicilio. Este requiriendo un préstamo Kiva para comprar tinte, cosméticos, shampo, cremas para cabello, cepillos, guantes, agua oxigenada. Pues además ella vende cosméticos y tintes en su propio salón, es muy humilde pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ella tiene como sueño lograr abrir otro salón de belleza y vender repostería al mismo tiempo.
texts.en: Mayra is from the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Matagalpa, but she now lives in Esteli.  She has three children, all grown.  She owns a beauty salon.  In the past, she has worked as a baker and a seamstress.  She has always been interested in hair-styling, though, and finally decided to take a hair-styling course.  She subsequently started her own beauty salon, a business that she operates from a space in her house.  Mayra is applying for a loan that she will use to buy dyes, cosmetics, shampoos, hair creams, brushes, gloves and other supplies.  She stocks some products for sale to complement the hair-styling services she provides.  It's only a start, she says, but she has high hopes for growing the business.  For the future, she would like to open another beauty salon and a bakery business.

loans.use: to stock her beauty salon.

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
El Sr Abrahan tiene 48 años, está casado con el Sra Maria de 38 años, viven en casa propia ,en la ciudad de Caacupé.  El Sr. Abrahan   se dedica a la producción de ladrillos prensados y comunes, cuenta con su propia fabrica y con un plantel de ayudantes a quienes da trabajo.
Solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva un crédito para traer más cantidad de leñas para asegurar la producción y ventas y así  satisfacer a su clientela.
Su meta es poder seguir trabajando, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a su familia y también seguir dando trabajo a las demás personas.
texts.en:
Sr. Abrahan is 48. He is married to Sra. Maria, age 38. They live in their own home in the city of Caacupé. Abrahan makes pressed bricks and regular bricks. He has his own factory with a staff of helpers whom he provides with work.
He is requesting a loan from the Fundacion Paraguaya and from Kiva in order to bring in a larger quantity of firewood. This will assure his production and sales and satisfy his customer base. His goal is to be able to keep working, so that he will be able to keep helping his family and providing work to others.

loans.use: to buy firewood for making bricks.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and one sibling. 

He has been working as a painter for many years. He had to start working early to support his father financially. He works upon customer’s demands, and during his free time, he works additionally in a local bird shop in order to increase his profits.
 
Today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase painting tools and supplies. He reports that these purchases will enable him to provide his services to more customers and take additional projects. 

In the future, he is planning to further expand his business operation and build a good business reputation. This is his first Kiva loan and he is sure that he will realize his business objective thanks to it.

loans.use: to purchase painting tools and supplies.

loans.name: Fatemah

texts.en:
Fatemah is a 50-year-old married female from Al Hashmi-Amman in Jordan. She has five children and requested a 1,100 JOD loan to buy clothes to resell. 

In the future she would like to have her own shop and to improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy plastic bottles for resale.

loans.name: Razan

texts.en:
Razan a 19-year-old single lady with four siblings who are all living with their parents.

Razan is a university student majoring in programming engineering. She has applied for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité LAS VENCEDORAS, pertenece al cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, ellas son 18 señoras que realizan diversas actividades pero también se ayudan las unas a las otras a salir adelante.
Isabelina es parte del grupo y cuenta que se dedica a vender comestibles en general y le va bien porque tiene muy buena sazón. Su sueño es poder tener un gran negocio y de esa forma seguir creciendo y ser el principal sostén de su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, etc, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y haciendo lo que le gusta.
texts.en:
The Las Vencedoras Committee is in the fourth cycle of the female entrepreneurs' program. The group is made up of 18 women who have various businesses but also help one another to get ahead.
Isabelina is part of the group. She tells us that she sells general food items and that it is going well for her because her products are delicious. Her dream is to be able to have a large business and to keep growing and become her family's main breadwinner.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies for her food products, such as vegetables, meat, and chicken. With these items, she will be able to keep working and doing what she loves.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Gezim

texts.en:
Gezim is in his early 30s and has two children, 4 and 1 year old. 

He has never before requested any loans from any institutions until recently he was chosen through the integrated project between VisionFund Albania and World Vision Albania. Individuals or families under such programs have been selected because of their extreme poverty level. Now these two organizations come together with joined efforts to improve the lives of these families by giving them basic entrepreneurial skills and microloans to fully equip them.

Gezim is requesting a loan through Kiva to purchase goats in order to increase the dairy products he has been selling to the locals in the past ten years. He also produces and sells crops and grains.

For Gezim this loan will be a great help and he appreciates the help of lenders and of course all the organizations involved.

loans.use: To add some more goats to the existing herd.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika has had a neighborhood kiosk for four years that has helped her to gradually support her three children with their personal development. She works very hard day to day to give her children better life opportunities. Masika has shown a great desire to move her family ahead.

With economic support, her goal is to make her business grow to be able to increase sales and even open a second store in the future. We hope that with this opportunity, Masika’s dreams will become a reality. 

The loan will be used to buy balers of maize and wheat flour, beans, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy balers of maize and wheat flour, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Fatemah

texts.en:
Fatemah is a 40-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi-Amman in Jordan. She has four children and requested an 800 JOD loan to pay for her house painting and improvements. 

In the future she would like to improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Nevazi

texts.en: Nevazi is single person who doesn't have any children. He is 29 years old. He needs 1800 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) to buy instruments for his construction work to improve his business. He has been in the construction business for the last five years. He tries all the time to improve his monthly income in order to support his family. Nevazi lives in the Fuzuli region with his parents. Nevazi is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli.

loans.use: to buy instruments for his work

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from a small village of Lanchkhuti district. She is 53 years old, married, and lives with her 24-year-old son. Her son works as a security guard and gets a monthly salary. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own a nut garden and a plot of land, where maize is grown. The family does all relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. Nino is involved in a dairy farm. She has three calves and three milk cows whose milk is used for cheese products. Nino sells the cheese at the local market. The family has a grain mill and serves local farmers. The work is hard, but still doesn't provide enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family. 

She requested a loan to repair a grain mill, which is damaged. Her mill will serve the local farmers by crushing grain. Nino will get a service fee and this will increase the income of the family. With the increased income she will improve their living conditions. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to repair a grain mill

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia es un grupo formado por mujeres con muchas ganas de salir adelante, son jefas de familia que dan todo por sus hijos y por toda su familia.
La sra. Mirtha esta acopañada hace 14 años con el señor Neri quien se dedica como chofer tienen dos hijos. Ella se dedica ala cria de ganado y cerdos como anexo tiene venta de leche, ella  solicita  el credito  para la compra de mas cerdos para la cria y la faena para poder aumentar mas sus ingresos. Mirtha tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y asi tambien ella poder realizarce como microempresaria.
texts.en: The Santa Lucia group is made up of women who have a great desire to get ahead. They are heads of their families and give everything for their children and their whole families. Sra. Mirtha has been with Sr. Neri, who works as a driver, for 14 years. They have two children. Mirtha raises livestock and hogs. She also sells milk on the side. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more hogs to be raised and slaughtered; this will increase her income. Mirtha's goal is to expand her business and provide her family with a better lifestyle; to fulfill her potential as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy hogs to be raised and slaughtered.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Bohol, Philippines. 

She is a dressmaker and has run a shop for more than ten years now. She makes school and office uniforms and provides alterations to clothing. Moreover, she also accepts other requests such as making curtains. This is the source of her income.

As of this time, she is in need of additional funds for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 26,000 PHP to buy materials for sewing, such as cloth, thread and buttons. In addition, she also wants to buy a new sewing machine to improve her work.

In the future, Leonides hopes to seeing her business become a successful one.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and materials, such as cloth, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Mariama from Moriba town, in the southern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children between the ages of 7 years and 20 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2002, Mariama established her palm oil business. She began her business because she was a housewife, and after her husband retired from his job, she had no option than to run a business. 

She works at the business every day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run it.

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy a variety of local stock like palm oil, pepper and beans. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariama plans to build a business store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of local stock like palm oil, pepper and beans.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has six children. 

She sells plantain and cassava at Wakrom near Takoradi. Efua has been selling food for the past eight years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. 

Efua will use her loan to purchase more variety of food to sell. With the new profit, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of food to sell.

loans.name: Besiki

texts.en:
Besiki is from a small village of the Terjola district. He is a 36-year-old single man. His economic activity is a greenhouse where tomatoes, cucumbers and dills are grown. Besiki owns a vineyard as well and picks the grapes in the late summer. He does all relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. The harvested production is sold locally. Besiki works hard to make some savings and expand his agricultural business. 

He requested a loan to purchase dill seeds, greenhouse cellophane and fertilizers. The loan will help him to provide financially for his needs. He confronts challenges such as pest infestations and diseases and changes in the weather, so that he can provide quality products for his customers. This will increase his income and Besiki will reinvest in his agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase dill seeds, greenhouse cellophane, and fertilizers

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is turning fifty soon and is married with two children, twenty-two and fifteen years old. Both her children attend school. This would be Adelina's second time applying for a loan through Vision Fund Albania, yet the first time requesting financial help from Kiva's lenders. 

She was the sole financial provider for her family until six years ago, when she started the livestock business and got support. She takes care of the animals, making dairy products that her husband takes to the city's market every day early in the morning. 

Adelina now wants to buy one more milk cow to increase the milk production, and with the profit she plans to provide higher education for both of her children. 

Adelina would like to thank everyone on Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy one more cow

loans.name: Mahmadsafar

texts.en:
Mahmadsafar is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Being a responsible father, Mahmadsafar works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs and send some of his children to school. He is dedicated to the farming business, growing onions on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards he has worked hard from early morning till late evening for five years. 

Mahmadsafar would like to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of $3000 to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for new planting season. He hopes that Kiva lenders won't reject his loan and he thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli is from the Terjola district of West Georgia. She is 66 years old, a widow and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and a grandson. 

Maguli is provided with a retirement pension. She owns a small grocery store, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. Maguli runs a small dairy business and has a milk cow. She milks the cow and produces dairy products. The family also has a vineyard and an agricultural land, which is cultivated and different kinds of vegetables are grown.  They sell their agricultural products in the nearby villages.  

Maguli requested a loan to brick the balcony. She will purchase building materials and expand her house. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Maguli hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to brick the balcony.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells frozen beef at Wakrom near Cape Coast. Ama has been in this business for three years now. She is a widow and has four children. As a single parent, she uses her income to support her children. Ama will use her loan to purchase more bush beef to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bush beef to sell

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge desde hace años comenzó su negocio. Pero antes de eso en la parroquia donde vivía  trabajaba como ayudante en un taller de bicicletas viendo y capacitándose, En la actualidad tiene  su propio taller  de bicicletas.  
En la actualidad labora de martes a domingo desde las 8:00am hasta las 18:00pm. No ha tenido ningún tipo de inconvenientes ya que en el lugar es tranquilo y es conocido por el sector. 
Jorge está casado y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo va a comprar repuestos para las bicicletas que le llevan los clientes para repararlas con mas rapides ya que es una de sus metas mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge started his business years ago.  But before that, he worked as a helper in a bicycle repair shop in the parish where he lived and learned the trade by observing.  He currently has his own bicycle repair shop.

He works from Tuesday through Sunday from 8am until 6pm.  He’s had no inconvenience since his neighborhood is tranquil and he’s well-known there.

Jorge is married and has two children attending public school.  He will use the loan to buy spare parts for bicycles his customers bring in so he can repair them more quickly since one of his goals is to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Johanna Marieliza

texts.es:
Johanna de 32 años empezó con su negocio hace 9 años, ya que salió de donde estaba trabajando porque sus hijos estaban muy pequeños y también quería aprovechar sus estudios de arte y Costureria. 
En la actualidad tiene un taller de costura en su casa, el  horario de trabajo empieza desde las 9:00 a 14:00pm de lunes a sábado. Unas de sus dificultades es que actualmente está muy reducida donde vive. Johanna está casada tiene 2 hijos 10 y de 6  años y estudian en una escuela fiscal su esposo trabaja en una empacadora de camarón. Con el préstamo va a mejorar su vivienda ya que desea tener mas espacio para la costura de ropa en su taller. Unas de sus metas para los próximos 5 años es que anhela ampliar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Johanna started her business nine years ago, as she left where she was working because her children were very young and because she also wanted to use her education in art and sewing.

She currently has a sewing studio in her home.  Her work schedule starts at 9:00 a.m. and ends at 2:00 p.m. Monday through Saturday.  One problem she has is that there is very little space in her home.  Johanna is married and has two children who are 10 and 6 years old and who attend public school.  Her husband works packing shrimp.  She will use the loan to improve her home, as she wants to have more room to sew clothing in her studio.  One of her goals for the next five years is to expand her business and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and paint to improve her sewing studio

loans.name: Narcisa Gloria

texts.es:
Narcisa comenzó desde hace 5 años trabajando en productos y puso un bazar vende retratos, cuadernos y le ha ido bien en este negocio. 
En la actualidad su trabajo lo hace sola y todo el día hasta las 18:00pm unas de sus dificultades son los ladrones ya que el sector es peligroso y la salud que le está afectando. Ella está separada de su esposo pero con sus tres hijos que ya son adultos sigue adelante.  Con el préstamo va a comprar retratos, cremas y perfumes.

Unas de sus metas para su negocio es poner una sucursal grande para dar mejor atención y comodidad al cliente y así poder tener mayor ingresos.
texts.en:
Narcisa began selling products five years ago and opened a bazaar where she sells pictures and notebooks.  Her business has done well.  

At the moment, Narcisa works alone every day until 6 P.M.  One of her challenges is dealing with robbers since she lives in a dangerous area.  As a result, her health has been affected.  Narcisa is separated from her husband and has three grown children who have moved forward.  With this loan, she will buy pictures, crèmes, and perfumes.  

One of the goals for her business is to have a large location where she can provide better service and comfort for her customers.  This will enable her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy pictures, crèmes, and perfumes.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
El Comité llamado San Lorenzo está conformado por 14 integrantes y actualmente se encuentran en el 5º ciclo. Son mujeres que se esfuerzan para salir adelante y solventar los gastos de la familia, la intención de las señoras fue formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras con el beneficio del crédito otorgado a fin de lograr mejorar sus emprendimientos y calidad de vida.
La Sra. Epifania es una de las integrantes que se esmera muchísimo por salir adelante, ella se dedica habitualmente  a la compra y venta de animales y también trabaja como empleada doméstica y así solventa los gastos de la familia. Ella pide el crédito para la compra de alimento para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como hasta hoy lo hace.
texts.en:
The San Lorenzo Committee is made up of 14 members who are currently in their fifth loan cycle. They are women who work very hard to get ahead and cover their families' costs. Their intention was to form part of the Female Entrepreneurs' Committee to get this loan with the goal of improving their enterprises and their quality of life.
Sra. Epifania is one of the group members who works very hard to get ahead. She habitually buys and sells animals. She also works as a maid in order to cover her family's costs. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of animal feed. This way, she will be able to keep working as she has done until now.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Isata from Kulanda town, Southern area in Bo. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 10 years and 30 years. One of her children attends school. She began her business when her husband retired from his job. She start the business to raise money to support her family.

Isata sells a variety of stock items. She sells rubber bowls, food containers and slippers. She has been running this business for 11 years. She works at the business every day, 7 days per week. Her other source of income comes from small-scale farming. Isata says that the main challenges to her business are some customers buy on credit but fail to pay back.

Isata has requested a loan in order to buy more rubber bowls, food containers and slippers. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve the quality of life for her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a full shop level. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rubber bowlsl, food containers, slippers.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is from Kharagauli district of West Georgia. She is 61 years old and lives with her husband, Anzor. Mzia and Anzor are provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an animal husbandry business. They have a milk cow, three calves and a pig. Mzia milks the cow and produces dairy products. She also has a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. The family owns beehives with bee colonies and gets honey. They sell their agricultural products in the nearby villages.  

Mzia and Anzor work hard to make some savings and improve their living conditions. Mzia has requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is old and damaged. She will purchase building materials and renovate her house. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Mzia hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua  is  married to a farmer and has 6 children. She produces Fanti kenkey to sell. In front of her, in the photo, is the maize she uses in the kenkey  production. She has done this for 6 years. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children and to pay for their children’s school fees. 

Ekua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and firewood to produce her kenkey. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and firewood to produce her kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Belen Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Fátima se encuentra en el 1 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Ellas trabajan arduamente y se ayudan las unas a las otras y de esa forma tratan de salir adelante.
L de la Sra. Feliciana se dedica a la venta de ropa, chancho y a demás tiene un kiosco, nos comenta que gracias a su negocio ha podido ayudar a su familia y mejorar su economía.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual poda surtirse y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen de Fatima" is in its first loan cycle, in the jointly and severally responsible form of the program.  The members work hard and help each other, and in this way they try to advance.

Señora Feliciana works selling clothing and other items. She has a kiosk. She comments that thanks to her business, she has been able to help her family improve its finances.

She is applying for the loan to buy articles of clothing of all types, with which she will stock her kiosk and offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and has six children.   

Rebecca cooks Ga-kenkey for sale. (Kenkey is maize dumplings.) This she has done for two years.  

She uses her income to support the husband in feeding, clothing and paying school fees for their children.  

Rebecca will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and firewood to produce her kenkey for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and firewood to produce her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has two children. 

She sells saucepans, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a driver. 

Ama  uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase saucepans for sale. With the new profits,  Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase saucepans for sale.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is from the Terjola district of West Georgia. She is 38 years old and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children (12 and 16 years old).

Maia’s mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. The children go to the local school. According to government estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get monthly social assistance.

Maia runs a small dairy business and has a milk cow and a calf. Maia milks the cow and produces dairy products. She also has a vineyard and picks grapes in the late summer. The family is involved in poultry farming as well and has 50 hens. They sell their agricultural products in the nearby villages.  

Maia has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase a milk cow. This will allow Maia to receive more milk for her dairy and increase the sales, which provide her main income. This will give her an opportunity to reinvest in her agricultural business and improve the living conditions of the family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort  is a single parent who has five children.

She sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, garden eggs and other food items at Wakrom near Cape Coast.  

As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay school fees for her children. 

Comfort will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El Sr. Teodoro es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy responsable, comenta que gracias al anterior préstamo de Kiva ha podido ir mejorando su negocio y esta creciendo cada vez mas. En su meta esta agrandar mas su negocio y así también poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de pinturas y masillas que podrá usar en su taller de chaperia y de reparación de automóviles. El agradece por la nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Teodoro is a very hard-working person.  Above all, he is very responsible.  He says that thanks to the previous Kiva loan he has been able to gradually improve his business, and it is continually growing.  His goal is to expand his business and to also be able to give work to other people.

He is requesting a new loan to buy paint and fillers that he will be able to use in his automobile body and repair shop.  He is grateful for the new opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy fillers and paint.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras surge del deseo de progreso de 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque, ellas viernon una gran oportunidad de crecimiento, y decidieron aventurarse y ser parte de un comité.
La Sra.Marta tiene una zapatería, esta casada con el señor Cesar, tiene 1 hijo aun menor . Ella solicito el credito  para la compra de cuero, pegamento, hilo, etc,para la elaboracion de zapatos para hombres, mujeres y niños, ella desea abrir un negocio en la zona centrica de luque, ya que ellos trabajan en su domicilio y desde alli cmplen con sus clientes, ella es muy sacrificada y cuenta que todo lo que obtuvo en la vida es gracias a su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Emprendedoras" [Enterprising Women] arose out of the desire for progress of 17 women in the city of Luque. They saw a tremendous opportunity for growth and decided to venture out and be part of a committee. 

Ms. Marta has a shoe-making business. She is married to Cesar and has one son who is still a minor. She is seeking the loan for the purchase of leather, glue, thread, etc. for making men's, women's and children's shoes. She wishes to open a business in the downtown district of Luque since they work out of her home and deal with their customers there as well. She makes many sacrifices and tells us that everything she got in life was thanks to her own efforts.

loans.use: tp purchase leather, glue, thread and other items for her shoe-making and shoe sales business.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Nueva Esperanza, es de la ciudad de Lambaré. Son 15 mujeres que son muy conocidas en el barrio por la unión que tienen, ya que siempre se esfuerzan y se ayudan mutuamente.
Mirna es parte del grupo, ella es modista y cuenta que desde pequeña trabajo por lo que no tiene miedo a ningún desafío. Tiene muy buena clientela, ya que sus clientes quedan siempre satisfechos porque hace muy buenos trabajos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tela, y de esa forma poder seguir confeccionando los pedidos de sus cliente. Quiere poder seguir creciendo y así mejorar el estilo de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" committee is from the city of Lambaré. They are 15 women who are well-known in the neighborhood for their group since they are always working and supporting one other. 

Mirna is part of the group. She is a dressmaker and says that she has worked since she was a young girl and so is not afraid of any challenge. She has a very good customer base since her customers are always satisfied because she does very good work. 

She is seeking the loan to purchase cloth so as to continue creating the items ordered by her customers. She wants to be able to keep growing and so to improve her and her family's life style.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El Señor Gustavo tiene 37 años, está acompañado con la Señora Josefina con quien tiene 2 hijos, por quienes lucha incansablemente, ya que quiere poder darles todo lo que él no pudo tener.
El Señor Gustavo se dedica a la plantación y venta de hortalizas desde hace más de 7 años, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su familia, el crédito que solicita es para poder invertirlo en la compra de un motor de mayor capacidad para mejorar su sistema de riego, ya que quiere poder invertir en su huerta, que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
Esta muy agradecido con la fundación y Kiva por la posibilidad de acceder a un crédito y de esa manera aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar de esa manera a su familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo, age 37, and his life companion, Josefina, have two children.  He struggles untiringly for them.  He does this because he wants to be able to give them everything that he was not able to have.

Gustavo has been growing and selling vegetables for over seven years.  He does this with the help of his family.  The loan he is requesting is to be able to buy a greater capacity motor in order to improve his watering system.  He wants to be able to invest in his garden, which is his main source of income.

He is very grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the possibility of a loan.  This way he will increase his income and help his family.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his vegetable watering system.

loans.name: Dashtseren

texts.en: Mr. Dashtseren, 31, is a carrier and he has been doing his job for a decade nonstop. He lives with his family in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His children always get sick in the winter, due to the cold at home. His house was built many years ago, and it has been bad lately. In winter there are emissions from the coal fired stove Dashtseren uses to warm his house. It is harmful to the health of his family members and the environment. For this winter, he wants to install a low pressure furnace in his house, as he hopes it will be economical and healthy for the environment. The loan he is taking out will be used to cover the cost of the low pressure furnace.

loans.use: to cover the cost of the low pressure furnace

loans.name: Erdenetuya

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenetuya, 42, is a program developer for an NGO (non-government organization). She has had this job for two years and her husband works as a blacksmith. She and her husband live with their three children in a rental apartment in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. In addition to her work at an NGO, early each morning she sells milk outside of her apartment building. She buys the milk from herders the day before she sells it and keeps it in a freezer in her home. Lately, her freezer has begun to break down so she is applying for this loan to buy a new one because she needs it to run her second business.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer to store milk.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Phy, 45, is married with four children. She lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To meet the family’s needs, she has been rice farming for twenty years. The current business earns her approximately KHR27,000 per day and nets her KHR17,000 each day after expenses. 

Phy received the first loan with VisionFund five cycles ago, while the other member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her family.

Now, she and her group member are seeking for a loan with VisionFund of KHR1,400,000 each. Phy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. The increase in her business will expand her income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Chheang is 53 and married with six children, four of whom are dependent on her. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming on a one-hectare area. She has been rice farming twenty years, and she is able to earn about 22,000KHR per day and save about 14,000KHR daily for future needs.

Chheang has been with VisionFund for seven cycles already, while the other member has been with VisionFund for five cycles. She fully repaid the past loans which have helped her relieve family’s burden. She is now leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm and use a fragment of it on gasoline. She hopes her rice will become more productive and profitable to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
A married woman of four dependent children, all of whom are still in school, Chanthy is aged 44 years. She has made a living through rice farming on five hectares of farmland for 10 years, while her husband contributes to the family’s income by fishing. Her family lives in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. The current business earns her around 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her rice farming business.

Chanthy has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past three loans have supported better living conditions for Chanthy's family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund for 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000, respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and gasoline for water pumping. She hopes to grow her current business and increase her income so as to make a better living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Khurelbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Khurelbaatar, 32, is a taxi driver who operates his business in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He started his business four years ago and now has some regular customers. He owns a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional yurt, in which he lives with his wife and three children. Living in this structure is difficult and cold in the winter, and his wife and daughter always get sick due to the low temperatures in their home. He has decided to get a new cover for his home, which will make living in it much more comfortable. He will use this loan to pay for the new cover.

loans.use: to buy a new cover for his yurt.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea is aged 44 years and married. She has five children, four of whom are dependent on her; some are in school and sometimes the others have paid work in the local area. Living in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Kea has been involved in growing corn for seven years to make a living. The current business earns her approximately 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her farming business. 

This is Kea's Group’s second microloan with VisionFund. She has fully paid back the past loan, which enabled her family to have sufficient food to eat and better support her children’s education. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Kea will use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her corn business and spend a fragment of it on plowing the field. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides for her corn business

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Musu from Torkpoi town in the southern area of Bo. She is widowed, with three children between the ages of 9 years and 16 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 1995, Musu established her general stock items at home. She began her business because she needs to generate income to support her family. She works at the business every day. She walks five miles from her house to the village where she buys palm oil. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network in the community.

Musu requires a loan in order to buy palm oil to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her living and expand her business. In the future, Musu plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil.

loans.name: Unión Retama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN RETAMAS”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de fruta, venta de enaguas, venta de mantas, venta de mantas, venta de fundas para camas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de enaguas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por referencias de su prima quien le enseño la elaboración y posteriormente ella se involucro al mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de herramienta (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.

En la fotografía se encuentra la voluntaria de nuestra institución acompañando al grupo ella es Doris quien esta abrazando a una de nuestras socias
texts.en:
The Unión Retamos communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II regional center.  It is comprised of six members, and it is run by a governing board, where Martha is the president.  The members’ businesses are varied.  Among them we have selling fruit, selling traditional skirts, selling blankets, selling blankets, and selling bed covers.

The loan they will take will benefit small businesswomen like Martha.  She has been a member of Pro Mjuer for three years, and she joined by invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling traditional skirts.  She says that she undertook this business by recommendation from her cousin who taught her how to make them.  Later she became involved in doing the same.

The loan that she will now take is to increase materials (to buy fabric) that she will get at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  She will later set them up in the space where she sells them.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health trainings and the loans.

In the photograph you can see our institution’s volunteer accompanying the group.  Her name is Doris, and she is hugging one of our members.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Somyan's Group

texts.en:
Somyan lives in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a 28-year-old married mother of three children. To make a living, Somyan has been farming rice on three hectares of farmland for ten years, while her husband is a taxi driver to help the family generate extra income. The current business earns them about 18,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 8,000 KHR for future needs. Lacking the capital to support her paddy-rice is the main challenge for her business. 

Somyan’s group consists of two members who live in the same village, and this is the fifth loan for her group with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her relieve the family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she and her group member are requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Somyan will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily to gain more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa earns a living by selling maize porridge, rice, eggs and groundnuts in the town of Waakrom near Cape Coast. She is married and has two children. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter, and she uses her income to help him support their family. Adwowa will use her loan to buy bags of rice, maize, eggs and groundnuts to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income she earns to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, maize, eggs and groundnuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba earns a living by making palm kennel oil to sell in the town of Waakrom, which is near Cape Coast. She is the single mother of six children and uses her income to make sure that her children have adequate food and clothing. Aba is requesting this loan to buy more palm kennels to use to make oil. With the additional income she earns from this loan, she plans to buy a machine which will help her in her business.

loans.use: to buy more palm kennels to use to make oil to sell.

loans.name: Jedida

texts.en: Jedida is 60 years old, widowed and the mother of four children, all of whom are grown and no longer depend on her. For the past 20 years, she has made a living by owning rental houses. This is her fourth business loan with KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans completely and on time. She will use this new loan to renovate her rental houses, especially to do painting and electrical work. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by building more houses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Gombotseren

texts.en:
Mr. Gombotseren, 54, runs a passenger transportation business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, with his minivan. He has been operating his business successfully for 8 years. 

He lives with his wife and daughter, a college student, in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt in the ger district in the city. Living in the ger is difficult, and cold in winter. His wife and daughter always get sick due to the cold inside the home. 

Therefore, he has decided to build his own small and warm family house. He recently started building his house.  Now, he needs to buy wall insulation materials for his new house, including cement, foam, rock, wool etc. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to paying for the building materials.

loans.use: To pay for building materials.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 37 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 3 and 19. She runs a palm oil business at Torkpoi town southern area Bo in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 15 years and sells palm oil at her house; she is living in her shop. Her business is the only income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to run her business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more palm oil and gari (West African dish made of cassava). She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's welfare and educate her children. In the future, she would like to build a house and expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and gari

loans.name: Colque Patha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLQUE PATHA” iniciará el vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Estefa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, comerciante de ropa, venta de comida, venta de regalos, confección de polleras, punto de llamadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Estefa es una integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de punto de llamadas, mismo que emprendió hace veinte años por recomendación de sus suegros y su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cabinas) que comprará de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tienen tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en: The "COLQUE PATHA" community association is starting its twenty-sixth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes, which is made up of eleven members and is run by a board of which Estefa is president.  The members of the community association operate a variety of businesses, including the following: a neighborhood store; clothing sales; gift sales; sewing skirts; and a call center.  The loan they are requesting will benefit small microbusiness owners including Estefa.  She says that she has belonged to Pro Mujer for four years, after being invited by a friend who is a member of the organization.  She now has a call center business, the same one that she started twenty years ago at the suggestion of her in-laws and her husband.  The loan that she is requesting is to add to her capital (the purchase of phone booths) that she will buy from wholesalers and later install in her commercial space.  This type of work allows her to earn income for her family, as she is married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes loans in the health field.

loans.use: to buy phone booths.

loans.name: Aida Nelly

texts.es: Aida Nelly  de 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien es muy trabajador y junto a dos hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Aída posee una tienda de productos varios y de primera necesidad, los cuales comercializa en su casa de habitación, dándole la ventaja que puede dedicarse a él durante todo el día los siete días a la semana, dedicarse a los oficios de la casa y cuidar a sus hijos, le encanta todo lo que hace y ello además ha permitido tener ingresos fijos. Aída solicita un préstamo  a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de surtir más su tienda, comprando productos alimenticios como: harinas, sopas instantáneas, leche, pan y también productos como golosinas y bebidas. El mayor deseo de Aida es poder crecer con su negocio y de esta forma aumentar sus ventas y convertir lo que inicio como un pequeño negocio de prueba en el mejor negocio de la zona.
texts.en:
Aída Nelly is 38 years old. She lives with her husband, who is a very hard worker, and their two children, who are in school. Aída has a store where she sells a variety of products and essential goods. It is set up in her home, which is an advantage because it allows her to tend to it all day seven days a week, do housework, and take care of her children. She loves everything she does and it has also allowed her to have a fixed income. 

Aída is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can better stock her store. She will purchase food products such as flour, instant soup, milk, bread, and other products like sweets and drinks. Aída's greatest desire is being able to expand her business so that her sales increase and to turn what started out as a small business try-out into the best business in the area.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as flour, instant soup, milk, bread, and also sweets and drinks.

loans.name: Elsa Carmen

texts.es: Elsa Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II y tiene 56 años de edad, es viuda y madre de dos hijos. Es socia de Finca Perú hace 17 años y se dedica a la venta de bloques de hielo y alquila algunos cuartos en su casa. Ella dice que en FINCA Perú le enseñaron a ahorrar, administrar su negocio y a ser más responsable, también le gustan mucho las capacitaciones porque se lleva muy bien con sus demás compañeras y se siente feliz. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en cambiar de pintura los cuartos que alquila en su casa.
texts.en: Elsa Carmen is a member of the “Unión II” communal bank.  She’s 52-years-old, widowed and the mother of two children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for 17 years and she sells blocks of ice and rents rooms in her house.   She says that FINCA Perú taught her how to save, manage her business and how to be more responsible.  She enjoys the training very much because she gets along very well with her fellow group members and she feels happy.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to repaint the rooms she rents in her house.

loans.use: to repaint the rooms she rents.

loans.name: Sonia Marcela

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su madre y su tío, es soltera y se dedica desde hace doce años a la venta de fruta pelada, el negocio de frutas lo trabaja  de lunes a domingo, lo cual lo  aprendió de su madre desde hace mucho tiempo.
Ella quiere  expandirse con su venta; pero necesita comprar más frutas  y no posee suficiente  dinero para ello, es por eso que ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar: mango, piña, papaya, pepino, y tambien para comprar lamina para cerrar su negocio y remodelarlo.
Este crédito  le ayudara al crecimiento de su negocio, ayudar a su mamá con el incremento de sus ganancias y poder diversificar los productos que ofrece y así tambien hacerse acreedora de muchos clientes, tambien  le ayudara a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her mother and her son.  She’s single and for the last twelve years has been selling peeled fruit.  She works in her fruit business from Monday to Sunday; she learned it from her mother a long time ago.

She wants to expand sales but needs to buy more fruit and does not have enough money to do so which is why she’s requesting a loan to buy mangoes, pineapples, papayas and cucumbers.  She will also buy a metal grate to seal her business and remodel it.

The loan will help her business grow and to help her mother with increased profits and to be able to diversify the products she sells so that she can acquire many more customers.  It will also help her have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, pineapples, papayas and cucumbers.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a businesswoman who sells palm fruit, cassava, and plantain at Wokrom near Cape Coast. She has done this for the past two years. Esi is married to a mason, and they have five children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Esi needs a loan from Kiva to purchase palm friut, cassava, plantain, and other types of food items to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm friut, cassava, plantain, and other food items to sell

loans.name: Yata

texts.en:
Yata is 38 years old, widowed, and has three children between the ages of 16 and 26. She runs a palm oil business at Moriba town southern area Bo. Her children are currently attending school. She began this business because her husband was killed during the war and she decided to start a business to generate income for the family.  

She has been in this business for eight years and sells palm oil, gari (West African cassava dish), and nut oil. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more gallons of palm oil. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children and to change her roof. In the future, she would like to expand her business more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa lives with her husband, a farmer, and 4 children in Wakrom near Cape Coast.  Adwowa has been selling cassava and maize for 2 years, and she uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase additional bags of maize and cassava to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and cassava to sell

loans.name: Elizalde

texts.es: Elizalde de 38 años de edad, una persona muy responsable la cual trabaja muy duro por su familia, que está conformada por cuatro hijos menores de edad, entre los cuales los dos mayores le ayudan con el negocio a Elizalde. Ella posee un taller de reparación de bicicletas, el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde no solo las repara sino también comercializa accesorios y repuestos como: llantas, asientos, lámparas para adaptarlas a las bicicletas y otras más. Elizalde solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de repuestos, de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorar en su negocio, lo cual es fundamental para el sostenimiento de su hogar debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para salir adelante.
texts.en: Elizalde is 38 years old, she is a very responsible person who works very hard for her family, composed of four young children; the first two help Elizalde in her job. She runs a bicycle repair shop located in her house: she not only repairs bicycles, but she also sells accessories and spare parts such as tires, saddles, lights for bicycles and other items. Elizalde is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to have the money she needs to buy a bigger quantity of spare parts in order to offer a better service to her customers and to improve her activity. Her job is fundamental to provide for her household, as it is the only source of income she can count on to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy tires and bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina  es socia del Banco Comunal Unión II y tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 5 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 12 años y es dueña de una bodega. Ella dice que le gusta FINCA Perú porque le enseñaron a ahorrar y le brindan apoyo en su negocio. Gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal a ser responsable y puntual. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su bodega en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, harina, menestras, bebidas etc.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the community bank Union II. She is a 65-year old widow and mother of five children. 

She is the proprietor of a small grocery store and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 12 years. She says she likes FINCA Peru because they taught her to save and support her in her business, thanks to the training she received at her community bank to be responsible and punctual.

She will invest the loan requested in her grocery store for the purchase of groceries like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, flour, beans, beverages etc.

loans.use: to buy groceries like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, flour, beans, beverages etc.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
