La A.C. “CRISTO REY”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maira es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, taller de calzados, costura de mochilas, chicharon de soya, venta de repostería, venta de verduras, venta de pan, venta de medias, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maira es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de mochilas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia y le esta yendo muy buen.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Cristo Rey” (Christ the King) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Maira, president.  The members carry out a variety of business among which are clothing sales, shoe repair shop, backpack making, soy chicharron, pastry sales, vegetable sales, bread sales, hosiery sales and cosmetics sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small businesswomen.  Maira is one of the group members and this is her first time with Pro Mujer having been invited to join by a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business sewing backpacks.  She comments that she started this business on her own initiative and is doing very well.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fabric in street markets in the city of El Alto and then bring it to her shop to sell.  This way of working makes it possible for her to support her family the best way possible since she lives together with someone.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Yenny De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Yenny, necesita continuar con su negocio, ha decidido sacar otro préstamo para invertir en la venta de pasteles y tamales, ya que su objetivo es tener entradas de dinero, se comprara materiales por ejemplo: aceite, cebollas, tomates chiles, carne, harina entre otros.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior influyo mucho en su negocio, aumento la capacidad de sus ingresos, sus ganancias;  y le ayudo a  tener  una visión optimista para seguir trabajando con el mejor de los deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Yenny needs to continue with her business, and she has decided to request another loan to invest in selling cakes and tamales, because her goal is to have sources of income. She will buy materials such as oil, onions, chili tomatoes, meat, and flour, among others. 

She says that the previous loan had a great influence in her business, she increased the capacity of her income, her profits. Also, it helped her to have an optimistic point of view to keep working with the best wishes to exceed.

loans.use: to buy oil, onions, chili tomatoes, meat, and flour.

loans.name: Fidel Armando

texts.es: Fidel Armando, habita junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa de su propiedad. Él se dedica a la venta de sorbete. Es un hombre muy emprendedor y sobre todo trabajador. No deja pasar ninguna oportunidad de negocio. Lo más importante que realiza su trabajo con mucha dedicación y amor lo cual hace que las personas le tenga confianza y prefieren sus sorbetes cada día más. Es muy importante mencionar que esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que trabaja muy duro para poder seguir recibiendo los frutos que le ayuden a llevar el sustento a su hogar. Fidel tomo la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL ya que ha pensando en la forma de hacer crecer sus ingresos y es de esta forma que siempre les dará a sus clientes la calidad que ellos esperan. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en la compra de sorbete y de esta forma espera mejorar sus ganancias y poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Fidel Arauz lives with his life companion and son in the house he owns.  He sells ice-cream.  He’s an enterprising, above all, hardworking man.  He does not let any business opportunity pass him by.  What’s most important is that he does his work with much dedication and love which makes people trust him and prefer his ice-cream more every day.  It’s important to mention that this activity is his main source of income so he works very hard to continue earning profits to provide sustenance for his home.

Fidel make the decision to request a loan from Integral because he’s looking for a way to make his income grow and this way he will always provide his customers with the quality they expect.  He will use the requested loan to buy ice-cream hoping to improve his profits this way and to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream at wholesale.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu lives at West Point with her husband. She is 47 years old and has four children, between the ages of 2 and 28.

Her husband is a mechanic. Two of her children stay with her at home and are attending school, while the other two are grown up and are independent. 

She has been selling rice, pepper, onions,  vita, cooking oil and palm oil in the community market for the past eight years. She learned to sell from her aunt and she started this business with a little income that she received from her husband.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more vita, cooking oil, pepper, and rice to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, cooking oil, pepper, and rice to increase her sales.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia de 39 años, es una mujer laboriosa; esta casada con Juan de 42 años y fruto de ese amor tienen 03 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Teodosia, es una mujer muy activa; ella tiene dos negocios al cual se dedica hace 13 años.
Su labor principal es la venta de ropa, ubicada en un puesto del mercado de su localidad; su esposo le apoya con las ventas de equipos de sonido, estas se ubican en su propio domicilio. Teodosia, comenta que a inicios de empezar con esta actividad tuvo dificultades en sus ventas pero con el tiempo logró ganarse la confianza de sus clientes y ahora se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que tiene buenos ingresos sobre todo a finales del mes.
Con el préstamo obtenido realizará la compra de mercadería de ropa para incrementar en su puesto de ventas. Este es su crédito número 02; esta agradecida con los financieros quienes confían en su trabajo para que siga adelante con su negocio.
En su banco comunal, es una socia responsable y activa.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, se abastecerá de prendas de vestir para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
texts.en:
Teodosia, 39, is a hardworking woman who’s married to Juan, 42; they have three children she wants to provide better quality of life for.  Teodosia is a very active woman.  She has two businesses she’s worked at for 13 years.

Her main job is selling clothes in a stand in her local market.  Her husband helps her selling sound equipment from home.  Teodosia comments that it was difficult at first to start this sales activity but in time she managed to win over the trust of customers and now she feels very happy with the work she does since she earns good income especially at the end of the month.

With this loan she’ will buy clothing merchandise to increase her stock in her stand.  This is loan #2 and she’s grateful to lenders who trust her work so that she can continue getting ahead wither business.

She’s a responsible, active member of her communal bank.  She will use the 3,000 new soles to stock up on clothes for children, young adults and adults.

loans.use: to buy clothes for children, young adults and adults.

loans.name: Las Magníficas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MAGNÍFICAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ignacia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de jugo de quinua, tienda de cerrajería, venta de ropa, venta de corte de mantas, ayudante de minibús, albañil, elaboración de polleras, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ignacia es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugo de quinua, mismo que emprendió ayudando a su prima de quien aprendió la receta, posteriormente ella instalo su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de quinua) que comprará de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente a la preparación lo distribuirá en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tienen tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Las Magníficas” (The Magnificent Ones) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by the president, Ignacia.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: quinoa sales, locksmith shop, clothing sales, blanket fabric sales, microbus assistant, construction worker, shirt making and bookstore.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small businesswomen.  Ignacia is one of the members and she indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having done so by invitation of a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling quinoa juice that she started helping a cousin and learned the recipe from her and later on opened her own business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy quinoa from wholesalers and once she makes the juice will sell it in her stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the credit and the health services.

loans.use: to buy quinoa.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa, 30, lives in West Point with five children between the ages of 9 months and 15 years old. For years now she has been operating a restaurant in her community.

Massa received a little amount from her husband to start her business and learned from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Bonnie fish, spare rib, rice, charcoal and pig foot for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more Bonnie fish, spear rid, rice, charcoal and pig foot for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Gladys de 25 años; convive con Froi de 25 años; viven en su propia casa a base de madera, que compraron hace 03 años; en ella habitan con su pequeño hijo Daniel de 04 años, a quien desean ofrecer un buen futuro. Gladys y su pareja, se dedican al cultivo de plantas de café; esta actividad lo realizan hace 07 años en su propio campo de cultivo que tuvo por herencia de su familia. 
En los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, siendo así logran terminar la cosecha que luego es llevado a comercializar a los centros de acopio ubicadas a una hora de su comunidad, es ahí donde son bien remuneradas los sacos de cosecha que vende. Sin embargo le cuesta mucho el tener que llevarlas, ya que no transita muchos vehículos por su comunidad y  su pareja tiene que cargar hasta cierto tramo, pero aun así no le impide seguir con su trabajo; por ello siempre cuenta con el apoyo de los financieros , quienes facilitan a su apoyo para que sigan adelante con su trabajo. Este es su crédito número 03; una vez más se siente agradecida con el préstamo brindado y asegura ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal, es una socia participativa y responsable.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de abono para mantener bien purificadas sus plantas.
texts.en:
Gladys is 25 years old and lives with Froi, also 25, in their own home, which is built with wood. They purchased it three years ago and live there with their little son Daniel, who is four years old. They want to provide him with a good future. Gladys and her partner work growing coffee plants. They have been farming their own land for seven years and inherited the plots from family.
 
During the harvest season she gets help from laborers so that they can finish harvesting. They later take the product to the distribution centers for sale, which are located one hour away from the community where she lives. She is well compensated for the sacks of coffee she sells there. However, transporting them is very hard for her, since there aren't very many vehicles in transit in her community and her partner has to carry them up to a certain point, but even that doesn't prevent her from continuing with her work. That is why she always has the financers' support. They give her help so that she can keep her business going.

This is her third loan. Once again, she is grateful for the loan offered and assures that she will make her payments on time. She is an active and responsible member of her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer so that she can maintain her plants properly purified.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Torre De Fuego Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TORRE FUERTE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Patricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de batidos y jugos, internet, atención de duchas, venta de comida, venta de plásticos, venta de materiales de ferretería, venta de carne por mayor, venta de licores.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Patricia es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la necesidad de tener un apoyo económico. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de internet, mismo que emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tonner) que comprará de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente lo distribuirá en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tienen dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud porque les ayuda a comprender y  conocer mas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Torre Fuerte" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Santiago II regional office. It is made up of eight members and is lead by a board of directors in which Patricia is the President. The businesses that the members of this communal bank carry out are several. Among them we have the sale of shakes and juices, internet, bathroom attendants, food sales, plastics sales, hardware sales, wholesale meat sales and liquor sales. 

The loan that is to be taken out will benefit the small business owners in which Patricia is a member. She indicates that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer, entering due to her need for economic support. Currently she has an internet service business which she learned through her own initiative several years ago. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying toner) that she will buy from wholesale dealers and then distribute in her business locale. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family. She lives with her partner and they have two children. 

When she is asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan and health training because they help her to understand and know more.

loans.use: to buy toner.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 35 year-old Salamatu. She is married, and has two children aged nine and two years. She has one additional dependent niece who lives with her. In 2008, Salamatu established her rice and provision business. She began her business to help assist her husband to solve some domestic problems. Working six days-a-week and 10 hours per day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy 20 bags of rice and will use the remaining balance for transportation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to assist her husband to complete their own house so that she can transfer there to reduce the cost of renting, which can help her to increase her revenue. She is honest and hardworking and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of rice and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: This is 38 year-old Abdul. He is married, and has two children aged eight and four years. He has no additional dependents. In 2008, Adbul established his computer and computer accessories business. He began his business after completing his diploma course in computer hardware and installation. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Adbul has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy computer and accessories worth Le 6,000,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 1,000,000. In the future, Adbul plans to open a computer school. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy computer and accessories.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, es un hombre trabajador, tiene 48 años de edad; es soltero y vive en su propia casa, inmueble que le dejó sus padres como herencia. Durante 20 años, Víctor, se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar variedades de plantas de la zona; pero para él las plantas de cacao y café eran rentables en su venta. En tiempos de cosecha siempre cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, quienes le ayudan a extraer los frutos de manara ágil; después son comercializados en los centro de acopio, quienes le gratifican a buenos precios por la buena calidad de sus granos de café y cacao. Comenta que para tener la mejor calidad tiene que estar constantemente sacando la hierba mala y fumigando sus plantas. Para ello necesita el apoyo de económico, ya que con el préstamo que obtuvo realizará el mantenimiento de sus plantas (desyerbar y fumigar). Este es su crédito número 01 y se siente orgulloso por el apoyo que le brindan los financieros; asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de trabajar con socios responsables y promete ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago, porque siendo así podrá acceder a otro crédito. 
Con el préstamo que obtuvo realizará la compra de funguicidas para cuidar sus plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Victor’s a hardworking, 48-year-old man.  He’s single living in his own house that was passed down to him from his parents as an inheritance.  For twenty years Victor has worked in agriculture.  His parents taught him how to grow a variety of local plants but his most profitable crops are cocoa beans and coffee.  

During harvest he always hires day laborers to help extract the beans with agility; they are then sold in the gathering centers that pay good prices for the good quality cocoa beans and coffee beans he produces.  He comments that in order to produce good quality he must constantly be removing weeds and fumigating his plants.  To do so, he needs economic support since the loan he got will help him do the crop maintenance (weeding and fumigating).  

This is his first loan and he feels proud of the support lenders are giving him.  He also thanks his communal bank for giving him the opportunity to work with responsible members; he promises to be punctual with his installment payments because this way he will be able to access another loan.  He used the loan he got to buy fungicide to care for his cocoa bean and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy funcigide.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia posee un negocio de venta de agua, gaseosas, jugos y frutas   ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace 15  años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, tiene dos hijos menores que están bajo su responsabilidad. Sale de su casa de habitación a las 6:30 am  abre su negocio a las 7:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 5:00pm, este trabajo  lo realiza  de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario,  Su negocio lo inicio de forma ambulante,  el capital con  que inicio fue producto de sus ahorro.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar variedad de gaseosas, jugos, y frutas y ofertarles a sus clientes que viajan a los diferentes municipios de la ciudad de León, así obteniendo mayores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida tanto de ella como la de sus dos hijos de 18 y 14 años de edad. 

Los sueños de la Joven María Eugenia  es que sus hijos logren a coronar una carrera profesional y tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en: Maria Eugenia has a business selling water, soda, juice and fruit located in one of the markets in the city of Leon.  She has been doing this work for 15 years in order to provide for her family.  She has two minor children for whom she is responsible.  She leaves the house at 6:30 am, opens her business at 7:00 am and finishes work at 5:00 pm.  She does this work from Monday to Saturday, on the same schedule.  She began the business as a mobile street vendor, with money from her own savings.  The loan that she is requesting through CEPRODEL is to buy soda, juice and fruit to sell to her customers who travel to the different municipalities in the city of Leon, and thereby earn more income and improve the standard of living for herself and her two children, who are 18 and 14 years old.  Maria Eugenia's dreams are that her children will achieve professional careers and have their own homes.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice and fruit.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida de 37 años, es madre soltera de 01 hijo, a quien le dedica todo sus esfuerzos; juntos viven en la casa que Zenaida compró gracias a su trabajo de cada día. Zenaida, se dedica a la venta de frutas; su puesto se ubica en el ovalo de su Distrito, donde transitan los transportistas y sobre todo la gente que viaja de un lugar a otro. Esta labor lleva realizando hace más de  05 años y comenta que en esta actividad tiene competencia, pero ella dice que gracias a la manera de convencer a la gente para que le compren las frutas que vende en cajones de madera; logra vender mayor cantidad. Para ella su trabajo es muy fácil y le gusta hacer, pero su dificultad es tener que poner las frutas en cajones y a veces no cuenta con ello; es por eso que siempre cuenta con el apoyo de los financieros, quienes gracias al préstamo que le facilitan, pues ella continua con su trabajo.
Con el préstamo que obtuvo realizará la compra de de una carpa para que el calor no afecte a sus frutas; asimismo comprará cajones para poner sus frutas. Este es su crédito número 04; una vez más se siente agradecida con el préstamo que le brindan, ya que gracias a ello seguirá con su negocio. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por la responsabilidad que tienen sus socios. 
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, hará la compra de una carpa y cajones para frutas.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 37, is a single mother of a son who she focuses all her efforts on.  They live together in a house Zenaida bought thanks to her daily work.  She sells fruit.  Her stand is located in her district’s oval which is where transportation providers and people traveling to other places congregate.  She’s been doing this work for more than five years and comments that there is competition in this line of work but she says that thanks to her skill in convincing people to buy boxes of fruit from her she manages to sell large amounts.  Her work is very easy for her and she likes doing it but her difficulty is having to place the fruit in boxes and sometimes she does not have any which is why she counts on support from lenders who make it possible for her to stay in business thanks to their loans.

With the loan she got she will buy a tent so that the heat won’t affect her fruit and she will also buy boxes to put her fruit in.  This is her 4th loan and once again she feels grateful for the support provided because thanks to it she’ll stay in business.  She also thanks her communal bank for the responsibility of its members.  She will use the 2,000 new soles to buy a tent and boxes for the fruit.

loans.use: to buy a tent and boxes to pack fruit.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana de 33 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa, dedicada a sus 02 hijos; vive en su propia casa que compró gracias a su trabajo habitual. Ana, tiene un restaurante, en la que se dedica dí a día. Durante todas las mañanas empieza su labor, ya que prepara “desayuno, almuerzo y cena”, para sus comensales. Esta actividad lleva realizando hace más de 02 años y comenta que es rentable para su economía; ella cuenta con dos personales, uno quien le ayuda a preparar los deliciosos platos de comida y una señorita para que le ayude a atender a los comensales. 
Para su trabajo es lo que mas le gusta, ya que gracias a ello puede brindarles una buena estadía a sus hijos; comenta que desde que acude a los préstamos de MFP, ha logrado mejorar su restaurante; es por ello que ahora también accede a los créditos, para que siga implementando en su negocio. Este es su crédito número 04; una vez mas se siente agradecida a las personas quienes financian este préstamo, ya que así seguirá con su negocio; por otra parte le gusta trabajar con los socios de su banco comunal, porque son personas que exigen la responsabilidad a cada socio.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles más sus ganancias, implementará su restaurante, comprando mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
Ana, 33, is an enterprising woman devoted to her two children.  She lives in her own house she bought thanks to her daily work.  Ana has a restaurant she spends all day in.  She starts her work in the morning because she makes breakfast, lunch and dinner for her diners.  She’s been in business for more than two years and comments that it’s profitable.  She has two staff members, one who helps her cook the delicious meals and a young lady who helps wait on customers.

Her work is what she likes best because thanks to it she can provide wellbeing for her children.  She comments that since she’s been calling on MFP loans she’s managed to improve the restaurant which is why she calls on loans to continue equipping her business.

This is her 4th loan and once again is grateful to the people who finance it because she will be able to stay in business thanks to it.  On the other hand, she enjoys working with her fellow communal bank members because they are people who insist on responsibility from each and every member.  She will use the 2,000 new soles plus her profits to equip her restaurant buying tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 55 years old. She is married to Odinga and together they have six children. She sells fish and has been in the business for the past 20 years.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase more fish for her business. She paid back her previous loan on time.

She hopes to purchase a lorry to aid in transportation.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Nueva Esperanza cuenta con 10 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias.
Mirian es una de estas mujeres, ella es vendedora del mercado municipal, ella comenta que con mucho sacrificio esta saliendo adelante, ella quiere superar los obstáculos de la pobreza y darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras, las cuales venderá y de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante, así como lo ha hecho hasta hoy. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus amigas reciben de fundación paraguaya y Kiva.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) is made up of 10 members. Each one of them is completely devoted to a small business activity, regardless of its size. These women are very excited. They permanently support each other and this inspires them to keep on struggling for their families. 
Mirian is one of these women. She has a stand at the city's market. She says that she is moving forward with much sacrifice. 
Mirian wants to overcome the obstacles of poverty and provide her family with everything they need. She is requesting this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables which she will later resell in order to keep on working and moving forward, just as she has done until this day. She is grateful for the opportunity that Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva are offering her and her friends.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia de 64 años de edad, es una mujer humilde; esta casada con  Maurino de 61 años y juntos habitan en su propia casa que compraron hace 30 años de casados; tienen 02 hijos a quienes apoya económicamente para que salgan adelante y tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Mauricia, es una mujer laboriosa; ella y su esposo se dedican a la carpintería; esta actividad lo efectúa hace más de 12 años, ya que su esposo tiene conocimiento sobre la elaboración de todo tipo de muebles (sillas, roperos, estantes, etc.); lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es entregar sus pedidos de manera responsable y que la gente admire su labor.
Este trabajo le es muy rentable, ya que siempre tiene pedidos por realizar; es por ello que siempre cuenta con los préstamos que MFP le brinda y gracias a los financieros quienes confían en su trabajo, pueden continuar con su negocio gracias a los préstamos que obtienen. Este es su crédito número 08; una vez mas agradece por la confianza de su trabajo; asimismo agradece a los socios de su banco comunal, por apoyarles a que siga continuando con su trabajo.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, realizará la compra de madera para que realizar sus muebles.
texts.en:
Mauricia, 64, is a humble woman married to Maurino, 61.  They live in their own house they bought; they have been married 30 years.  They have two children she supports so that they can get ahead and have a better quality of life.

Mauricia is a hardworking woman.  She and her husband work in carpentry, an activity they’ve been doing for more than 12 years since her husband knew how to make all types of furniture (chairs, armoires, shelving, etc.)  What she likes best about her work is to fill her orders responsibly and that people admire her work.

This work is very profitable because she always has pending orders to fill which is why she always counts on the loans MFP grants her and thanks to lenders who trust in her work they can stay in business thanks to the loan they get.  

This is her 8th loan and once again she’s grateful for the trust placed in her work.  She also thanks the members of her communal bank for supporting them to stay in business.  She will use the 2,000 new soles to buy lumber to make furniture.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Leyda María

texts.es:
La Joven Leyda María  trabaja  en un colegio de la Ciudad de León desempeñando el cargo de docente  Leyla María sale de su casa de habitación 6:30 inicia sus labores 6:45 am  finalizando  a las 12:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes,   Por la tarde  dedica dos hora para la planificación de la clase del día siguiente,  Leyda María es  madre de dos  hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad. 

Leyda  solicita un crédito a Ceprodel  el que  utilizara  para compra de uniforme de su hija que participara en el desfile  de la fiesta patria como integrante de la comparsa rítmica del colegio en que estudia  y uniforme de su Hijo varón que también participara en el desfile.
texts.en:
Leyda María is a young woman who works as a teacher in a school in the city of León.  Monday through Friday she has the same schedule: she leaves her house at 6:30 a.m., starts work at 6:45, and finishes at 12 noon.  In the afternoon she spends two hours planning the next day's lesson.  Leyda María is the mother of two children, ages 7 and 5.

Leyda is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to buy her daughter a uniform to participate in the holiday parade as a member of her school's rhythmic group and a uniform for her son, who also will participate in the parade.

loans.use: to buy uniforms for the holiday parade

loans.name: Xinia

texts.es: Xinia, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo  y sus hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar materia prima para la fabricación de cosméticos que ella elabora para su posterior venta. Actualmente ella trabaja con unas más compañeras más en común. Ella actualmente está generando productos para una empresa que les está comprando sus producciones para comercializarlas en zonas más urbanas y de mayor mercado. Por eso es que ella necesita del crédito para comprar más productos naturales para elaborar más cosméticos y aumentar la cantidad de producción de lo normal que se produce y abastecer al mercado comprante de sus productos de belleza. Ella quiere poder entrar en este mercado y fortalecer sus ingresos con las ganancias generadas por el aumento de los cosméticos y así poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor bienestar familiar, al igual con las ganancias poder ir saliendo con los pagos de su crédito que solicita y a la vez agradecer por apoyarla en su proyecto de vida.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Xinia is 46 years old, is married and lives with her husband and children, who are her top priority. With the loan, she expects to buy raw materials for the manufacture of cosmetics she prepares for resale. Currently, she works with some other partners. 

She is currently producing products for a company that buys her products to sell in urban areas and larger markets. That's why she needs the loan, to buy more natural products to elaborate more cosmetics and increase the amount of production. She wants to produce more than normal and supply the buying market with her beauty products. 

She wants to enter this market and strengthen her income with the profits generated by the increase of cosmetics. Doing so, she wants to give a better quality of life and a better family welfare to her children. Also, she expects to meet the payments of the loan with the profits, and at the same time, be grateful for the support to her life project.

It's the first loan she receives from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had any other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR gave her the loan with better facilities and an interest rate much lower.

loans.use: to buy materials to manufacture cosmetics

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Kadiatu from Moriba in  the southern area of Bo. She is married with five children between the ages of seven and 23. Her children are currently attending school. In 2002, Kadiatu opened her store. She started her business when two of her children entered secondary school and she found cost of education expensive. So she decided to start the business to raise money to help her husband support their family. She works at the business every day, six days per week. Kadiatu and her family live in the shop.  She describes her major problem as the cost of customs tax and transportation.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more body cream, televisions, musical sets and perfume. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and pay her loan installments. In the future, Kadiatu plans to build a big house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more body cream, televisions, musical sets and perfume.

loans.name: Amenah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Amenah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus the above photo is of her husband.
Amenah is a 46-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi - Amman in Jordan. She has two children and has requested a 500 JOD loan to buy clothes, cosmetics and perfumes for resale. In the future she would like to open her own shop and buy a house.

loans.use: to buy several kinds of goods for resale.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 32-year-old woman, married to Peter and a mother of three lovely children. She buys and sells used clothes. She has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 shillings.

This will be Ann's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to buy more clothes for resale with the money she is earns. In the future she wants to be a successful businesswoman and be self-sustaining.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité  Virgen de Fátima, se conformo con la iniciativa de una de las miembros y actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con  10 integrantes.
Blanca es trabajadora y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de perfumes, cuenta que en su vida tuvo que pasar por muchas necesidades y es por ello que se esfuerza, ya que no quiere que su familia pase por lo mismo. Su sueño es tener todo lo que ellos necesiten y de esa forma puedan salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para poder surtirse con todo tipo de perfumes y así dar más variedad a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que ella y sus amigas reciben.
texts.en:
Communal bank Virgen de Fátima was born out of the initiative of one of its members and is currently in its first cycle. It is made up of 10 members.
Blanca is a hard worker who sells all kinds of perfumes. She says she'd faced many difficulties in life and now works hard because she doesn't want her family to live through the same. Her dream is to have everything her family needs so they can progress in life. 
Blanca is asking for this loan to buy all kinds of perfumes and offer a greater variety to her customers. She is grateful for this advancement opportunity granted to her and her friends.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes to sell

loans.name: Mariscal Intocables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARISCAL INTOCABLES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de salchipapas, venta de jugos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución quien fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, que emprendió ayudando a su mamá de quien aprendió la técnica de tejido y posteriormente ella inicio su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que comprará de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo distribuirá a pedido de las clientes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “MARISCAL INTOCABLES” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Santiago II. The group has eight members, and Juana is president of its board. The members have a variety of professions including managing a neighborhood store; weaving blankets; and selling food, vegetables, juices, and salchipapas [French fries with hot dogs].

This loan program helps micro businesses like the one Juana is a member of. She says this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, to which she was introduced by an institution representative who visited her home. She currently weaves blankets, which she learned by helping her mother. Later, Juana started her own business. 

The loan will provide increased capital to buy wool, which Juana will purchase from wholesalers. After weaving the wool, she will fill her customer orders. This work lets Juana earn income to help her family; she is married and has a son. She says she likes the training in credit and health issues she receives from Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando, de 48 años, es un hombre a quien siempre le gustó hacerle frente a las circunstancias que se le presentan, es así como pudo salir adelante junto a Patricia con quien tiene 4 hijos de 25, 20, 18 y 10 años de edad respectivamente. vive en su casa propia a lado de su pareja y sus dos últimos hijos en donde continúa esforzándose mucho pues desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Fernando, tiene como actividad principal la administración de un taller de mecánica en el que brinda todo tipo de servicios de reparaciones de motos, mototaxis, bicicletas, y otros vehículos. Su establecimiento esta ubicado en su casa y ahí trabaja por las tardes desde hace 5 años con ayuda de su sobrino quien se encarga de las labores técnicas. Por otra parte, trabaja en la compra y venta de madera desde hace 10 años, desempeña esta labor en las mañanas con la ayuda de 3 obreros, compra cada diez o quince días,  trabaja principalmente con madera de la especie “lupuna” la cual envía a otras ciudades por ser la más solicitada por sus clientes. Tiene también un mototaxi el cual conduce eventualmente por las calles de la ciudad para generar mayores ingresos económicos a su familia. Está muy contento porque ambas actividades le están dando buenos resultados gracias a la buena clientela que ha podido consolidar con el paso del tiempo, espera seguir trabajando como hasta ahora para que más adelante consiga establecer un taller de carpintería o de venta de maderas para la región. Este es el préstamo número 17 con MFP, por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que siguen confiando en él para acceder nuevamente a este financiamiento que le ayudará a aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que nuevamente tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual, está contento de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que sus integrantes son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, aumentará el capital que necesita para comprar mayor cantidad de madera, ya que su inversión quincenal puede bordear los 15000 soles.
texts.en:
Fernando, 48, is a man who has always liked to face circumstances that arise head-on.  This is how he was able to get ahead with his wife, Patricia, and their four children who are 25, 20, 18 and 10 years old respectively.   He lives in his own house with his spouse and his two youngest children.  He continues striving very much because he wants to give them a better quality of life.

Fernando’s main activity is managing a repair shop where he provides all kinds of repair services for motorcycles, mototaxis, bicycles and other vehicles.  His shop is located at home and he works there in the afternoon.  He’s been in business five years and his nephew helps him with the technical tasks.  On the other hand, he also works buying and selling lumber.  He’s been doing this for ten years and does this work in the morning with help from three laborers.  He buys every ten or fifteen days and works especially with lumber of the “lupuna” species that he ships to other cities where it’s in high demand.  He also owns a mototaxi that he drives occasionally through the city streets to generate more income for his family.  He is very happy because both activities are having good results thanks to the good clientele he’s managed to consolidate as time has gone by.  He hopes to continue working like he’s done to date so that later on he can open a carpentry shop or a regional lumber sales business.

This is MFP loan #17.  He thanks all those people who continue trusting in him so that he can access financing again that will help him increase his working capital.  He knows that he will have to be very responsible and above all punctual once more.  He’s happy to belong to his communal bank because he sees that all the members are very supportive.  He will use the requested 3,000 soles to increase capital to buy larger amounts of lumber; his bi-weekly expenditure can hover around 1,500 soles.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Claudia Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Claudia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Claudia va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Claudia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Claudia works selling cosmetics via catalogue.  She sells her products on foot, visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of La Paz, where she offers her products.  This is her first sequence with the institution.

Claudia is going to use the loan to buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale and on sale, to offer a variety of products to her customers and increase her earnings.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving in her business.

Claudia will use the profits to continue buying a variety of beauty products.  Claudia's a very hardworking person.  She's happy about the opportunity that's being offered.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Musyimi

texts.en:
Musyimi is 36 years old and married with two children, both of whom attend a local primary school. His wife is a Mwanamkasi, a businesswoman.

In order to get himself and his family ahead in life, Musyimi has a small store in his house where he sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, vegetables, greens, etc. His wife also works in the store. Musyimi has spent two years in this business--it is going very well.

This loan will help him to stock up his store. He is going to buy rice, sugar, and oil, among other basic products. His goals are to continue getting ahead in his business and to give the best to his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil, among other basic products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Mary has been working hard to manage her market stall, which sells g-nuts, chips and cassava. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator, and will help Mary to generate greater profits through increased inventory variety. This will help her to cover the basic needs of her family. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house and overcome the problem of renting. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Nadia prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. The above photo is of her husband. Nadia is a 41-year-old married woman who has three family members from Al Hashmi-Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 900 JD to buy food and clothes to resell. In the future she would like to increase her business by opening a shop and to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy food and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Asila

texts.en:
Asila is a 23-year-old single woman in the business of cosmetic sales. She started this business a year ago and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

She wants to purchase jewelry and cosmetics, and has requested a second loan of KES 40,000. She will use the profit to purchase additional stock for resale. 

Her dream is to see her business grow to greater levels.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Nadia prefers that her photo is not on the internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Nadia is a 29-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to do maintenance of the home and repaint her home. In the future, Nadia wants to expand her home. She also hopes for her sons to continue their education. Since Nadia is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetable for resale

loans.name: Jose Anastacio

texts.es: José Anastasio de  51 anos de edad, del departamento de Chinandega municipio Posoltega la cual esta ubicado en el occidente de país. Su gente se caracteriza por ser gente de pueblo donde su mayor actividad económica es la  crianza y venta de cerdos. José Anastasio es casado, con 6 hijos de 20, 18, 17, 15, 14,10 de los cuales  4 están bajo su responsabilidad porque estudian y son menores de edad. El negocio lo tiene ubicado de forma ambulante el cual cuenta con 25 anos de experiencia. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria por lo tanto ha tenido que luchar duro para que sus hijos tengan mejores  oportunidades de vida. La rutina diría de José Anastasio es levantarse todos los días a las 4: 00 am para emprender su viaje a las comarca aledañas y lejanas de su vivienda para comprar cerdos en pie  y revenderlos estos en pie también a personas que destazan para vender la carne. Actividad que la realiza en un carretón jalado por caballos de su propiedad en el que se desplaza y a la vez en el mismo carretón trasladan a los cerdos. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en la comprar de cerdos para  poder ofrecer a sus clientes fijos y eventuales.  José Anastasio agradece a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda  y oportunidad que les brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y  países pobres como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de vida digno. Y de dicha forma erradicar un poco la pobreza en nuestro país.
texts.en:
José Anastasio is 51 years old.  He comes from Chinandega, in the municipality of Posoltega, which is located in the western part of the country.  The people there are village people whose main economic activity is the raising and selling of hogs.  José Anastasio is married, with six children aged 20, 18, 17, 15, 14 and 10.  Four of his children are dependents, as they are students and still minors.

His business, which he has been running for 25 years, is itinerant.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, he was not able to pursue a university education and has therefore had to fight hard for his children to have better opportunities.

José Anastasio's routine is to get up at 4:00am every day to begin his journey to regions that are both nearby and far away to buy live hogs and resell them to butchers who will then sell the meat.  He goes about this activity using a wagon pulled by horses, which he owns.  He travels in the same wagon with the hogs.

He needs the financing in order to invest in the purchase of hogs to offer his established and new customers.  José Anastasio is grateful to the Kiva investors for their help and opportunities for a dignified life that they offer the small vendors with few resources living in poor countries like Nicaragua.  In this way, they are helping to eradicate some of the poverty of our country.

loans.use:
para invertir en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie
to invest in the purchase and sale of live hogs.

loans.name: Ivania Veronica

texts.es: Ivania Verónica de 46 anos de edad del departamento de Chinandega, casada, con dos hijos, de  15, 11 anos de edad los cuales están bajo su cargo, además estudian en primaria y secundaria respetivamente. Ivania Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, ella ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 la cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad y solvencia de pago, Ivania se desempeña como maestra de un colegio de su localidad, ya que para ella es un gusto y satisfacción  poder trabajar con niños y transmitirle los conocimientos adquiridos en le transcurso de su desempeño como maestra, para formas personas de bien y que en un futuro sean el porvenir de Nicaragua. Un país con tantas limitantes para los jóvenes. El financiamiento lo necesita para construir un cuarto a la vivienda, ya que en la actualidad todos duermen en la misma habitación  y no tienen ninguna privacidad, incluso su hija la mayor esta señorita y necesita tener mas espacio, y brindarles mejores  condiciones a sus hijos. Dichas mejoras la ha necesitado realizar desde hace 2 anos las cuales por falta de ingresos suficientes no las ha realizado esta inversión .Por lo tanto acudió al financiamiento para realizar dicha mejoras. El material que necesita comprar para la construcción es lo siguiente zinc, cemento, arena, hierro, cal, calvos, bloques, madera.
texts.en:
Ivania Verónica, 46, is from Chinandega Department.  She’s married and has two children who are 15 and 11 years old and are in her care.  They attend elementary and secondary school.  

Ivania Verónica is a very hardworking, responsible person who has worked with Fundación León 2000 and has shown responsibility and payment solvency.  Ivania works as a teacher in a local school.  For her, it’s a joy and a satisfaction to work with children and pass on the knowledge she’s acquired during her career as a teacher to form upstanding citizens who will become the future of Nicaragua, a country with so many obstacles for young people.

She needs the financing to add a room at home since everyone currently sleeps in the same room and have no privacy.  In fact, her oldest daughter is a young woman now needing her own space and Ivania must provide better living conditions for her children.

These home improvements have been needed for the last two years but she’s been unable to do them for lack of funds which is why she called on a loan to do them.  She needs to buy building materials and supplies like metal sheeting, cement, sand, rebar, lime powder, nails, concrete blocks and lumber.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, metal sheeting and sand.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town Southern area in Bo. She is married with 2 children, ages 20 and 23. Her husband is a teacher; his income is not enough to support the home.

Fatmata runs a general store, selling gari, palm oil, and fruit. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business 11 hours a day, 7 days per week. She also earns income from renting out a house. Her business growth has improved, but the challenge of a poor road network remains.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more goods like gari, palm oil, and fruit to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of the home and pay her installment. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more goods like gari, palm oil, and fruit to sell

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 32 years old and married to Anne. He sells clothes--a business he started eight years ago--and earns a monthly income of KES 50,000.

He has requested a second loan of KES 40,000 to purchase more bales of clothes for sale. The profit will help him improve his living standards. His dream is to see this business expand.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 56 years old. She is a widow and a mother of one child. She operates a grocery shop in Kiambu and has been in this business for 4 years now. She gets a monthly income of 9,000 KES.

This will be Jane’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and other vegetables for resale. She says she will use the profit to add more stock for her business. 

In the future, Jane wants to fully provide for her child and also become self-sustainable.

loans.use: To buy vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, etc. for resale

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is from Tkibuli district of West Georgia. She is 65 years old and lives with her husband Zauri, daughter, son-in-law and grandson. Makvala and Zauri are provided with a retirement pension. Her daughter works as a cook in the restaurant and gets a monthly income. The family runs a small dairy business; they have 3 milk cows and 2 calves. Makvala milks the cows and produces cheese products. She also has a vineyard and picks the grapes in the late summer. The family sells their agricultural products at the local market. Makvala works hard to make some savings and improve their living conditions.

Makvala requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is old and damaged. She will purchase building materials and renovate her house. Then the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard-working day in a more comfortable environment. Makvala hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 5 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her small business, which tailors all types of clothes and other materials. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a new sewing machine and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah, 42, resides with her husband in Kakata. She has five children that are between the ages of 8 and 26. All of her children do not live with her, as they stay with their aunt and other relatives. They are all in school; the oldest child is a college student. She has been selling rice, onions, tomatoes, sardines, cooking oil, dish soap, bath soap, and other items for the past ten years.  With the initial capital from her husband, she started this business. She loves to run her business, because she interacts with people every day and makes a profit from what she sells. With the profit, she will buy more goods and improve her business and her life. She has requested this loan to purchase more rice, cooking oil, dish soap, bath soap, and onions for her business. She plans to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, cooking oil, dish soap, bath soap, and onions for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay those who work for him in his rice cultivating business.

loans.name: Unión De Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN DE AMIGA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de tucumanas, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, salón de belleza, venta de conservas, venta e libros, venta de electrodomésticos, ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rina es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución quien fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de ferretería, que emprendió hace años con la compra de materiales de construcción.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pinturas) que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo distribuirá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora María pues fue a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “Unión de Amigas” (Unity of Girlfriends) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board whose president is Rina.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which are the sale of ‘tucumanas’ [turnovers], clothing sales, cosmetics sales, beauty salon, canned goods sales, book sales, home appliance sales and hardware sales.

They will take out the loan to benefit small businesswomen.  Rina’s one of them and she indicates that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a hardware store she opened years ago with the purchase of construction materials.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy paint from suppliers and then resell in her shop.  This way of working allows her to support her family since she’s married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the credit training and the health services.  

(María does not appear in the photo because she was at a clinic appointment.)

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Lilliam Maria

texts.es: Lilliam María  de 29 anos de edad, madre  soltera con una hija de 12 anos bajo su responsabilidad, Lilliam pertenece al municipio de chichigalpa, el cual esta ubicado en el occidente del país, un chichigalpa es un municipio muy bonito, con gente acogedora, servicial, esta rodeado de volcanes, naturaleza pura, y muy productivo en cana de azúcar. Lilliam tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, tiene tres anos de experiencia en el negocio, el cual distribuye de forma ambulante, y da servicio de lavado y planchado a domicilio. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio para vivir y poder mantener a su pequeña ya que es  madre soltera. Esta iniciativa de trabajo la inicio con los créditos que fundación le brindaba  y comenzó a invertir en venta de ropa y poco a poco fue ganando clientela, debido a su esfuerzo, tenacidad, responsabilidad. La rutina diaria de Lilliam es de 10 horas diarias día a día, ella se levanta temprano todos los días,  y carga su mercadería  en bolsos la cual distribuye de forma ambulante a clientes fijos y eventuales, su rutina es dura bajo el intenso sol el pesos de los bolsos con la mercadería, pero eso no le impide seguir trabajando porque quiere logara su sueños  mas anhelado como es formar profesionalmente a su pequeña hija. Motivo por el cual agrade a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que les prestan a personas de escasos recursos y de países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Lilliam María, 29, is a single mother who takes care of her 12-year-old daughter. Lilliam lives in the city of Chichigalpa, located in the western part of the country. Chichigalpa is very beautiful, and its people are warm and accommodating. The city is surrounded by volcanos and natural beauty, and the area produces a lot of sugar cane. Lilliam has three years of experience selling general merchandise as a street vendor and offering in-home laundry and ironing service. She started the business because she needed to make a living and support her daughter, as she is a single mother. She began buying clothing to resell and slowly built a client base through much effort and tenacity. 

Lillian's workday lasts 10 hours. She gets up early every morning to fill the bags of merchandise she will deliver on foot to regular and potential customers. Her routine is hard, given the intensity of the sun and the weight of her bags of merchandise, but that doesn't keep her from working because she wants to achieve her dreams. What she wishes for most is to see her daughter pursue a profession. She thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they offer low-income people to have a decent life in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing for adults and children.

loans.name: Oseas Neftali

texts.es:
Oseas, está solicitando otro crédito porque necesita invertir en su negocio en ampliación de ventas y aumentar la compra de materia prima, algunos de los productos que necesita comprar son: manteca, huevos,  azúcar, aceite, leña y una licuadora.
El primer crédito que se le extendió, tuvo un efecto muy grande en su pequeña empresa, por le permitió mantener su clientela y  logro tener una mejor rentabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en: Oseas is seeking another loan because he needs to invest in his bakery and increase his sales.  He needs to purchase more raw materials such as butter, eggs, sugar, oil, firewood and a blender.  His first loan had a very positive effect on his small business.  It enabled him to keep his customers satisfied and achieve more profitability.

loans.use: to buy butter, eggs, sugar, oil, firewood and a blender.

loans.name: Dushyigikirane/ Nykby Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Protogène est le membre et le président du groupe Dushyikirane / Nykby. Le nom du groupe signifie «Supportons-nous ».Il à 37 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 3 an à 14 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Protogène est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Protogène is a member and the leader of the Dushyikirane / Nykby group.  The name of the group means, “Let's help each other.”  He is 37 and married with four children between the ages of 3 and 14  years, three of whom attend school.  He has had six years of primary school.

Mr. Protogène grows rice.  This is his first loan through ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

In order to grow his business, he plans to request other loans  for increasing  his rice growing capacity.  In the years to come, he would like to be the biggest rice cultivator in the region.  With his profits, he foresees being able to pay for his children’s education and health care.

loans.use: He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz es una señora de 49 años, que se describe como una persona emprendedora, felíz, trabajadora y muy responsable. Luz vive con sus tres hijos en Ibarra.

Luz trabaja en un puesto de venta de productos de herbalife, también utiliza estos productos para preparar batidos para los clientes y de esta manera obtener ingresos económicos, Luz se ha dedicado en este negocio por 12 años, actualmente Luz necesita incrementar su negocio debido a que tiene la necesidad de comprar constantemente productos para que su negocio siga prosperando es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi con el objetivo de invertir en la compra de productos de herbalife como batidos f1, té, aloe, calcio, necesita comprar 15 frascos de cada uno.

Luz sueña en que su negocio crezca y que en un futuro sea un negocio de venta de medicina natural y obtener buenos ingresos con los cuales quiere construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Luz, 49, describes herself as an enterprising, happy, hardworking and very responsible woman.  She lives with her three children in Ibarra.

Luz works in a stand selling Herbalife products.  She also uses these products to make blended drinks for customers as a way of earning income.  Luz has been in this business for 12 years.  She now needs to increase business because she constantly must buy products so that her business will continue making progress and this is why she’s asking Fodemi for a loan to buy Herbalife products like F1 mix, tea, aloe, calcium; she needs to buy 15 jars of each.

Luz dreams with her business growing and that in the future it becomes a business selling natural remedies and to earn good income with which she wants to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building the wall.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
María, vive en casa propia, tiene treinta años de edad, está acompañada no tiene hijos, trabaja cultivando maíz  para obtener ingresos y poder mantenerse; Tiene  dos años de trabajar lo aprendió desde pequeña.
Esta solicitando un crédito, para comprar insumos para la cosecha,  compra de tres sacos de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y para el pago de mano de obra, ademas la compra de semilla para la producción.
Seguidamente sacar esa cosecha a la venta para obtener ganancias y que sus ingresos puedan cubrir las necesidades del hogar
texts.en:
María is a 30-year-old woman lives in her own home with her common-law husband.  They currently do not have children.  She grows corn in order to make income and support herself.  She has been working as a farmer for two years and learned this discipline when she was a child.

She is seeking a loan in order to purchase farming supplies.  She will buy three sacks of fertilizer, as well as herbicides and insecticides and seed corn.  She will also use the funds to pay laborers.

Following the harvest, she will sell the corn in order to make income so that she will be able to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides, as well as to pay laborers.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, tiene treinta y siete años de edad, está casado, tiene una hija de tres años, viven en casa propia, él se dedica a la panadería en la reventa de pan ha tomado la decisión de continuar trabajando; pero necesita financiamiento, por lo que nos solicito un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería tal como: pan dulce y pan francés.
Este crédito le ayudara a incrementar el inventario y su atencion a la clientela, tambien tendrá más ingresos y le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio; sus sueños es incrementar las ganancias y estar mejor económicamente, darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 37 years old, married, and has a three-year-old daughter. They live in their own home and he works reselling baked goods. He has made the decision to continue working but needs financing, which is why he has requested a loan to invest in purchasing merchandise such as pastries and French bread.

This loan will help him increase inventory and improve the service he gives his customers. He will also have more income and this will help him strengthen his business. His dreams are to increase profit and achieve a better financial situation so that he can give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale pastries and French bread.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: La Sra. Marcelina  tiene 35 años y es casada tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 8, 4 y 2 años, se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de comida ella vende chicharrón de pollo en su puesto de venta que  se encuentra ubicado en la zona Primero de Mayo, le va muy bien con esta actividad ya que su negocio se encuentra en un lugar estratégico, este préstamo es el primero que tiene dentro de la institución, la Sra. Marcelina  vive en la localidad de Sacaba donde escasea el agua la mayor parte del tiempo se compra agua de las cisternas que ofrecen agua por cada zona a un precio módico, por este motivo el solicito este préstamo para la construcción de un tanque de agua para poder tener reserva de agua ya que una de las principales acciones para la construcción de un Tanque de agua es para almacenar y distribuir el agua, construcción de cañerías que lleva el agua hasta las distintas dependencia como el baño, ducha y cocina y esto es de mucha utilidad ya que las cisternas van una vez a la semana y muchas veces su familia se queda sin agua y este liquido elemento es imprescindible en cada hogar y con la construcción de este tanque de agua la Sra. Marcelina mejorara de gran manera su calidad de vida, por este motivo se siente agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 35, is married and has three children who are 8, 4, and 2 years of age.  She works making food to sell; she sells fried chicken in a stand located in the Primero de Mayo neighborhood.  She does very well with this activity since her business is in a strategic location.  This will be her first loan with the institution.

Marcelina lives in Sacaba where water is scarce most of the time.  Water must be purchased at moderate prices from tank trucks that come by the various neighborhoods.  Because of this, she requests a loan to install a water tank to be able to have water in storage since one of the main reasons for installing a water tank is to have water available in storage and then to install piping to bring water to the various spots where it’s needed like the toilet, shower and kitchen.  This is very useful because the tank trucks come by only once a week and sometimes her family is left without this liquid which is essential in every home.  By installing the tank, Marcelina will greatly improve her quality of life and this is why she’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s being given.

loans.use: to install a water tank.

loans.name: Impuzamugambi / Gkndmvr Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Augustin est le membre et le président du groupe Impuzamugambi. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les membres qui ont le même objectif ».Il à 42 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 3 ans à 21 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Augustin est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Augustin is a member and the leader of the Impuzamugambi group.  The name of the group means, “Members who have the same goal.”  He is 42 and married with six children between the ages of 3 and 21 years, five of whom attend school.   He has had six years of primary school.

Augustin grows rice.  This is his first loan through ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

In order to grow his business, he plans to request other loans for increasing  his rice growing capacity.  In the years to come, he would like to be the biggest rice cultivator in the region.  With his profits, he foresees being able to pay for his children’s education and health care.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Carla Adriana

texts.es: La Sra. Carla  tiene 35 años tiene dos hijos que tienen la edad de 17 y 15 años, ella se dedica a la confección y bordado a mano de manteles, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Villa Cotapachi, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Carla  utilizara este préstamo para el mantenimiento y compra de un motor para su vehículo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital ya que este vehículo le ayuda a transportar su mercadería de trabajo, la Sra. Carla enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas, la Sra. Carla se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carla, 35, has two children who are 17 and 15 years old.  She makes and hand embroiders tablecloths.
